This will be her first loan through MFP and she promises to make all of her payments on time, so that she can continue to move ahead. She is happy with her communal bank’s organization because it is made up of responsible people. Yanina plans to invest the money from this loan into large quantities of merchandise so that she can offer a larger variety to her customers. In this way she hopes to increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Adjowa Atche N.

texts.en: Adjowa A. lives in Lome, Togo and sells charcoal and millet grain from her home. She has been working in this activity since 2005. Normally, Madame A. purchases her products further north in Togo, and this time she has requested a loan of 200,000 CFA in order to assist her purchases and augment her stock of millet and charcoal. Madame A. has one child.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and millet.

loans.name: Awaou

texts.en: Madame Awaou I. is 39 years old and works selling charcoal and firewood from her home in Lome, Togo. She's been engaged in this activity since 2002. She is 39 years old, married to a chauffeur, and they have 2 children. Madame I. has requested a loan of 500,000 CFA in order to purchase more charcoal and firewood. This is her first time taking a loan from WAGES. The profits she earns from her sales will allow her to better care for her children and her family.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Amilcar

texts.es: Amílcar, de 26 años, vive en compañía de su padre Lorenzo de 78 años, en casa de él, juntos habitan en un paraje de la serranía peruana. Este joven trabajador se dedica a las labores agrícolas, pues desde que era muy pequeño aprendió las técnicas necesarias para obtener una productiva cosecha. Siembra papa y arveja y dice que la labor debe ser constante, por eso desde muy temprano trabaja en el campo junto a su padre, quien lo asesora de la técnicas agrícolas. Amílcar heredó la responsabilidad y empeño de su progenitor, pues trabaja sin descanso para que su producción sea muy fructífera, y esta satisfecho porque la recompensa a todo su esfuerzo es la ganancia de la comercialización de sus cosechas. Bajo el cielo azul de la sierra del Perú, Amílcar busca salir adelante, y ya tiene planeado para el futuro sembrar en mayor cantidad, pues quiere obtener mejores ganancias. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además dice que la labor que desempeña su grupo comunal es muy honrada pues todos los integrantes son muy responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de semilla de arveja y abono que necesita para la próxima siembra, además dice que les pagará a sus trabajadores para que le ayuden a sembrar y cosechar.
texts.en:
Amílcar is 26 years old and lives with his father, 78 year old Lorenzo, in a spot of the Peruvian mountain range. This hard working young man has been farming since he was very young. It was then that he learned the techniques needed to have a good harvest. He raises potatoes and peas and says that the work should be continuous, so he and his father, who advises him on farming techniques, begin working very early in the morning. Amílcar inherited his sense of responsibility and commitment from his father. He works without rest so that his production will be very fruitful and he is satisfied because his reward is the income from the sale of his harvest. Under the beautiful blue Peruvian mountain sky Amílcar looks for ways to get ahead. He plans to increase his planting in order to increase his income. This will be his seventh loan through MFP and he is very grateful to those who have made this loan possible. It will allow him to continue working. He also says that the work that his communal group does is honest and all of the members are very responsible. He will use the money from this loan to buy sacs of pea seeds and fertilizer for his next planting. He will also pay the laborers who help him with the planting and harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Dahona

texts.en: Madame Dahona O. B. is 33 years old and is the proprietor of a general store in Lome, Togo. She sells grocery products like oil, rice, sugar, canned goods, and other items out of her home in the Agoe Quartier of Lome. She has had this business since 2005. Dahona is married to a man in the military, and they have 4 children. Dahona's income allows her to contribute to the family's expenses. Dahona has requested a loan of 400,000 CFA in order to purchase oil, rice, sugar, and canned goods.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more radio batteries and toothpaste.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 28 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo Ángel de 34 años, y sus 2 pequeños hijos, juntos habitan en un paraje de la sierra central del Perú. Desde muy joven aprendió como se debían desempeñar las labores agrícolas para obtener una producción de calidad, es por eso que en la actualidad siembra papa, arvejas y flores de gladiolos, que cuida con esmero durante varias semanas, junto a su esposo. Le gusta mucho su labor porque dice que le permite ganar regulares ganancias que sirven para brindarle a su familia una adecuada calidad de vida, además dice que sembrar para luego cosechar es una labor tranquila. También dice que solo necesita de la ayuda de operarios cuando es tiempo de cosecha, y lo que no le agrada mucho es cargar los pesados costales que contienen sus productos, aunque dice que así obtiene mejores ganancias ya que ahorra bastante. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, además de comprar algunas cabezas de reses pues quiere empezar en la comercialización de animales. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además dice que esta muy satisfecha con el desempeño de los integrantes de su grupo comunal. Ana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de abono y semillas de arveja que necesita para la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Ana is 28 years old and lives with her husband Ángel, 34, and her two young children in her own home in the mountains of central Perú. She has been a farmer since she was very young and has learned how best to ensure a quality harvest. Currently, she and her husband work together, carefully tending fields where they grow potatoes, peas, and gladiolas. Ana really enjoys her work because it provides regular income that helps her family enjoy an adequate standard of living. She finds the work harvesting her crops to be very peaceful and she is glad that she only needs additional help during the harvest season. She does not enjoy lugging heavy sacks of produce, though this helps her save a lot of money. She is an enterprising woman and has plans to plant even more crops in the future. She would also like to purchase a few head of cattle and begin raising them commercially. This is her first loan from MFP and she is grateful to all the people that have made it possible. She is also very satisfied with the hard work of the members of her communal bank. Ana plans to invest this loan in the purchase of fertilizer and seeds for the next planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pea seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Los Madroños Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Los Madroños está conformado por Danelia Z. Dávila, Flora Nuvia M. L. y Damaris del Socorro S. Mejía, tres mujeres de una zona en crecimiento que comparten la misma dedicación y empeño al desarrollar sus labores de comercio diarias con el deseo siempre de superarse y obtener lo mejor para ellas y sus familias.

Danelia, quien es la coordinadora, vende ropa en general (nueva y usada) en su casa de habitación y también ambulante frecuentando a familiares, vecinos, conocidos y personas recomendadas para ofertar sus productos. Ella inició hace 8 años del mismo modo pero con muchos menos clientes, muchos menos productos y muchos menos estilos de ropa. Flora también se dedica a la venta de ropa pero ella vende únicamente ropa usada, y Damaris de igual modo vende ropa decidió vender también cosméticos y algunos artículos de uso personal.
texts.en:
The “Los Madroños” group is comprised of Danelia Z. Dávila, Flora Nuvia M. L., and Damaris del Socorro S. Mejía. These three women are from a rapidly developing area and share the same spirit of dedication and hard work towards developing their businesses, always seeking to get ahead and provide the best for their families. Danelia, the coordinator of the group, sells new and used clothing from her home. She also travels to the homes of relatives, neighbors, and other acquaintances to offer her products. She began this business 8 years ago with many fewer clients, products, and styles of clothing. Flora sells clothing, but specializes in used clothes. Damaris sells clothing as well as cosmetics and other personal care items.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Saraswoti

texts.en:
This is 49 year old Saraswati S.. She is married and has 2 children aged 17 and 18. In 2004, she established her grocery shop business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase of goods for her store.

In the future, Saraswati plans to send her children to school for higher studies. She thanks you for your support.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To purchase goods for store.

loans.name: Restauracíon Group

texts.es: Francisca Gabriela C. Hernández es una mujer de 41 años, coordinadora del grupo solidario Restauración, que inició su vida laboral hace 16 años cuando por necesidad tuvo que buscar un medio para salir adelante y cubrir sus necesidades básicas. Ella se dedica a la venta de lácteos en su casa de habitación y ambulante en el departamento de Masaya. Sus socias Petronila C. y Marvell Verónica Gómez tienen una fábrica de tortillas en sus respectivas casas de habitación; ambas iniciaron aproximadamente hace 10 años esta actividad económica y desde entonces han agregado otros productos a sus fábricas como son la venta de nacatamales, frijoles cocidos entre otros.
texts.en:
Francisca Gabriela C. Hernández is 41 years old and the coordinator of the united “Restauración” (Restoration) group. She began working out of necessity at age 16, when she needed to find a way to cover her basic needs. Now she sells milk products on foot and out of her home within the Masaya department. Her friends, Petronila C. and Marvell Verónica Gómez have tortilla factories in their respective homes. They began their business ten years ago. Since then they have added other products to their factories, such as nacatamales and cooked beans among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more radio batteries, soap, and copy books.

loans.name: Johana Mabel

texts.es:
Johana de 28 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona urbana, con una ecología en reconstrucción), ella tiene una pequeña papelería y integrado un pequeño Cyber. 

Ella vivía en Guayaquil con su suegra y su esposo pero como querían independizarse comenzaron a reunir dinero para ir a vivir a otra parte, y tener así su propio negocio. Poco a poco cuando ya viviendo en Duran readecuaron su casa y ubicaron una papelería y un pequeño Cyber. Ahora ella trabaja de lunes a sábado. Por la inseguridad en el sector por donde vive a tenido que poner unas rejas de metal en su negocio (como en la foto). 

En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para poder transportar la mercadería, y con el préstamo quiere comprar papelería y computadoras para el Cyber.
texts.en:
Johana, 28 years old and lives in la Primavera de Duran (an urban zone with an environment that is being re-built). She has a small newsagency with a small cyber cafe inside. Johana used to live in Guayaquil with her mother-in-law and husband, but as they wanted to become independent they began to save money to live in another location, and opened their own business. Little by little, now living in Duran, they have adapted their house and installed a newsagency and cyber cafe. Johana works from Monday to Saturday. Because of the uncertainty of the area where she lives she has had to put metal bars in her business (as shown in the photo). In the future Johana wants to purchase a car to transport her merchandise, and with this loan will purchase stationery and computers for the cyber cafe.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stationery and computers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 35 years old and has five children. She is married and her husband helps her with her business. Josephine sells timber and has done this business for three years. She needs a loan to buy more timber in order to enlarge her business. She also hopes to sell local brew with the profits. She strives to have a big workshop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more timber.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 43 years old and married to a farmer. She has 6 children aged from 1-16 years. Agnes sells banana juice, and she is requesting a loan in order to buy more food items for her store rather than just selling banana juice. She is hoping to further increase her inventory of food stuffs for her store. With the profits she plans renovate her house, which is the place where she conducts her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items.

loans.name: Peace And Progress Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale-business people in Makeni, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and make more profit.

Fenti (on the left) is the leader of this group. He was born in Makeni 41 years ago and is married with four children. His wife is a businesswoman and their children are attending primary school.

Fenti buys and sells cattle and has been doing this business for twelve years now. With his share of the loan, he will expand his business by buying  sheep and goats to sell.

In the corner of the photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats to sell

loans.name: Brigite

texts.en: Brigite is married to a farmer. She has five children who are between 6 months and 14 years old. They are all in school, apart from the 6 month old child. She has a small store where she sells household items. She also owns and operates a milling machine to grind grains and vegetables grown locally. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of household items for her store. She eventually hopes to carry a wider variety of goods in her store to meet her clients' needs.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of household items to sell.

loans.name: Domithile

texts.en: Domithile is 43 years old and has 8 children, among which she adopted two. Her husband is a farmer and sells milk. Domithile is a barber and has done this business for two years. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of hair cutting supplies. She plans to buy food for her family with the profits and plant some pineapples.

loans.use: To buying hair cutting supplies.

loans.name: Evelin Mercedes

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 49 años.  Mercedes nació y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos.  
 
Mercedes es licenciada en Administración de Empresas. Actualmente, Mercedes trabaja como empleada publica en la universidad san Antonio Abad del Cusco en el área de administración de obras. Mercedes y su amiga Amelia abrieron una pequeña empresa de servicios de Katherine. Ya es un  año que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar un samovar. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This member, Mercedes, 49, belongs to the communal bank "Granito de Mostaza", part of the Arariwa Association. Mercedes was born and lives in Cusco city together with her husband and 3 children. Mercedes is qualified in Business Administration and works as a public employee at the San Antonio Abad University of Cusco in project administration. Mercedes and her friend Amelia opened a small service business called Katherine. She has run this business for a year and it is doing very well thanks to the hard work that she puts in. Mercedes is seeking a loan to purchase a samovar. Mercedes is very thankful for the opportunity given to her and promises to meet the repayments according to the timeline stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a samovar

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: Basilia, de 45 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su pareja Juan de 43 años y con 5 de sus 7 hijos, pues los dos mayores son independientes. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la agricultura, siembra junto a su esposo papa, arveja, maíz y flores de gladiolo, y aunque afirma que el trabajo debe ser muy dedicado. Durante todos los días vigila con paciencia sus campos, hasta la espera de la cosecha y cuando llega el tiempo para recoger toda su buena producción observa la recompensa a todo su esfuerzo, en donde carga junto a sus familiares todos los pesados sacos con los productos naturales, que vende a regulares precios a los mayoristas que vienen de la ciudad. Además le gusta mucho este trabajo ya que lo desempeña desde muy joven, y en la actualidad le permite brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Como si fuera poco también prepara y comercializa comida en la feria de la ciudad. Como mujer emprendedora que es, tiene planeado en adelante sembrar en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, y promete que será muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero del crédito que le permitirá continuar progresando. Basilia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos, y de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Basilia, 45, lives in her own house alongside her partner Juan, 43, and 5 of their 7 children (the oldest 2 are independent). This hard-working lady works in agriculture together with her husband, sowing potatoes, peas, maize and gladioli flowers. She affirms that you must be very dedicated to your work. Each day they patiently patrol their plots of land, waiting for the harvest and for the time to arrive to gather the production and reap the reward for all their hard work. Basilia and her family load the heavy sacks with products which she sells at regular prices to the wholesalers who come to the city. Basilia likes her work very much and has been doing it since she was very young. It allows her to give her family a good quality of life. Basilia also prepares and sells food in a market in the city. Being an entrepreneurial woman, in the future she plans to sow a greater quantity of crops to improve her earnings. This is her third loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with her repayments. She is very thankful to everyone who made the loan possible, allowing her to continue to progress. Basilia plans to invest this loan in the purchase of fertilisers that she needs to improve the productivity of her crops, and continue progressing this way.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilisers

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 30 years old and has five children, one of which is adopted. Her children are between the ages of 1 and 10 years of age. She is married to a businessman. Three of her children are in primary school, one is in secondary school, and the last does not attend school due to the inability to pay school fees.

Pelagie sells food crops and with the loan she hopes increase her inventory. She used to sell both malt and other food stuffs, but since she gave birth to twins she has decided to only sell food stuffs. She has a large clientele, because she is the only wholesaler in her neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy more food crops.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 50 years of age and married to a farmer. She has 12 children who are between the age of 2 and 25 years. All her children are in school, apart from those who are not yet of school age. Jeanne sells meat, crops, and cow’s milk. As shown in the photo, she has a charcoal stove and a table on which she prepares and roasts skewered meat. She has done this business for 6 years, and with the loan she plans to increase her herd of cattle.  With the profits she hopes to pay her children’s school fees and buy more food for home consumption.

loans.use: To increase her herd of cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter les intrants notamment les semences et des fertilisants

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 44 years old and she is married to a man who does masonry and carpentry. She has 10 children who range from 2-22 years of age. All her children are in school, apart from those who are not yet of school age.
 
Rose sells locally made banana juice and has done this business for 15 years. With the loan she hopes to renovate her house, which is also the location of her business. She also plans to hire other employees. She hopes to pay her children’s school fees with the profits, and buy other family needs, such as food.  She is well known for her business, because of her good customer care.

loans.use: To renovate her house and  hire employees.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is 42 years old; she has 5 children aged 14-23 years. Three of her children are in primary school, one is in secondary school, and the last one does not attend school due to a failure to pay school fees. Patricie owns a store in which she sells a few home items, such as soap, matches and condoms. She has done this business for two years and she is requesting a loan in order to increase her inventory. With the profits she plans to pay for all of the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
Shown in the photo are the members of the “Ruth” group from the small town of Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. The members are women with small-scale businesses who want a loan of SLL 2,800,000 in order to boost their businesses.

With the help of this loan, the members will be able to buy more goods, attract more customers and make more sales and better profit, consequently improving their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isatu C.. Isatu is age forty-two and was born in Kambia, northern Sierra Leone. Currently, she is living in Waterloo (about 26 miles from Freetown) together with her husband and four children.

Isatu has been a businesswoman for ten years now. She sells market-food such as rice (the country’s staple food), groundnuts (peanuts), Margi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), beans, etc., in Sierra Leone’s capital city, Freetown. With this loan, she will be able to buy more of the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more rice, groundnuts, Margi, beans, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 25 years old and her husband is a barber and a farmer. She has one child who is one year old. Patricia owns a hair salon and with the loan she wants to buy a solar energy panel. She has done this business for two years and says that her business is well-known. One positive attribute of her salon is that there is a good waiting room in which clients wait when the barbers are occupied.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy panel.

loans.name: Mario Anderson

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Mario pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 56 años.  Mario nació en la ciudad de Lima y actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos.  
 
Mario es licenciado en Turismo.  Actualmente, Mario es independiente y trabaja como guía oficial de turismo por el valle sagrado de los Incas y hace camino Inca. Ya son 18 años que se dedica al turismo y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en el negocio de su esposa que es organizar eventos sociales y culturales. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mario is a member of the Ariariwa Association’s Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (“Little Mustard Seed”) and is 56 years old. Mario was born in the city of Lima and currently lives in the city of Cusco together with his wife and three children. Mario has a degree in tourism. Currently, he works independently as an official tour guide for the Sacred Valley of the Incas and does the Inca trail trek. He has been working in tourism for 18 years already, and it has been going well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He needs this loan to invest in his wife’s business, which is organizing social and cultural events. Mario is grateful for the opportunity provide through this means and commits to making the payments according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his wife's business of organizing social and cultural events

loans.name: Retamas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “RETAMAS” ha decidido asociarse para solicitar su primer crédito en el Centro Focal de VILLA EXALTACIÓN, ha conformado una mesa directiva compuesta por Presidenta, Tesorera y Secretaria de Actas. La presidenta, doña  Betzabé se dedica a la venta de tostad;  está casada y es madre de cuatros hijos.

El consumo de “tostado” (parecido a la pipoca) es común y tiene bastante demanda, se puede observar productos como la soya, la quinua, el trigo, granos como el maíz o productos de primera necesidad como el arroz y los fideos. 

La señora Betzabé aprendió este negocio de su madre y tía, compra la mercadería de los mayoristas y se dedica a la venta en diferentes fiestas y los fines de semana.  Actualmente le ayuda su hija a llevar adelante el negocio. 

Ocho mujeres integran la asociación comunal. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: venta de ropa, venta de verduras, tejedora de chompas, venta de comida, venta de manzana, Hilandería, venta de Tostado, venta de mantas.
texts.en:
The Retamas Communal Bank has decided to team up in order to request their first loan. In the Villa Exaltación community center they have formed a governing board comprised of the president, treasurer, and secretary. Betzabé is the president, and she sells “tostado” (roasted nuts and legumes). She is married and has four children. Eating tostado (similar to popcorn) is common, and there is plenty of demand. She has products like soy, quinoa, wheat, grains like corn, or basic needs items like rice and noodles. Betzabé learned this business from her mother and her aunt. She buys the merchandise from wholesalers, and she sells at different celebrations and on the week-ends. Her daughter now helps her get ahead with the business. Eight women belong to the communal bank. They have different business like selling clothes, selling vegetables, weaving sweaters, selling food, selling apples, a spinning mill, selling tostado, and selling blankets.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corn, quinoa, wheat, noodles, and rice

loans.name: Jimena Adriana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Jimena pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 21 años.  Jimena nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con sus  padres.   
 
Jimena es profesora de educación inicial y enseña a niños de 3 a 4 años en el colegio San José de la Salle de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 3 años que se dedica a la enseñanza y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para gasto personal desea comprar una computadora portátil. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This member Jimena belongs to the communal bank 'Granito de Mostaza', part of the Arariwa Association. Jimena is 21 years old and was born and lives in Cusco city together with her parents. Jimena is an primary education teacher and teaches children between 3 and 4 years old in San José de la Salle college in Cusco. She has been a teacher for 3 years and is doing very well thanks to the hard work she puts into her work. Jimena needs a loan for personal costs as she wants to buy a laptop. Jimena is thankful for the opportunity granted to her and promises to make the repayments according to the time period stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a laptop computer for personal use

loans.name: No Joke Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “No Joke” group from the small town of Waterloo where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is 44-year-old Fatmata B. who is pictured on the right. Fatmata was born in a town called Tongo, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and the couple has three children: two in primary school and one in senior secondary school I (JSS I) .

For ten years now, Fatmata has been selling bags of cement. With the help of this loan, she will be able to expand her business. She will travel to Freetown, which is about 26 miles from Waterloo to buy cement wholesale and retail it in Waterloo.

loans.use: To buy cement wholesale to sell in Waterloo

loans.name: Juan Buatista

texts.es:
Juan de 62 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales),  trabajando en su taller de madera, desde las 07h30am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos. 

Antes de tener su propio taller de ebanista, el trabajo como obrero en una construcción y hay aprendió a ser ebanista. Cuando cumplió 33 años decidió comenzar con su propio negocio de madera, poco a poco haciendo mueblería en su casa y vendiéndola a sus vecinos, pudo ampliar su taller, ahora el es ebanista de madera. Hace sillas, mesas, conjunto de salas etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio el quiere comprar madera y pegamento. En el futuro quiere comprar herramientas y readecuar su taller de madera.
texts.en:
Juan, 62, lives in El Suburbio in Guayaquil (an urban area; most of the inhabitants are small businessmen), working in his wood shop from 7:30 am until 6:00 pm everyday with the help of his children. Before having his own cabinetmaking workshop, he worked as a laborer in construction and learned to be a cabinetmaker. When he was 33 years old, he decided to start his own woodworking business, little by little making furniture in his house and selling it to his neighbors. He was able to expand his workshop and now is a cabinetmaker. He makes chairs, tables, living room sets, etc. To keep up with his business he wants to buy wood and glue. In the future, Juan wants to buy tools and renovate his workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wood, glue

loans.name: Big Family Group

texts.en:
Meet with the members of the “Big Family” group from Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 2,000,000. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Francess N. (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group. The thirty-year-old is married with one child ands has been a businesswoman for five years now, selling medicines. She intends using her SLL 1,200,000 share of the loan to add more drugs to her pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy more medicines to add to her pharmacy

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
Nuestra socia María pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 48 años.  María nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con sus dos hijos.   
 
María trabaja brindando servicio de transportes específicamente brinda movilidad escolar del colegio “Pukllasunchis”, Maria trabaja de lunes a viernes en dos horarios, ella recoge a los alumnos en sus casas, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la mañana y los lleva su colegio. María los devuelve a sus casas, desde el medio día hasta las 4 de la tarde. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a brindar servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para gasto personal desea comprar una lavadora. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member María belings to the communal bank “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA of the Asociación Arariwa. She is 48 years old. María was born in the city of Cuzco and lives in the same city with her two children. María works offering transportation service. Specifically, she offers transportation service for the “Pukllasunchis” school. Maria works from Monday through Friday during two time slots. She picks up the students at their houses from 7 to 9 a.m. and takes them to school. She returns them to their homes from midday until 4 in the afterrnoon. She has been offering this service for 10 years and it is going well for her, thanks to the dedication she brings to her work. Maria needs the loan for personal expenses; she wants to buy a washer. This member is grateful for the opportunity offered and she is committed to making her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses; she wants to buy a washer.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: Benedicto, de 40 años, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su hijo Elio de12 años, habitan en una tranquila localidad de la sierra central del Perú. Este hombre trabajador se dedica a las labores agrícolas desde muy joven, y con el transcurrir de los años aprendió todas las técnicas necesarias para obtener una buena producción, es por eso que en la actualidad siembra arvejas y papa. Cuida con esmero sus cultivos, y luego de un tiempo recoge toda su producción de calidad, y lo traslada hasta el mercado mayorista de su ciudad donde la comercializa a buenos precios, que le permiten obtener una buena calidad de vida. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces trabaja solo, porque su hijo estudia, aunque le ayuda en lo que puede, pero cuando es tiempo de cosecha contrata los servicios de operarios que le facilitan la labor. Como es un hombre emprendedor tiene grandes planes para el futuro, y uno de ellos es sembrar en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias, además quiere comprar algunas cabezas de reses. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, y también esta muy satisfecho con el desempeño de su grupo, pues esta integrado por personas responsables y solidarias. Benedicto tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de arveja y abono, pues necesita mejorar su producción para la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Benedicto is 40 years old and lives in his own home with his twelve year old son Elio. His house is located in a peaceful town in the central mountains of Peru. This hardworking gentleman has been farming since he was a young man. Over the years he learned the necessary techniques that would help him achieve good production. Benedicto currently grows peas and potatoes. He looks after his crops with great care and takes his entire harvest to the wholesale market in the city, where he is able to sell his products at good prices. This enables him to achieve a good quality of life. What he dislikes the most is working alone because his son is in school, although he tries to help whenever he can. During the harvest season, he hires laborers to help facilitate the work. Being an entrepreneur, he has great plans for the future, one of them being planting in larger quantities so that he can generate more income. In addition, Benedicto would like to acquire a few heads of cattle.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Benedicto is extremely grateful to everyone who made this loan possible because it will allow him to continue working. He is also very pleased with the accomplishments of his group since the members are responsible individuals who are supportive of one another. Benedicto plans to invest the money in the purchase of several sacks of seeds for planting peas, as well as compost, so that he can improve his production for the next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost & seeds for planting peas

loans.name: Marcial Jesus

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Marcial Jesús pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 44 años.  Marcial Jesús nació en la ciudad de Cusco.  Actualmente, Marcial Jesús vive en la misma ciudad, vive solo pues es soltero y todavía no se caso. 
 
Marcial Jesús trabaja como chofer en el ministerio. Ya son seis años que se dedica a ser conductor y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Marcial Jesús trabaja los 6 días de la semana de lunes a viernes desde las 7 hasta las 4 de la tarde. Marcial Jesús requiere el préstamo para comprar un equipo de sonido. 
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marcial Jesús is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is 44 years old and was born in the city of Cusco. Marcial Jesús still lives in the Cusco and is single because he never got married.

He works for the ministry as a chauffeur. Marcial Jesús has had this job for six years and has done very well because of the effort he puts into his work. He works five days a week, Monday through Friday, from 7am to 4pm. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy sound equipment

Marcial Jesús is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sound equipment

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana Q. V., tiene la edad de 36 años, es casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos,  que son su mayor prioridad. Ella  quiere comprar materiales para la fabricación de ropas y luego vender. Además en su taller de costura quiere ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de prendas de vestir. Tiene varios años que se dedica a la costura y quiere crecer ya que cuenta con muchos clientes que le permitirán crecer en su actividad. Es la  primera vez que recibe un préstamo de FUDECOSUR. Doña Ana desea tener mayores ingresos para invertir y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. FUDECOSUR le está brindando esta oportunidad  con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja,  también tiene el deseo de brindarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro  personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Ana Q. V. is 36 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children who are her highest priority. She wants to buy materials so that she can make clothing to sell. In addition to managing her sewing workshop, she wants to offer her customers with a wider variety of garments. Ana has been sewing for several years and has accumulated many customers, thereby allowing her to grow her business.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. Doña Ana wants to have more income to invest so that she can provide her children with a better quality of life. FUDECOSUR is providing this opportunity with greater convenience and a much lower interest rate. Ana also wants to provide her children with the necessary education that will help them become prepared individuals in the future who can deal with life more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Vidal pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 39 años.  Mario nació en la ciudad de Sicuani a tres horas de la ciudad del Cusco.  Actualmente, Vidal vive en la ciudad del Cusco vive solo pues es soltero y todavía no se caso. 
 
Vidal trabaja como sub gerente de la empresa constructora “RAF”.  Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a administrar el negocio    y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Vidal y su hermana Katia tienen un negocio familiar que consiste en brindar servicios de internet. Vidal requiere el préstamo para comprar accesorios de computadoras. 
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Vidal is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is 39 years old and was born in the city of Sicuani, which is three hours away from the city of Cusco. Vidal now lives in Cusco and is a bachelor since he has never married.

Vidal works as an assistant manager for the RAF construction company. He has had this job for four years and has done very well as a result of the effort he puts into his work. Vidal and his sister Katia have a family business providing Internet services. He is requesting a loan to buy computer accessories.

Vidal is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computer accessories

loans.name: Esfuerzo Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Esfuerzo Gracias a Dios lo conforman Arcadia Gertrudis T. C., María Auxiliadora Bermúdez Martínez, Marlin Ivonne R. T. y Coralia del Socorro P., 4 mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas, con distintas actividades económicas pero con el mismo sueño… Salir adelante.

Arcadia, quien es la coordinadora del grupo y la mayor de las cuatro se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa (pantalones, blusas, etc.), inició hace 30 años como costurera independiente atendiendo pequeños trabajos de confección, ahora recibe pedidos en el mercado y de gente particular los cuales entrega por lo general los días viernes de cada semana. Por otra parte María Auxiliadora se dedica a la venta de dulces de manera ambulante, Marlin es costurera y realiza trabajos de corte y confección y Coralia tiene una venta de refrescos, hielo, helados y otros productos en su casa.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Esfuerzo Gracias a Dios” consists of Arcadia Gertrudis T. C., María Auxiliadora Bermúdez Martínez, Marlin Ivonne R. T., and Coralia del Socorro P.. These four hardworking and strong women have different business activities, but they share the same dream of getting ahead.

Arcadia, the group coordinator, is the most experienced of the four ladies and earns a living by making and selling clothing (trousers, blouses, and other items). She started her business 30 years ago working as an independent seamstress, taking small sewing jobs. Now she receives orders from the market and specific individuals, and as a general rule, delivers her products every Friday.

As for the other members, María Auxiliadora sells candy as a street merchant. Marlin is a seamstress who makes handmade garments. Coralia has a shop in her house where she sells soft drinks, ice, ice cream, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: constituer un stock de maïs pour préparation et vente de mets

loans.name: Jenny Eliana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Jenny pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 40 años.  Jenny nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposo.

Jenny es Ingeniero Zootecnista, ella viaja a las zonas rurales y realiza capacitación a los campesinos de las comunidades.  Jenny compra queso y carne de las comunidades y después vende a sus amistades en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 2 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para construir su casa. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 40 years old and was born in the city of Cusco. Jenny still lives in Cusco with her husband.

She works as a veterinary technician, traveling to rural areas and providing training classes to the residents of these communities. Jenny buys cheese and meat when she is in these communities and sells them to her friends in city of Cusco. She has had this business for two years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. The loan she is requesting will be used to build her house.

Jenny is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Lizbeth pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 41 años.  Lisbeth nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposo y su hijo Adriano de 6 años.  
 
Lizbeth trabaja junto con su esposo como asistente administrativo de gerencia en el taller Mecánico “DISEMI”. La pueden encontrar en el taller, los 6 días de la semana de viernes a lunes, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Ya son 3 años que se dedica a brindar servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar un carro. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 41 years old and was born in the city of Cusco. Lizbeth still lives in Cusco with her husband and her six year old son Adriano.

Lizbeth works with her husband as the office manager of their auto repair shop called “Disemi”. They operate their business five days a week, Monday through Friday, from 9am until 6pm. Lizbeth and her husband have been providing repair services for three years and have done very well as a result of the effort they put into their work. She is requesting a loan to buy a car.

Lizbeth is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a car

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es: Celestino, de 49 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposa Dominga de 40 años y de sus 2 jóvenes hijos, que estudian, y juntos habitan en un apacible paraje de la sierra central del Perú. Desde muy joven se dedica en la agricultura, y en la actualidad siembra papa, arvejas, maíz y flores de gladiolos en sus chacras. Le gusta mucho la labor de campo porque lo realizan todos los miembros de su familia, aunque reconoce que la labor es sacrificada ya que debe vigilar todos sus cultivos que no sean atacados por las plagas de insectos o por los factores climáticos adversos, de esta manera siente que su dedicación es recompensada durante el tiempo de cosecha, pues recoge toda su producción y la vende en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad a regulares precios. Además paralelamente a su labor agrícola también se dedica en la crianza de animales como: vacas, toros, carneros, chanchos, que comercializa de vez en cuando en las ferias de la ciudad. Y como es un hombre emprendedor, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, y también quiere comprar más animales para continuar con la comercialización, ya que sabe que obtendrá generosas ganancias. Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar laborando, además dice estar satisfecho con el desempeño de su grupo comunal porque esta integrado por personas muy responsables. Celestino tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de semillas de arveja y varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Celestino is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Dominga, age 40, and their two teenage children who are in school. Their house is located in a peaceful village in the central mountains of Peru. Celestino has been farming since he was a young man. He currently grows potatoes, peas, corn, and gladiola flowers in his fields. What he enjoys most about farming is seeing everyone in his family help one another because they are all aware that the work requires sacrifice. Celestino monitors all of his crops because he does not want to be negatively impacted by plagues of insects or adverse weather conditions. He believes his dedication is rewarded at harvest time, when everything he produces is sold at the wholesale market in the city at regular prices. In addition to farming, Celestino also raises animals such as cows, bulls, sheep, and pigs. He sells the animals whenever he attends the city fairs. Being an entrepreneur, he wants to plant in greater quantities in the future and also buy more animals to sell later so that he can obtain a generous income.

This is the third time he has received a loan from MFP. Celestino is grateful to everyone who made this loan possible because it will allow him to continue working. In addition, he says he is pleased with the work of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible individuals. Celestino plans to invest the loan he requested in the purchase of seeds for planting peas and several sacks of compost and fertilizers that are needed to improve crop production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost, fertilizers, and seeds for planting peas

loans.name: Wilson Hipolito

texts.es:
Wilson de 38 años, el es vendedor de refrescos y frutas como coco y sandias, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (en una zona urbana, con una ecología en construcción). 

Tuvo su negocio porque en el sector por donde vive no había un puesto de frutas,  comenzó a vender cocos, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo vender sandias y otras frutas, ahora se levanta a las 04h00am hasta las 15h00 todos los días. Vende cada coco a $ 0.60 y las sandias a $ 1.50 c/u, también vende refrescos naturales de sandias y cocos. 

Para poder continuar con mas clientela el necesita comprar con el préstamo cocos y sandias, en el futuro el quiere tener locales de frutas en todo el sector las Orquídeas.
texts.en:
Wilson is 38 years old and sells refreshments and fruits, such as coconuts and watermelons. He lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil, an urban area with a decaying ecosystem.

He started this type of business because there were no other fruit stands where he lives. At first he sold coconuts, but with a little bit of effort, he began selling watermelons and other fruits. Now he wakes up at 4am and works until 3pm every day. He sells coconuts for $0.60/each and watermelons for $1.50/each. Wilson also sells natural beverages made from watermelons and coconuts.

In order to continue attracting more customers, Wilson will use his loan to buy more coconuts and watermelons. In the future, he hopes to set up fruit stands in every sector of Orquídeas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coconuts & watermelons

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Hope To God” group from Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch.

The members are petty-business women who have come to SMT, also a Kiva partner, in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,800,000 for the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Kadiatu C. who was born in a place called Magbele about forty years ago. She is married to a farmer and has six children of whom one is in secondary school and the rest are no longer attending school.

For seven years now, Kadiatu has been selling fertilizers, ginger, pepper and rice. With her SLL 1,000,000 share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying more fertilizers, ginger, pepper and rice to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers, ginger, pepper and rice to add to her current stock

loans.name: Adrian Wilder

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Adrian pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 43 años.  Adrian  nació en la ciudad de Cusco.  Actualmente, Adrian vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposa Lizbeth y su hijo Adriano de 6 años.  

Adrian tiene un pequeño taller de mecánica. Ya son varios años que se dedica al taller y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Adrian trabaja los 6 días de la semana de lunes a viernes desde las 7 hasta las 6 de la noche. Adrian requiere el préstamo para comprar una grúa. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Adrian is a member of the Communal Bank “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is 43 years old and was born in the city of Cusco. Adrian still lives in Cusco with his wife Lizbeth and his six year old son Adriano.

Adrian has a small auto repair shop. He has worked several years as a mechanic and has done very well as a result of the effort he puts into his work. Adrian works five days a week, Monday through Friday, from 7am to 6pm. He needs a loan to buy a vehicle lift.

Adrian is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle lift

loans.name: Hera Devi

texts.en:
This is 50 year old Hera Devi M.. She is married and has 2 children aged 28 and 29. In 1996, she established her agriculture business. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to purchase fertilizers and seeds. In the future, Hera Devi plans to expand her agriculture business. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Orquidea Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Orquídea se encuentra integrado por Cándida Paulina Velásquez, Ángela del Carmen González y Reyna Isabel Guzmán; las tres se dedican a la venta de cosméticos como principal fuente de ingreso, y aunque en esencia el giro es el mismo los negocios son totalmente distintos.

Cándida de 33 años, es la coordinadora del grupo y además de vender cosméticos también se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, algunas piezas de ropa en general y sandalias, todas sus ventas son 100% de contado y tiene muchos clientes fijos a pesar de vender ambulante. Reyna de 20 años, es la menor del grupo y también vende cosméticos de manera ambulante pero ella lo hace por medio de catálogo y no vende otro producto que no se encuentre en sus catálogos y no sea solicitado por el cliente. Ángela de 25 años, además de vender cosméticos también vende accesorios como perfumes y shampoos.

Estas mujeres utilizarán el crédito otorgado para aumentar la venta de esos productos que venden con mayor frecuencia y comprar otros que pueden ser también de alta demanda entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Orquídea (Orchid) includes Cándida Paulina Velásquez, Ángela del Carmen González y Reyna Isabel Guzmán. The three members work selling cosmetics as their main source of income. Although the idea is the same, the businesses are totally different. Cándida, 33 years old, is the coordinator of the group. In addition to selling cosmetics she also works selling underwear, some general articles of clothing, and sandals. All of her sales are 100% cash and she has many regular clients in spite of selling as a street vendor. Reyna, 20 years old, is the youngest of the group, and also sells cosmetics as a street vendor, but she sells by catalog and does not sell any products that are not in her catalogs and requested by her clients. Angela, who is 25 years old, is also a street vendor of cosmetics and sells accessories such as perfumes and shampoos. These women will use the loan to increase the sale of the products that they sell with greatest frequency and buy other products that may also be in high demand among their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional products

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Abel pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 40 años.  Abel nació en la ciudad del Cusco y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad.  
 
Abel tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería en el distrito de San Sebastián en la urbanización de Cachimayo de la ciudad del Cusco. Abel viaja a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado del departamento de Madre de Dios a comprar madera. Le pueden encontrar en el taller, los 6 días de la semana de lunes a viernes, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Ya son 13 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Abel belongs to the communal bank “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA" of the Asociación Arariwa. He is 40 years old. Abel was born in the city of Cuzco and he lives in the same city at present. Abel has a small carpintry workshop in the San Sebastián district in the Cachimayo sector of the city of Cuzco. Abel travels to the city of Puerto Maldonado of the Madre de Dios department to buy wood. He can be found at the workshop 6 days a week, Monday through Friday, from 7 in the morning until 7 at night. He has been working in this business for 13 years and it is going very well for him, thanks to the dedication he brings to his work. The member needs the loan to buy wood. The member is grateful for the opportunity offered in this way and he is committed to making the payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stocker des ignames

loans.name: Sorbeh United Group

texts.en:
Meet with the members of the “Sorbeh United” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Ibrahim T. (pictured second from left) is the leader of this group. The thirty-three-year-old man is married to a businesswoman and they have two children.

Ibrahim has been a businessman for seven years now, selling toothpaste, toothbrushes, bars of soap, etc. With his share of this loan, he will buy more of the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy more toothpaste, toothbrushes, bars of soap, etc.

loans.name: Short Street Strikers Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Short Street Strikers” group. They are people with small-scale businesses based in the small town of Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch.

They are seeking a loan of SLL 5,000,000 from Kiva lenders to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more sales, better profits, and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Zainab T. who is pictured on the right. She is age 32 and was born in Masiaka village. She is a widow with three children: two in primary school and one in junior secondary school III (JSS III).

Zainab sells soft drinks and cold water. With her SLL 1,500,000 share of this loan, she will buy more crates of soft drinks to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Aménagement de boutique pour vente de produits alimentaires

loans.name: Martha Fabiola

texts.es:
Martha de 28 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (en una zona urbana, con una ecología en construcción). Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de dulces en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Su esposo vende pollos y tienen dos hijos, pero debido a los pocos ingresos que tenían, ella decidió invertir sus ahorros y comprar dulces para vender a sus conocidos, poco a poco con esfuerzo, a podido tener una pequeña dulcería en la parte delantera de su casa, trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 20h00pm. 

Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo dulces y galletas, en el futuro quiere obtén mas cliente y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Martha is 28 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (in an urban zone under construction). She has a small candy store in the front part of her home. She and her husband have two children. Her husband also sells chickens, but because of the low income they had, she decided to invest her savings to buy candy to sell to her acquaintances. Little by little, with some effort, she has been able to establish a small candy store in the front part of her home. She works from 7:30 AM to 8:00 PM. She wants to use the money from this loan to buy candy and cookies so that she can offer a greater variety in her business. In the future she wants to have more customers and wants her children to complete their education with enthusiasm.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cookies and candy

loans.name: Esmerney

texts.es:
Cuando usted visita a  Esmereney  C., Hombre agradable y trabajador  encuentra toda clase de  mercancías y también tiene una mesita donde funciona con tres celulares como un operador de servicios de telefonía; Hace algunos días solicitó su crediKiva porque necesita comprar mercancías como electrodomésticos menores y unos planes más amplios de celulares y aunque  también desea agregar mercancías  de todo tipo, que acompañe su punto de servicios telefónicos, reconoce que debe esperar un poco, hasta que rote su dinero de préstamo para lograrlo, aunque    ya sus clientes   le preguntan por accesorios, celulares novedosos, maletines, dulcería y refrescos,  debido a que su operación de servicios telefónicos ha avanzado.

 Desde hace poco más de un año  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo le está apoyando en el crecimiento de su negocio mediante el financiamiento y con ello Esmereney ha logrado ampliar su gama de productos y tener un mayor grupo de clientes, ubicados en su barrio y en  las comunidades de alrededor; él es un  buen miembro de familia conformada por su esposa y sus 2 hijoa y tambien de la comunidad donde habita, por eso noy hay dudas respecto a su crecimiento prontamente, porque es muy trabajador y la gente lo prefiere.
texts.en:
When you visit Esmereney C., a pleasant, hard-working man, you will find all kinds of merchandise as well as a small table with three cell phones where he operates his call service. Several days ago, he requested his CrediKiva because he needs to buy merchandise like small appliances and a wider range of cell phone calling plans. He would also like to add many other kinds of merchandise to complement his call center, but he realizes that he must wait a little while until the loan he is currently investing comes back to him. His clients are already requesting cell phone accessories, new phones, briefcases, sweets and drinks, since his call center has advanced. For slightly over a year, Fundación Mario Santo Domingo has been supporting Esmereney so that he can expand his business through loans. Esmereney has been able to expand the range of products he offers and gain a wider base of customers from his neighborhood and other nearby communities. He is a family man, is married and has two daughters. He is also an upstanding member of the community in which he lives; there is no doubt as to his continued growth, since he is very hard-working and people prefer him.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Cell phone accessories for resale

loans.name: Sakomah Group

texts.en:
These entrepreneurs are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 each in order to further boost their businesses. With the help of this loan, they will be able to buy more goods, make more sales and make better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve, they can at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills if any of them fall sick.

Memuna K. is the leader of this group. She was born in Yele village and is forty-six years of age. She is married to a retired soldier and they have two children who are attending secondary school.

For twenty-eight years now, Memuna has been running a restaurant, selling cooked food and drinks. With her share of this loan, she will be able to buy drinks, rice, and other cooking ingredients wholesale.

loans.use: To buy drinks, rice, and other cooking ingredients wholesale

loans.name: To Time Group

texts.en:
These are women with small-scale businesses in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They have come to SMT, also a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 1,400,000 for the group to enable them expand their businesses.

With a loan of SLL 1,400,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school and be able to feed and clothe them.

Kadiatu B. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. She was born in a place called Rotifunk about forty years ago. She is married and has three children who are attending schools: two in secondary school and one in primary school. Her husband is a carpenter.

For eighteen years now, Kadiatu has been selling house-building materials: cement, iron rods, paint, etc. With her SLL 800,000 share of the loan, she will buy more of the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more house-building materials such as cement, iron rods, paint, etc.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina, de 28 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su conyugue Emilio de 29 años y de su pequeño hijo, juntos habitan en un paraje de la sierra central peruana. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, y en la actualidad siembra arveja junto a su pareja, aunque dice que la labor es algo sacrificada, pues debe madrugar todos los días para vigilar con dedicación sus cultivos, sabe que la recompensa a todo su esfuerzo es la buena cosecha que obtiene. Cuando su producción de arveja esta lista para ser recogida, contrata la ayuda de trabajadores que le ayudan a levantar los pesados sacos para comercializarlos a los vendedores mayoristas de la ciudad. Las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de sus productos naturales son regulares, es por esta razón que puede ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Como la labor agrícola le parece un negocio rentable, en adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias, además quiere comprar ganado porcino y empezar con la comercialización de estos animales. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecida con las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Con el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de guano y fertilizantes para mejorar su producción en la próxima siembra que ya esta cerca, para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Delfina is 28 years old and lives in her own home with her 29 year old husband, Emilio, and their young son. They live together in a spot in the central Peruvian mountains. [Delfina] has been farming since she was very young and at the moment she and her husband raise peas. She tells us that the work involves much sacrifice, as she must rise every day at dawn to care for her crops. She knows that the reward for her efforts will be a good harvest. When her peas are ready to harvest, she hires additional workers to help with the gathering and moving of the heavy sacs to the major sellers in the city. Her revenue from the sale of peas is steady and it allows her to offer her family a good quality of life. Because she considers farm work to be profitable, she plans to plant in larger quantity to increase her income. She also wants to buy hogs and begin selling these animals. This will be her seventh loan through MFP and she promises to be punctual with her payments. She is very grateful to the people who have made this loan possible. It will allow her to keep working. She will use the money from this loan to buy guano and fertilizer to improve the production of her next crop, which is coming up soon.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and guano

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acquérir un réfrigérateur

loans.name: Chiltoma Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Chiltoma se encuentra conformado por Nubia Auxiliadora Obregón González, Matilde Patricia González R. y Consuelo del Carmen P. González tres mujeres de distintas edades pero con un mismo sueño, ser victoriosas en la vida.

Nubia, quien es la más joven de tan solo 24 años es la coordinadora del grupo, se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado de Masaya desde hace 4 años aproximadamente, cuando decidió independizarse y tener una familia; hoy en día, su esposo es quien le ayuda en las actividades del negocio, ambos tienen un hijo al que quieren criar de la mejor manera posible y que llegue a ser alguien en la vida. Matilde, también se dedica a la venta de frutas, sin embargo ella lo hace en menor escala y de forma ambulante en el mercado municipal. Consuelo quien es la mayor del grupo, una mujer madura de 60 años ya, se dedica al destace de cerdos y la venta ambulante de su carne y derivados. Todas ellas utilizarán el crédito para la compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Chiltoma" is made up of Nubia Auxiliadora Obregón González, Matilde Patricia González R. and Consuelo del Carmen P. González, three women of different ages but sharing the same dream: being victorious in life. Nubia, the youngest at only 24 years old, is the group's coordinator. Her work is selling fruit in the Masaya market. She started about 4 years ago, when she decided to become independent and start a family. Today, her husband helps her with her business activities. Together, they have a child whom they would like to raise in the best way possible, so that he can be someone in life. Matilda also works seilling fruit, but she does it on a smaller scale, as a mobile vendor in the municipal market. Consuelo is the oldest member of the group, a mature woman who has already reached the age of 60. Her work is butchering pigs and selling their meat and byproducts as a mobile vendor. All of them will use the loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise to sell

loans.name: Salinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Salinas lo conforman tres jóvenes mujeres, luchadoras, emprendedoras y decididas a salir siempre adelante. Reyna Isabel Román F. de 29 años es la coordinadora de éste grupo se dedica a la venta de ropa en los alrededores de su casa de habitación y en la comunidad de Tisma desde hace tres años, ella tiene dos hijos los cuales son su fuente de inspiración para su lucha día a día.

Raquel del Socorro S. Pérez de 33 años se dedica a la venta de leche, cuajada y queso de modo ambulante en el departamento de Managua y Angélica María C. R. de 21 años a la venta de pescado, también de modo ambulante en Tisma. Ellas destinarán el dinero prestado a la compra de más mercadería.
texts.en:
The Salinas group is comprised of three enterprising young women who are dedicated to coming out on top. Reyna Isabel Román F., 29-years-old, is the coordinator of this group. For three years she has sold clothes in the area around her house and in the community of Tisma. She has two children who are the inspiration for her daily struggle. Raquel del Socorro S. Pérez, 33-years-old, travels around selling milk, curds, and cheese in the department of Managua. Angélica María C. R., 21-years-old, travels around selling fish in Tisma. They will invest the loan money in the purchase of more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: resupply merchandise

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
This is 50 year old Sita R.. She is married and has 2 children aged 25 and 20. In 1995, she established her service business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to increase the investment in her tea shop.

In the future, Sita plans to expand her service in terms of increasing inventory in the shop. She thanks you for your support. Whether on the streets of Kathmandu, or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.

With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked, while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To increase investment in tea shop.

loans.name: God Is Good Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “God is Good” group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the small town of Waterloo where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. These businesswomen are seeking a loan of SLL 1,800,000 for the entire group to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

Isatu C. who is age fifty-four is the leader of this group. Born in Waterloo, near Freetown, Isatu is married to a driver and they have four children – one in Senior Secondary School I (SSS I), another in Junior Secondary School II (JSS II) and another not of school-going age. 

Isatu sells market food – palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), fish, firewood, etc. She has been doing this business for six years now. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy palm oil, fish, firewood, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: extend cultivated area and buy agricultural materials

loans.name: We Hope To God Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “We Hope To God” group. They are small-scale businesswomen who are based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. These small-scale entrepreneurs have applied for a loan of SLL 3,700,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to improve their businesses. 
 
The leader of this group is Aminata J.. Aminata was born in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch.  She is age thirty-two, married with two children. Her husband is a tailor and one of her children is attending primary school while the other is still suckling.
