Aminata makes a living through the selling of clothing and plastic bowls. Aminata has been selling clothes and plastic bowls for ten years now. She will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,500,000) to buy more clothes and plastic bowls to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy more clothes and plastic bowls to add to her current stock

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Ana está conformado por Marta Lorena M. Gaitán, Ana Belki U. C. y Karla Patricia Alemán, tres mujeres que comparten la misma actividad económica y el deseo de ser mañana mejor de lo que son hoy. Ellas se dedican a la venta de cosa de horno, pero en distintos sectores y dedicarán el monto prestado a la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos.

Marta, la coordinadora, vende sus productos en Masaya y el M. Roberto Huembes de Managua, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 6 años, en todo ese tiempo ha conseguido clientes que le compran de manera continua y clientes de confianza a quienes les brinda crédito de 7 y 15 días. Ana Belki, tiene el mismo tiempo de experiencia y ella comercializa sus productos de modo ambulante en el M. municipal de Masaya, Karla por el contrario lo realiza de manera ambulante en Managua.
texts.en:
The Santa Ana group is comprised of Marta Lorena M. Gaitán, Ana Belki U. C., and Karla Patricia Alemán, three women who share the same economic activity and want to be better tomorrow than they are today. They sell baked goods, but in different areas and they will invest the loan money in primary ingredients for their products. Marta, the coordinator, sells her products in Masaya and the Roberto Huembes market in Managua. She's had this business for 6 years, in which time she's gained trustworthy and regular customers to whom she extends credit between 7 and 15 days. Ana Belki has worked for the same number of years, and she sells her products in the municipal market in Masaya. Karla, on the other hand, sells in Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Honest Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is pleased to present to you members of the “Honest Group II”. They are small-scale businesswomen in Waterloo, a small town where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch.  They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,600,000 in order to further develop their respective businesses.

The leader of this group is twenty-eight-year-old Fatmata K..  Fatmata was born in Makeni city; she is married and the couple has one child who is attending primary school.

Fatmata, who has been a businesswoman for many years now, is the owner of a small grocery shop where she sells sardines, cocoa, butter, milk, sugar, etc. With the help of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys sardines, cocoa, butter, milk, sugar, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Resupply merchandise in bulk on a regular basis

loans.name: Concepcion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Concepción está conformado por 3 mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras, su coordinadora Alma Nubia M. C. tiene 26 años de experiencia en la compra/venta de zapatos, actualmente tiene un tramo en el mercado de Masaya y su meta es tener una gran tienda con zapatos de todos los estilos y a un buen precio.

En éste grupo, Gladis V. R. también se dedica a la venta de zapatos, sin embargo ella realiza esta actividad en su casa de habitación ofreciéndolos en su mayoría al crédito a la gente de la comunidad, personas conocidas y recomendadas por sus familiares. La última integrante, Rosa Argentina S. O., tiene una actividad distinta a la de sus compañeras, pero no menos lucrativa, ella se dedica a la venta de fritangas; su puesto se encuentra en su casa de habitación y atiende principalmente por las noches y fines de semana. Todas ellas destinarán el crédito a la compra de mercadería y/o materia prima para seguir aumentando su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
The Concepción group is comprised of 3 hardworking, enterprising women. Their coordinator is Alma Nubia M. C., who has 26 years of experience buying and selling shoes. Currently she has a stand in the Masaya market and her goal is to have a big shoe store with all styles at a good price. In this group Gladis V. R. also sells shoes, however she works in her house, offering credit to the people of the community, persons known to her and vouched for by others. The third member, Rosa Argentina S. O., works in a different, but no less lucrative field than her partners. She sells fried foods from her house, mostly at night and on the weekend. All three women will use the loan to buy merchandise and/or primary ingredients to continue growing their working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Replace his van's engine and carry out other repairs

loans.name: John A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is pleased to present to you teachers of the Baptist Model Secondary School, in Waterloo, a small town where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. Baptist Model Secondary School was established by the Baptist mission primarily to educate the children of Allen town and its environs. The school is staffed with fifty teachers and has 2,100 pupils.

These hard-working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT to seek a loan of SLL 7,400,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful project that their mere salaries alone cannot do. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy house building materials, buy a piece of land or pay school fees for their children, while some of them will invest the loan in a business. 

John A. B. is the leader of this group of teachers. He is age thirty-eight. Abu is married and has two children. Mr. B. will use part of his share of the loan to pay school fees for his children and will use the remainder of the loan to pay school fees for himself to pursue further studies.

loans.use: pay school fees for his children and  for himself

loans.name: Manito Poderosa Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Manito Poderosa lo conforman Leyla Francisca
texts.en: The “Manito Poderosa” (Powerful Hand) Communal Bank is comprised of Leyla Francisca

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo, de 22 años, vive en casa de su madre Agripina de 56 años en compañía de ella, y de su hermano mayor Orlando de 29 años, juntos habitan en un paraje de la sierra central peruana. Desde muy joven ayudaba a sus padres en largas faenas agrícolas, y así aprendió todo lo necesario para cultivar, es por eso que en la actualidad siembra papa y arveja junto a su hermano, en las chacras de su madre. Le gusta la labor agrícola, pues dice que le gusta vigilar las tierras con dedicación, brindándoles los insumos necesarios para que produzcan en cantidad. Cuando es tiempo de cosecha, si no se abastece en el trabajo con su hermano, contratan operarios, y de esta manera venden toda su producción a los mayoristas de la ciudad, quienes le pagan regulares precios, sobretodo por la arveja, que es una legumbre bastante cotizada en el mercado nacional. Como es un joven emprendedor para mas adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, para mejorar sus ganancias, y así espera convertirse en el mejor productor de la zona. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que les permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso, además esta muy satisfecho con el buen desempeño de su grupo comunal, pues esta integrado por personas bastante responsables. Eduardo tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono y semillas de arveja que necesita para la próxima campaña, ya que quiere aumentar su producción, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 22 years old. He lives with his 56 year old mother, Agripina, and his older brother, 29 year old Orlando. They live together in his mother’s house in the central Peruvian mountain range. Since he was very young he helped his parents with the long agricultural chores. That way he learned everything he needed to in order to farm. That is why he now plants potatoes and peas with his brother. They plant on their mother’s fields. He likes farm work, and he says that he likes watching over the fields. He does it with dedication, and he gives the plants what they need to produce in quantity. If he and his brother need help at harvest time, they hire workers. They sell all of their production to wholesalers in the city. They pay him the usual price, especially for peas. Peas are very sought-after in the national market. In the future, as a young entrepreneur, he plans to plant in greater quantity to improve his income. That way he hopes to become the best producer in the area. This is his third loan with MFP. He is very grateful to all of the people who made the loan possible. They will allow him to continue working in the pursuit of progress. Also, he is very happy with the good performance of his communal bank. It is comprised of very responsible people. Eduardo plans to use the loan to buy several sacks of fertilizer and pea seeds that he needs for the next season. He wants to increase his production, and he hopes that this way he will continue to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Alejandro Usberto

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola caracterizado por producir principalmente frutas, las cuales son procesadas para luego exportarse a diversos países del exterior. La zona pertene a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de mango y limon, que son los principales cultivos de la zona, el cuenta con una pequeña extensión de terreno donde suele sembrar estas plantas frutales, las cuales cosecha cada cierto tiempo, las frutas que cosecha las ofrece en venta a las plantas procesadoras las cuales se encargan de exportar estos productos a diversos países del exterior. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad el se encarga de sostener la economía de su familia.

Alejandro desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a los cultivos con los que cuenta. Para lograr este objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles.

Alejandro es una persona responsable y bastante trabajadora, desde muy joven ha entregado lo mejor de si para sacar a su familia adelante y ahora se encuentra orgulloso ya que sus hijos están emancipados y son personas de bien. El desea seguir trabajando para poder sentirse activo y util y además para que pueda asegurarse una vida tranquila junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Alejandro, age 60, is married. He lives with his wife in the Tambogrande district. It is an agricultural district, which is known for mainly growing fruits. The fruits are processed and then exported to different foreign countries. The area belongs to the Piura province, which is in the region with the same name. It is three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He does agricultural work. Specifically, he grows mangos and lemons, which are the main crops in the area. He has a small piece of land where he usually plants these fruits. He harvests them each season. He sells the fruits that he harvests to the processing plants, which export these products to different foreign countries. He uses the income from this activity to support his family. Alejandro wants to get fertilizers to provide maintenance to his crops. To achieve this objective he believes that it is advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan for 1,300 soles. Alejandro is a responsible and very hard-working person. Since he was very young he has given his best to get his family ahead. He is now proud that his children are independent, and that they are good people. He wants to continue working in order to be able to feel active and useful. He also wants to be assured of a peaceful life with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers to provide maintanence on his mango and lemon crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy and sell pagnes and clothing fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sales of generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Agua Clara Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Agua Clara se encuentra conformado por Leyla María Velásquez V., Ivania del Carmen
texts.en: The solidarity group "Agua Clara" ["Clear Water"] is made up of Leyla María Velásquez V., Ivania del Carmen

loans.use: Buying supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a motor pump to water tomato beds and extend the cultivated area

loans.name: Richard Jerry

texts.es:
Richard de 43 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), el distribuye agua en botellones. 

Por la falta de oportunidades el comenzó a trabajar repartiendo agua en una carreta desde joven, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación hizo este su trabajo principal para mantener a su familia, ahora el tiene una moto para repartir el agua a sus clientes, también reparte cilindro de gas.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar botellones de agua y cilindros de gas, en el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta y así expandir mas la distribución.
texts.en:
Richard is 43 years old and lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil (an urban zone where most inhabitants are traders on the informal market). His work is distributing water in large bottles. Because of the lack of opportunities, he started the work of distributing water on a cart when he was young. Little by little, with effort and dedication, he made this his main activity to support his family. Today, he has a motorcycle which he uses to distribute the water to his customers. He also distributes household gas cylinders. With the loan, he wants to buy large bottles of water and gas cylinders. In the future, he would like to buy a pickup truck so that he can extend his distribution even more.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying water bottles and gas cylinders

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María de 33 años, ella vive en una zona periurbana en la Primavera de Duran,  ella tiene una papelería en el Ecuador se les llama “bazar”.

Con la motivación de tener que mantener a sus hijos tuvo que invertir sus ahorros para comprar papelería y comenzar a venderla a sus conocidos. Ahora trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm en su propio negocio. Una de las dificultades es la falta de tiempo y la delincuencia que ahora hay en el sector, por eso tuvo que poner rejas en su negocio (como en la foto). 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y papelería para su negocio, en el futuro quiere construir su casa mejor su casa y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old and lives in the area just outside of Primavera de Duran, Ecuador. She has a stationery store, which in her country is called a "Bazar." Motivated by the need to support her children, she had to invest her savings in order to buy stationery. She began to sell her products to people she knew. Now, she works from 7am until 9pm at her own business. One of the difficulties she has is a lack of time; also, she has had to put up bars at her store (as seen in the photo) due to crime in the area. With the loan, María wants to buy notebooks, pens, and paper products for her business. In the future, she would like to make improvements on her house; she also wants her children to finish their studies successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy notebooks, pens, and paper products

loans.name: Consentidas Group

texts.es:
“CONSENTIDAS” es el nombre de la Asociación Comunal que se organizò para su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de VILLA EXALTACIÓN, como todas las asociaciones está guiada por una mesa directiva, compuesta por una presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. 

La tesorera,  doña L. se dedica a la venta de carne, aprendió este negocio de sus padres pues antes trabajaba con su familia.    Actualmente le colabora su pareja, compran carne por mayor del matadero y la venden por menor todos los días.  Es parte de la asociación desde el primer ciclo, la primera vez fue invitada por sus compañeras.


La asociación comunal esta integrado por siete mujeres y un varón. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: venta de carne, venta de comida, recicladora de chatarra, venta artesanía, venta de salchipapa, venta de productos de salud.
texts.en:
“Consentidas” (Easy-Going Women) is the name of the communal bank that was organized for its second loan cycle at the Villa Exaltación Service Point. Like all the communal banks, it is guided by a board of directors, consisting of a president, treasurer and secretary. The treasurer, L., sells meat. She learned this business from her parents because she used to work with her family. Now she works with her husband; they buy meat wholesale from the slaughterhouse and sell it retail everyday. She has been part of the bank since the first loan cycle. The first time, she was invited by her friends. The communal bank is made up of seven women and one man. They have different businesses, such as: meat sales, food sales, scrap iron recycling, handcraft sales, sales of salchipapa [a Bolivian fast food], and sales of health care products.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: meat

loans.name: Eduardo Humberto

texts.es:
Eduardo de 32 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona urbana, con una ecología en reconstrucción), es tiene un taller de reparación de bicicletas. 

Desde pequeño el papa le enseño a reparar bicicletas, pero por la falta de oportunidades tuvo que comenzar a trabajar reparando bicicletas para poder mantener a su familia. Poco a poco readecuo su taller. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar llantas, cadenas y herramientas para su taller de bicicletas, en el futuro quiere tener talleres de reparación.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 32 years old. He lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban zone with an ecology that is being revitalized). He has a bicycle repair shop. Starting when he was a small boy, his father taught him how to repair bicycles. Because of the lack of opportunities, he had to start repairing bicycles in order to support his family. Little by little, he set up his workshop. With the loan, he would like to buy tires, chains and tools for his bicycle workshop. in the future, he would like to open more repair shops.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bicycle tires and chains

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Arnaldo M.  tiene 27 años de edad es soltero y vive con su madre en la ciudad de Carapeguá. 
    	Como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de estudiar y ser un profesional decidió emprender un pequeño negocio, empezó vendiendo ropas y calzados por la zona urbana de su ciudad, en poco tiempo logró juntar un poco de capital para empezar a comprar más variedad de artículos y llevar a vender por la capital del país Asunción donde ya tiene una buena clientela formada.
Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  pudo comprarse una motocicleta  la cual lo utiliza para realizar sus ventas y mantener la buena clientela.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas) puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos
texts.en:
Arnaldo M., 27, is single and lives with his mother in the city of Carapegua. As he comes from a family of modest circumstances and has a desire to study and become a professional, he decided to start up a small business. He started selling clothing and footwear in an urban neighborhood in his city. In a short time, he managed to gather together a small amount of capital that he used to start to buy a greater variety of items and take them to sell in the capital city of Asuncion, where he already has formed a good customer base. Thanks to his work and efforts, he was able to buy a motorcycle, which he uses to carry out his sales and maintain a good clientele. He requests a loan to buy merchandise (traditional woven items such as hammocks, bedspreads and sashes, along with blankets and bed sheets), since he has a lot of orders for these products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, sheets, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Martha Elizabet

texts.es: Doña Martha Elizabeth Vásquez A. de 41 años es una mujer luchadora y esmerada, costurera que desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, en especial de huipiles en el mercado municipal de Masaya y en su casa de habitación. Su fuente de inspiración son sus tres hijos por quienes trabaja y se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante. Ella utilizará el crédito para la compra de materiales para seguir aumentando su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Martha Elizabeth Vasquez A., 41, is a woman who strives to succeed and puts a lot of care into her work. She is a dressmaker who for 10 years has been selling clothing, especially huipiles (traditional Mayan woven garments), in the municipal market of Masaya and also from her house. Her 3 children are her source of inspiration; she works hard for them every day to get ahead. She will use the loan to buy materials to continue increasing her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for her clothing business

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with no children yet. She sells various types of women's clothing. Her kiosk is located at the food market. This location allows Irina to offer her goods to many people who come to the market to get food. Irina started her business five years ago. Her mother, who had a lot of sales experience, helped Irina to make this business a success.

Irina would like to borrow 15,000 Ukrainian grivna to increase her assortment of inventory. She would like to develop her business further and start a second location.

loans.use: To increase the assortment.

loans.name: Javier De Jesus

texts.es: Javier C. Pérez vive en el municipio de Baranoa donde tiene una pequeña miscelánea allí vende hermosos detalles para cumpleaños, artículos para modistería y papelería en general. Él inició con muy poco surtido de mercancía y una sola vitrina  en el año 2004, pero gradualmente y con los financiamientos realizados por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, fue surtiendo su vitrina poco a poco, eso si trabajó con mucha disciplina en la aplicación de los recursos y por eso ha logrado  sostener su negocio a lo largo de todos los tiempos y también proyectar su continuidad exitosa, pero con un buen manejo de su vida crediticia. El credikiva es el tercer crédito que recibe con esta organización y   una parte estará dirigido a aumentar su capital de trabajo, comprando hermosos detalles para el día del amor y la amistad que se aproxima en Septiembre y la otra parte para comprar una pequeña vitrina, surtirla, ordenando mucha  de su mercancía  para exhibirla efectivamente. Su meta más inmediata es adecuar la planta física donde funciona su negocio y adquirir nuevas vitrinas para terminar de organizarlo. Su desafío más importante es contar con un capital de trabajo para financiar su cartera.
texts.en:
Javier C. Pérez lives in the municipality of Baranoa, where he has a small general store. There he sells attractive items for birthday celebrations, dressmaking supplies and stationery in general. He started with a very small supply of merchandise and a single glass display case in the year 2004, but gradually, and with the help of loans made through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, he filled his display case with merchandise. He worked with a lot of discipline in the use of these resources, and as a result he has managed to keep his business going over all this time and also to lay plans for its continued success while also continuing to do a good job managing its credit. This Kiva loan is the 3rd loan he has received from this organization, and a part will be used to increase his working capital by buying attractive items for the "Day of Love and Friendship" that comes in September. He will use the other part to buy a small glass display case and stock it with merchandise that can be displayed effectively. His more immediate goal is to adapt the physical infrastructure of his business and acquire new glass display cases to finish organizing it. His main challenge is to have sufficient working capital to finance his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy gift items, dressmaking supplies such as thread and thimbles and general stationery items, and to buy a new glass display case

loans.name: El Espino Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario El Espino está conformado por Vilma Emerita P. M. de 53 años de edad, Nidia del Carmen C. H. de 28 y Silvia María Pérez Díaz de 24, ellas quieren aumentar su negocio y para lograrlo optaron por el crédito.

Vilma, la coordinadora y la mayor del grupo inició una venta de comida en su casa de habitación hace tres años, los cuales los dos últimos ha podido mejorar el aspecto e invertir en más capital de trabajo gracias a los créditos que se le han brindado. Nidia, se dedica a la compra/venta de maní y Silvia a la venta de prendas de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
The El Espino community bank has Vilma Emerita P. M. (age 53), Nidia del Carmen C. Hernandez (28), and Silvia Maria P. Diaz (24) as members. The want to expand their business and have requested a loan to do it. Vilma, who is the group coordinator and the eldest, started selling food out of her home three years ago. During the past two years she has been able to improve it and invest more working capital thanks to the loans she have received. Nidia works buying and selling peanuts and Silvia sells clothing door to door.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various goods

loans.name: Corrales Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá  unas señoras de escasos recursos se conformaron su comité para integrar el programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y todas de dedican a la artesanía.
Se reunieron para buscar apoyo a fin de  fomentar a través del crédito  sus trabajos y por ende sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Isabel que al igual que sus compañeras se dedica a la artesanía el cual es una actividad muy común de la zona.
Ella fabrica mantas de lana, ponchos de lana, bufanda de lana y otros, actualmente todo para el invierno.
Se encuentra muy satisfecha ya que hay mucha demanda y solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como hilos, telas y colorantes para teñir las telas.
texts.en:
In the city of Carapegua a group or women of modest means came together to form their own committee and so be able to join the Comite de Mujeres Emprededoras [Entrepreneurial Women's Committee]. These women are active and hardworking and all make a living making crafts. They came together to be able to support their businesses through loans and so improve their families' income and quality of life. They need this loan to be able to invest in their respective businesses and so be able to achieve the sustained growth that will help them grow as a group and individually. One of the members is Isabel, who like her partners, works making crafts. This is a very common activity in the area. She makes wool blankets, ponchos and scarves amongst others for the winter. She's very happy because demand is strong and she is requesting the loan to buy raw material such as thread, fabric and dyes.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase thread, fabrics and various dyes

loans.name: Gari Heribeto

texts.es:
Gari de 33 años,  vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (en una zona urbana, con una ecología en construcción). El tiene un taller de cerrajería (lugar donde se reparan metales, y se suelda).

Desde pequeño el papa le enseño a  ser cerrajero, reparaban puertas juntos y metales, pero por la falta de ingreso no pudo tener su local sino trabajar en su domicilio para poder mantener a su familia, poco a poco con esfuerzo logro readecuar su casa y ubicar el taller de cerrajería que tanto había querido. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. 

El quiere con el préstamo comprar una maquina cortadora para su taller, en el futuro quiere seguir en su trabajo y tener mas cliente para que su familia tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Gari, 33, lives in Las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, an urban area with a diminishing ecosystem. He runs a locksmith shop (a place that repairs metals and does welding). Since Gari was little, his father taught him how to be a locksmith. He repaired doors and metals but due to lack of funds he couldn’t have his own shop; rather, he had to work at home in order to support his family. Gradually, with effort, he managed to convert his home into the locksmith shop that he wanted. Now he works from 8AM until 6PM every day. Gari would like a loan to buy a power saw for his shop. In the future he wants to continue his line of work and have more customers so that his family has a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Circular Power Saw

loans.name: Rosas De Rosas Pampa Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “ROSAS DE ROSAS PAMPA” es parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, tiene como presidenta a la señora  Rufina.

Doña Rufina al igual que el resto de sus compañeras están solicitando crédito por primera vez, ellas conocieron a Pro Mujer a través de la promoción del personal de la institución.  Su negocio es la venta de Helado, ella indica que aprendió por necesidad desde hace 21años. Su solicitud ha sido por Bs.2000.-, ella piensa comprar con este dinero fruta por mayor. Ella vende su mercadería entre las 10:00 a.m. y las 18:00 p.m. en el puente Bolivia. Le colaboran sus hijos (son siete).

De los servicios que ofrece Pro Mujer el servicio que más le gusta a doña Rufina es el servicio de Salud por que le ha brindado muy buena atención.

Por otro lado las integrantes de la asociación comunal, son ocho mujeres. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: venta de fruta, venta de helado, venta de comida, venta de calzados y llantería.
texts.en:
The community association “ROSAS DE ROSAS PAMPA” is part of the Villa Exaltación Center. The president of the association is Señora Rufina. Mrs. Rufina, as well as the other members, is asking for credit for the first time. They learned about Pro Mujer through a personal contact with the organization. Her business is selling ice cream, something that she learned to do 21 years ago, out of necessity. Her request is for 2000 Bolivianos. She would like to fruit with this money. She sells her wares from 10am to 6pm on the Bolivia bridge. Her children help her (there are seven of them). Of the services that Pro Mujer offers, the one that Doña Rufina likes the most is the health service because they have given her really good care. The other members of the community association are 8 women. They have different businesses, like selling fruit, ice cream, food, shoes and tires.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr .Daniel es de la ciudad de Acahay, vive en compañía  de su esposa Sra. Liza Martínez y juntos tienen una hija menor de edad.

    Hace varios años que se dedica a la venta y distribución de remedios naturales en los diferentes mercados de diferentes ciudades.

        Comenta que es un trabajo que le genera  muy buen ingreso  ya que ellos mismos son los encargados de la venta, también manifiesta que gracias a su sacrificio y dedicación al trabajo van  mejorando  su calidad de vida.
Actualmente viven en una casa alquilada y tienen un capital ahorrado por lo que solicita el préstamo para completar la suma que les falta para el pago de un terreno.
texts.en:
Daniel is from the city of Acahay and he lives with his wife, Sra Liza Martínez and their young daughter. For various years, Daniel has worked selling natural remedies in different markets in different cities. He says this job has provided him with a good income because they themselves are responsible for the sales. He also says that thanks to his sacrifice and dedication, he and his family have improved their quality of life. Right now he and his family live in a rented home and they have some savings. They are asking for a loan to make a down payment on a piece of land.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying land

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Eusebio, de 46 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposa Celia (40) y sus  3 jóvenes hijos, juntos trabajan para salir adelante. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura; siembra arveja, papa y maíz en sus tierras que compró gracias a varios años de constante esfuerzo en su trabajo. Dice que trabaja a lado de toda su familia, y que le gusta esta labor porque es tranquila y aunque es algo sacrificado madrugar todos los días para vigilar sus cultivos, la recompensa a su esfuerzo, es recoger una productiva cosecha, que vende en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad a buenos precios. Lo que no le gusta de su trabajo es que debe trasladar todos sus productos para venderlos, hasta la ciudad, porque es bastante cansado. Como quiere continuar progresando para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, además de comprar algunas cabezas de reses para criarlas y luego venderlas a mayor precio. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, también dice que el trabajo con su grupo comunal es bastante organizado, porque los miembros de su grupo son personas responsables y puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará abono y fertilizantes que necesita para mejorar sus tierras, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 46 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Celia (40 years old) and his three young sons. They are working together to get ahead. Since he was very young, Eusebio has worked in agriculture, planting peas, potatoes and corn on the land that he bought thanks to many years of constant effort in his job. He says that he works alongside his family and that he likes this work because it is peaceful. Although it is a sacrifice to get up at dawn every day to care for his crops, the reward for his effort is a productive harvest that he sells at the largest market in his city for good prices. What he doesn't like about his job is that he must transport all his products to the city in order to sell them, because it is very tiring. Since he wants to continue his progress for the future, he is planning to plant greater quantities of crops and also to buy a few head of cattle to raise and then sell them at a higher price. This is his 7th loan with MFP and he is very grateful to all the people that made this credit possible because it allowed him to continue working. He also says that the work with his community group is very organized, because the members of the group are responsible people, and punctual in their loan repayments. With the loan he has requested, he will buy the manure and fertilizer that he needs to improve his soil and hopes to continue his progress this way.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es:
El Sr. Eliseo C. es oriundo de la ciudad de Carapeguá y vive en una de la compañía llamada Beni Loma, tiene 36 años de edad y está casado hace mas de  11 años con la Sra. Pelagia Chaparro,  tienen  Tres  hijos dos en edad escolar  y el otro ya mayor de edad.
Hace  15 años  se  iniciò vendiendo colchas  que ellos mismos producen con su madre, mas adelante después de 8 años se independizó y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia; lleva los productos artesanales de la zona a venderlos por las ciudades de Caapucu, Florida y Misiones. 
Este  trabajo lo realiza  en su motocicleta ,que  le  permite realizar su  recorrido  hacia  zonas distantes  tiene  muy buena  clientela y su trabajo le genera  muy buenas ganancias.  
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas y sábanas) puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Sr. Eliseo C. is a native of the city of Carapeguá and he lives in an area called Beni Loma. He is 36 years old and has been married for 11 years to Sra. Pelagia Chaparro,. They have three children, two are school-age and the other is older. Fifteen years ago, they began selling quilts that they produced themselves, along with his mother. Eight years later, Eliseo became independent and started his own business. He brings the handmade products from his home to sell them in cities like Caapucu, Florida and Misiones. He transports his products on his motorcycle, which allows him to make his way to more remote areas. He has a very good clientele and he makes a good living with this job. He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise (hammocks, blankets, sheets) because he receives many requests for these products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hammocks, blankets and sheets

loans.name: Vicenta Narcisa

texts.es:
Vicenta de 44 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona urbana, con una ecología en reconstrucción),  ella tiene un restaurante, utiliza su casa para cocinar los platos típicos y en el cerramiento los vende.    

Ella comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de ingresos, y para poder mantener a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera. Invirtió sus ahorros en víveres y comenzó a hacer comidas en su casa y venderlas a sus vecinos y amigos. Desde esos tiempos hasta ahora ella ha vendido almuerzos y meriendas desde $ 1.25 hasta $ 1.50.

Para continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo mesas y sillas para tener mas clientela. En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 44 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban area with an environment that is being rehabilitated). She has a restaurant. She cooks typical foods in her home and then sells them. She began this business due to her lack of income and in order to take care of her children because she is a single mother. She invested her savings in food and began to cook at home and sell the food to her friends and neighbors. Since then she has been selling lunches and snacks at $1.25 to $1.50. To continue her business she would like to use the loan to buy tables and chairs in order to expand her clientele. In the future, she would like her business to grow and her children to complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La Sra. Carolina es de la Ciudad de La Paz,  vive en la zona denominada Ernesto torres antes de legar a la Zona de Llojeta, una zona muy concurrida de nuestra ciudad,  tiene  dos niños de entre 4 y 10  años de edad que se encuentran en edad escolar, es concubina no se caso y su actividad  es comerciante en la venta de abarrotes cuenta con 3 años de experiencia en el rubro y menciona que invertirá el dinero en la compra de arroz, fideo y azúcar ya que una buena parte del capital fue invertido en la compra de frutas secas y condimentos, es muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Carolina is from the city of La Paz. She lived in an area called Ernesto Torres before she came to the Llojeta area. Llojeta is a very busy area in our city. She has two school age children, ages four and ten. She is not married, but she is in a common-law marriage. She has been selling groceries for three years. She says that she will use the loan to buy rice, noodles, and sugar. A good part of the money was used to buy dried fruits and condiments. She is a very hard-worker. She is very grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries wholesale

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 37 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja Moisés de 40 años y de sus 4 pequeños hijos, y juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Con los primeros rayos del sol, cada día esta trabajadora mujer se despierta para empezar la faena agrícola, junto a su esposo, pues siembran juntos papa, arvejas, maíz y diferentes verduras. Pese a que esta labor debe ser constante, así evitaran que las plagas de insectos y los factores climáticos echen a perder toda su producción, ya que depende de ello para obtener regulares ganancias. Dice que recibe ingresos adicionales cuando ella misma traslada sus productos, sin intermediarios, sin embargo no le gusta cargar los pesados sacos hasta la movilidad y de ahí a los mercados. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, pues quiere convertirse en una de las mejores productoras de su zona. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y se compromete a pagar puntualmente con sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.  Flor tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes que necesita para asegurar su producción en la siguiente siembra, con el fin de obtener productos naturales de calidad.
texts.en:
Flor, age 37, lives in her own house. She lives with her 40 year old husband, Moisés, and their four young children. They work hard every day to get ahead. At the first light of day this hard-working mother gets up to start the agricultural chores with her husband. Together they plant potatoes, corn, and different vegetables. Because they work continually, they avoid insect infestation and the weather factors that cause the loss of all of their production. She depends upon the crops in order to get a steady income. She says that she gets additional income when she transports her products without intermediaries. However, she does not like to carry the heavy sacks to the vehicle and from there to the markets. As a very enterprising woman she plans to plant in greater quantity in the future. She wants to become one of the best producers in her area. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She pledges to make her payments on time. Also, she is very grateful to all of the people who make the loan possible. It allows her to keep working in the pursuit of progress. Flor plans to use the requested loan to buy various sacks of natural and chemical fertilizers. She needs them to assure her production for the next planting season. She wants to have natural, quality products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Maximo Federico

texts.es:
El Sr. Máximo Vive en la ciudad de el Alto La Paz, en la zona de Villa Dolores, la casa donde vive es familiar herencia de los suegros, el cliente es casado con la señora Daría  Ambos son de origen Yungueño cuentan con terrenos donde se plantan coca esta es una hoja originaria de nuestros ancestros, pero mucha gente consume como calmante a algunos dolores, también para  aliviar la fatiga, muchos turistas lo consumen por los malestares que ocasiona la altura.
El Sr. Máximo y su esposa  son comerciantes de coca llevan con esta actividad mas de 20 años y cuentan con toda la documentación respectiva para comercializar su producto. El crédito será destinado para la compra de alcohol y cigarrillos que son complementos en la venta de coca ya que los mismos cuentan con dos puestos de venta fijos uno en la ciudad de la paz y otro en la ciudad de cobija, el Sr. Se encuentra en la fotografía junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Máximo lives in the city of La Paz in the Villa Dolores area. The house where he lives was inherited from his mother and father-in-law. He is married to Daría. Both of them are from Yungueño, and they have some land where they plant coca. This leaf originated from our ancesters. But, many people consume it as a pain killer. It is also used to relieve fatigue. Many toursists use it for the ocasional discomfort from the altitude. Máximo and his wife are coca merchants, and they have been doing this for over 20 years. They have all of the documentation to sell their product. The loan will be to buy alcohol and cigarrettes, which compliment coca sales. They have two fixed sales locations. One is in the city of La Paz, and the other is in the city of Cobija. He can be seen in the photo with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 54 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de 2 de sus 3 hijos, porque el mayor trabaja en la ciudad, y juntos habitan en un tranquilo paraje de la sierra peruana. Desde que era muy joven observaba a los miembros de su comunidad como trabajaban en la tierra, y así aprendió a cultivar. En la actualidad siembra arvejas, maíz y papa, para realizar esta labor cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, que trabajan esforzadamente la tierra cuando no estudian. Dice que el trabajo de campo es algo tedioso, y que los resultados se aprecian cuando empieza la temporada de cosecha, pero que las ganancias son regulares ya que toda su producción la vende a los comerciantes mayoristas que saben de la calidad de sus productos naturales, y llegan a comprarle toda su producción. Además le gusta mucho vigilar y cuidar bien sus campos para obtener una fructífera cosecha; y como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene pensado sembrar en mayor cantidad , sobretodo papa y arveja, para obtener mayores ganancias. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y promete cumplir puntualmente con cada una de sus cuotas, además dice que le gusta el trabajo organizado de su grupo comunal, ya que todos los integrantes son muy responsables. Juana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de abono y semilla de arveja para mejorar la calidad de su producción y de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Juana, age 54, lives in her own house with two of her three children. Her oldest child lives in the city. They live together in a peaceful spot on the Peruvian mountain range. When she was very young she observed how the members of the community worked on the land. That was how she learned to work the land for growing crops. She currently plants peas, corn, and potatoes. Her children help her with this work. They put great effort into their work when they are not studying. She says that the fieldwork is somewhat tedious. But, she appreciates it when the harvest season starts. She has a steady income because she sells all of her production to the wholesale merchants. They know the quality of her natural products, and they come to buy all of her production. Also, she really likes keeping an eye on her crops and taking care of them in order to get a fruitful harvest. As a very enterprising woman, she plans to plant in greater quantity in the future. She will plant potatoes and peas most of all in order to get greater earnings. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She pledges to make each one of her payments on time. Also, she says that she likes the organized work of her communal bank. All of the members are very responsible. Juana plans to use the requested loan to buy fertilizer and pea seeds to improve the quality of her production. That way she hopes to continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pea seeds

loans.name: Isidro Ramón

texts.es:
El  Señor  Isidro  es de la compañía  Cerro P. de Carapeguá es separado tiene  2  hijos ambos  mayores de edad, presta servicios de gomería,  anexo lavadero. 
 Es un señor muy trabajador, dicho emprendimiento inició desde el año 2000 y  se encuentra en constante crecimiento. 
 Tiene casa propia, en donde tiene montado su gomería, solicita el préstamo para tener mayor stock de mercaderías.

Con  el crédito  obtenido comprará llantas, cubiertas  y cámara.
texts.en:
Isidro is with the Cerro P. Company in Carapeguá. He is separated, and he has two children who are both adults. He has a tire repair shop with an attached laundry room. He is a very hard-working man. He started his enterprise in 2000, and it is constantly growing. He has his own house, which is where he has his tire repair shop. He is requesting the loan in order to have a greater stock of merchandise. He will use the loan to buy tires, covers, and inner tubes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires, covers, inner tubes, and other things

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, de 24 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, en compañía de ellos, y de sus 8 jóvenes hermanos, juntos habitan en un paraje de la sierra peruana y trabajan para salir adelante. Desde muy joven estudio mecánica, y aprendió en los diferentes trabajos donde se desempeñaba, observaba como trabajaban los mecánicos experimentados, y así adquirió experiencia. Este joven trabajador tiene su taller propio, donde labora a lado de un ayudante, y repara todo tipo de autos, pues su habilidad le ha permitido obtener gran cantidad de clientes, que siempre lo buscan por la calidad del servicio. Le gusta mucho su trabajo y como si fuera poco, también se dedica a la agricultura, pues siembra en compañía de sus hermanos, papa y arveja, que durante el tiempo de la cosecha venden a los mayoristas de la ciudad, y luego se reparten las regulares ganancias que obtienen. Aunque trabaja de lunes a viernes en su taller, no descansa los fines de semana, pues se dirige a las chacras de su familia a cuidar sus cultivos. Siendo un joven emprendedor, para el futuro tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de su taller, renovar las herramientas y contratar un ayudante más, ya que quiere ofrecer mayor variedad del servicio automotriz. 





Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y promete cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecido con las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.  
Luis tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de una maquina compresora para implementar mejor su taller de mecánica, y así espera mejorar el servicio que brinda.
texts.en:
Luis, age 24, lives with his parents and his eight young siblings in his parent’s house. They live together in a place on the Peruvian mountain range, and they work to get ahead. When he was very young he studied mechanics, and he learned the different jobs that are done. He observed how the experienced mechanics worked, and that is how he got experience. This hard-working young man has his own shop. He works with an assistant, and he repairs all types of automobiles. His ability has allowed him to have a lot of customers who always seek him out because of the quality of his service. He really likes his work. If that weren’t enough, he also works in agriculture. He and his siblings plant potatoes and peas. At harvest time they sell to the wholesalers in the city. Then they share the steady income that they get. Even though he works in his shop from Monday through Friday, he does not rest on the week-ends. He goes to his family’s fields to take care of the crops. As a young entrepreneur, he plans to improve the facilities of his shop, to repair his tools, and hire another helper. He wants to provide a greater variety of automotive service. This is his sixth loan with MFP. He pledges to make his payments on time. He is very grateful to the people who made this loan possible. It will allow him to continue working in the pursuit of progress. Luis plans to use the requested loan to buy a compressor in order to better outfit his mechanic shop. That way he hopes to improve the service that he offers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate his shop's facilities and buy new tools

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Carlos Cliente que vive en la ciudad de la paz,  en la zona denominada Tembladerani. La casa donde vive es familiar heredada por los Padres, cuenta con un niño de aproximadamente 4 años de edad es concubino con la señora Jaqueline  que se dedica a la venta de mariscos en los diferentes restaurantes de la zona sur. Nuestro cliente tiene como actividad principal el servicio de transporte mismo que lo viene realizando hace 4 años cuenta con dos móviles afiliados al sindicato litoral (trufis), el crédito será destinado a comprar un motor nuevo y realizar el chapeado de los vehículos como previsión para futuras fallas, el Sr. en la foto posa junto a su pareja.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos lives in the city of La Paz in an area called Tembladerani. The house where he lives is a family inheritance from his parents. He has a four year old son. He lives with Jaqueline, and she sells seafood to the different restaurants in the southern area. His main activity is providing transportation service. He has been doing this for four years, and he has two automobiles with the Litoral Syndicate (“trufis”: a taxi that travels along a specific route and has fixed stops). The loan is to buy a new motor and to veneer his two vehicles to prevent future problems He can be seen in the photo with his life partner.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance (buy a motor and veneers)

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
El señor Marcial es casado, con 66 años de edad, se dedica a  la compra y faenamiento de chanchos.
 Dicha actividad viene realizando desde la década de los 90.
Dicha actividad le genera buen ingreso y a través del ingreso que  le genera dicha actividad ha podido solventar los gastos de sus hijos que hoy en día ya no dependen más de él económicamente; todos son mayores de edad y tienen sus propios ingresos. 
Actualmente solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne de cerdo para satisfacer la demanda.
texts.en:
Marcial, age 66, is married. He buys and slaughters pigs. He has been doing this since the 90’s. This activity generates good income. Because of the income that is generated he was able to pay his children’s expenses. His children are no longer economically dependent upon him. They are adults with their own incomes. He is currently requesting the loan to buy pork to meet the demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: El Señor Freddy  se dedica al transporte publico desde hace tres años y medio con movilidad propia, actualmente vive en alquiler, pero tiene un lote que se ha comprando,  el señor trabaja mucho  es muy responsable en su trabajo y en sus pagos el realiza su trabajo en la ciudad de Cochabamba, este crédito es para aumentar la construcción de su vivienda, el recibe la ayuda de su esposa que trabaja como trabajadora del hogar desde hace nueve años, tiene tres hijos. El señor actualmente no tiene deudas y lo mas desea es ver su casita terminada por eso necesita comprar materias de construcción como cemento, pintura, etc. El esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Freddy has worked in public transportation for three and a half years with his own vehicle. He currently rents where he lives, but he has purchased a lot. He works a lot, and he is very responsible in his work and with his payments. He works in the city of Cochabamba. This loan is to do more construction on his house. His wife helps him; she has been a housewife for nine years. He has three children. He does not currently have any debts, and what he wants most of all is to see his little house completed. That is why he needs to buy construction materials like cement, and paint, etc. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have shown him in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a house

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María de 21 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de venta de embutidos. 

Empezó a los 14 años vendiendo legumbres con ayuda de su mama después que llegaba del colegio, poco a poco cuando creció consiguió un puesto en el mercado de su casa. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta 14h00pm, vende mortadelas a $ 2.10, chorizas a $ 1.50.     

Para seguir con su puesto de embutidos ella quiere comprar embutidos con el préstamo, en el futuro quiere tener su propia tienda, y una tienda de embutidos para asegurar su juventud.
texts.en:
María, age 21, lives in the Perimetral de Guayaquil (suburban area bordered by a salt water stream). She has a stand in the market, and she sells sausage. Fourteen years ago, with her mother’s help, she started selling vegetables when she got home from school. Little by little, when she was grown she got her own stand close to her house. She now works from eight in the morning until two in the afternoon. She sells bologna for $2.10 and sausage for $1.50.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sausages

loans.name: Rosa Liduvina

texts.es:
Rosa de 53 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (en una zona urbana, con una ecología en construcción). Tiene una ferretería (lugar donde venden artículos, herramientas, materias le construcción).

Ella comenzó con la ayuda de un amigo de su hijo, que le vendiendo algunas herramientas para que venda, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar algunos artículos de hogar y comenzar a vender en un local, ahora ella trabaja con ayuda de su hijo desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer, veden pinturas, herramientas, materiales de construcción etc. 

Para poder continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo pinturas, arenas, herramientas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener otra ferretería en el sector donde vive.
texts.en:
Rosa is fifty-three and lives in Las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (in an urban area with a recovering ecology). She has a hardware store (where they sell home products, tools, and construction materials). She started out with help from her son's friend, who sold her tools for resale. Little by little and with effort, she was able to buy some home products and start selling from a locale. Now she works with the aid of her son from very early to nightfall. They sell paints, tools, construction materials, etc. Rosa wants to use her loan to buy paints, sand, and tools so she can keep her business going. In the future she would like to have another hardware store around where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paints, sand, tools.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 55 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposa Dionicia de 55 años y con el menor de sus 7 hijos, pues el resto son mayores y viven independientes. Se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, recuerda como los miembros de su comunidad se ayudaban mutualmente en sus chacras, y por eso sabe que trabajando en equipo las cosas salen mejor. En la actualidad siembra papa y arvejas en sus chacras que son propias, junto a sus hijos mayores que le ayudan, luego de días de sacrificada labor reciben la recompensa que es una buena  producción de calidad. Como son varios los miembros de su familia no necesitan la ayuda de operarios, además dice que gracias al trabajo agrícola ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, y por eso lo considera un trabajo rentable, aunque no siempre obtiene una buena producción, por las plagas o el clima, dice que siempre se gana algo de dinero de la comercialización a los mayoristas de la ciudad. Además también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, que vende cuando se le presenta alguna dificultad económica. Siendo un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado comprar algunas reses, pues quiere ampliar este negocio. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible dicho préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso, además esta muy satisfecho con la labor que desempeña su grupo comunal, que siempre buscan que ayudarse mutuamente. Manuel tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de arveja y abono que necesita para mejorar su producción, pues se acerca  la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 55, lives in his own house with his wife, 55 year old Dionicia, and with the youngest of their seven children. The rest of the children are adults and live independently. He has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He remembers how the members of his community mutually helped each other on their farms. That is why he knows that when working as a team things turn out better. He currently plants potatoes and peas on his own fields, and his older children help him. After days of working and sacrificing they receive their recompense with a good, quality production. As they have a lot of members in their family, they do not need help from laborers. Also, he says that thanks to the agricultural work he has managed to get his children ahead. Therefore, he considers it to be a profitable for him. Even though he does not always have good production because of the pests or the climate, he says that he always earns something from selling to the wholesalers in the city. He also raises cattle, and he sells them when he has financial difficulties. Being an enterprising man, he plans to buy some cows in the future; he wants to expand this business. This is his third loan with MFP. He is very grateful to all of the people who made this loan possible. The loan will allow him to keep working and pursuing progress. Also, he is very happy with the work that his communal bank does. They are always helping each other. Manuel plans to use the requested loan to buy several sacks of pea seeds and fertilizer that he needs to improve his production. The next planting season is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: El Nuevo Club Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. ELIZABETH TIENE 27 AÑOS Y TIENE TRES PEQUEÑOS HIJOS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "EL NUEVO CLUB" INTEGRADO POR 8 PERSONAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO DE COMAS. SUS COMPAÑEROS LA ELIGIERON COMO SECRETARIA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE CUATRO MESES ADQUIRIÓ UNA MOTOTAXI QUE LA TRABAJA PARA EL SERVICIO DE TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS, ANTERIORMENTE SU PAREJA ALQUILABA UNA MOTO PARA TRABAJAR, CON LO QUE JUNTABA DEL SERVICIO DEL DÍA Y DESCONTANDO EL PAGO DEL ALQUILER PUDO ADQUIRI SU PROPIA MOTO. ÉSTE ES SU ÚNICO SUSTENTO FAMILIAR POR LO QUE SE DEDICAN A TIEMPO COMPLETO.
SU PROXIMA META SERÁ COMPRAR OTRA MOTO, PARA QUE CADA UNO ES DECIR SU LA SRA. ELIZABETH Y SU PAREJA PUEDAN TRABAJAR.
EL PRESTAMO SOLLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE ROPA PARA NIÑOS, YA QUE TIENE PEDIDOS DE SUS AMIGOS Y CONOCIDOS.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 21 years old, and she has three small children. She is part of “El Nuevo Club” (The New Club) Communal Bank, which is comprised of eight people who live in the Comas district. Her colleagues selected her to be secretary of the group’s executive board. Four months ago she got a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) that is used for passenger transportation. Her life partner previously rented a moto in order to work. With what he got together from the daily service, and without having to pay to rent, he was able to get his own moto. This is the family’s only means of support, so they work full time. Her next goal will be to buy another moto so that both Elizabeth and her life partner can work. The requested loan is to buy clothes for the children. She has orders from her friends and acquaintances.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's winter clothes to start selling children's clothes

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, de 28 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Eduardo de 36 años, y de su pequeño hijo Luis de 3 años. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, aprendió las técnicas del cultivo ayudando en la labor a sus padres, luego cuando formó su propia familia empezó a trabajar junto a su esposo. Dice que la labor de campo es muy sacrificada, pues siembra papa y arveja en sus chacras propias, y debe vigilar sus cultivos todos los días, desde muy temprano, para cuidarlos de las plagas de insectos y de las inclemencias del tiempo que muchas veces afectan y atacan sus cultivos y echan a perder la mayor parte de la producción. Lo que no le gusta es cargar, junto con su esposo, los pesados sacos de productos naturales, para llevarlos a comercializar hasta los mercados de la ciudad, aunque asegura que obtiene regulares ganancias de las ventas al por mayor. Como es una mujer emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado aumentar su producción de arvejas, además quiere comprar reses para criarlo y luego venderlo a mayor precio. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y promete ser puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar progresando. Marleni tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes pues desea mejorar sus cultivos para producir en mayor cantidad y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marleni is 28 years old, lives in her own home with her husband Eduardo who is 36 years old, and their small son Luis who is 3 years old. She has been dedicated to agriculture from a very young age. She learned cultivating techniques by helping her parents, then she formed her own family and began working with her husband. She says working in the fields is very demanding since she grows potatoes and peas in her own small farm and must keep an eye on the crops daily, from very early in the morning to protect it from pests and insects and the harshness of the weather that many times affect and attack their crops ruining the majority of the production. What she does not like is carrying, along with her husband, the large sacs of natural products to take them to sell all the way to the markets in the the city in spite of assuring that she earns regular profits by selling wholesale. Since she is an aspiring woman she plans to increase her pea production in the future. In addition she wants to buy and raise cows and then eventually sell them at the highest price possible. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual and responsible in her loan payments. She is also very thankful for all of the people who made this loan possible that will allow her to continue progressing. Marleni plans using the requested loan to buy fertilizer to improve her crops and produce the greatest quantity possible and obtain optimal profits.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a 43-year-old mother of three who lives with her husband and children in La Peregrina, La Uruca, Costa Rica. Shirley runs a store out of the garage attached to her house. She has dedicated the past six years to her business where she sells various articles such as party decorations, personal hygiene products, books and photocopying services. Shirley plans to use this loan to increase her working capital. For health reasons, she has not been able to find a steady job, reducing her ability to make contributions to her working capital. This loan will be used to purchase various products to fill Shirley´s store.

Business hours are from 7AM to 8PM. Shirley juggles the tasks of taking care of her children (one of her children is three years old) and running her business. Her main obstacle is a lack of access to working capital. Shirley's goal is to get business back to the way things used to be, a store full of products and clients. This loan will help to address this challenge.

loans.use: To purchase various products to sell at her store (party decorations, books).

loans.name: Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “KANTUTA” es una asociación antigua que esta iniciando su crédito número catorce, es parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, tiene como presidenta a la señora Gimena.

Doña Gimena al igual que el resto de sus compañeras, es una socia que ha renovado vA. veces el crédito.  Su negocio es la venta de ropa de forma ambulante desde hace cinco años. El crédito que está solicitando actualmente es por la suma de Bs. 4500.- el mismo que invertirá en la compra de mercadería.

Por otro lado las integrantes de la asociación comunal esta conformado por diez mujeres y un varón. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de garrafas, venta de batidos, venta de Tarjetas de teléfono y artículos varios, atención de Internet y trabajos en macramé.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kantuta" is a long-established group that is starting its 14th loan cycle. It is part of the Pro Mujer central office in Villa Exaltacion. Gimena is the president of the group. Gimena, along with the rest of her group members, has taken loans on a number of different occasions. She is a street vendor who has been selling clothing for 5 years. She is now requesting a loan of 4,500 Bolivianos which she will invest in the purchase of merchandise. This central bank is comprised of 10 women and one man. They have a variety of businesses such as the sale of: clothing, cosmetics, food, carafes, milkshakes, telephone cards and other items, internet services and items made of macrame.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, de 22 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su pareja Gabriel de 28 años y de sus 2 pequeños hijos, habitan juntos en un paraje de la sierra central del Perú. Se dedica a la agricultura, y junto a su esposo vigila desde muy temprano sus cultivos de  papa, arvejas y olluco en sus chacras que posee. Dice que le gusta mucho su labor, aunque debe ser muy dedicada, porque este trabajo es arduo, ya que debe de pasar largas horas en el campo soportando las inclemencias del tiempo, pero dice que le gusta mucho sembrar porque luego la recompensa a su sacrificada labor es cuando recoge una producción de calidad que vende a regulares precios a los mayoristas de la ciudad. Además paralelamente a la agricultura también se dedica a la crianza de carneros, que luego  de criarlos comercializa a mayores precios. Como es una joven madre de familia muy trabajadora para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, para aumentar sus ganancias. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y promete que será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con los integrantes de su grupo comunal que confiaron en incluirlo en el grupo, además esta muy agradecido con las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Miriam tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos, pues quiere vender más para mejorar sus ganancias, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Miriam, 22, lives in her own house with her life partner, Gabriel, 28, and their two small children. They live together in a settlement in Perú’s central mountain range. She’s a farmer. She and her husband watch over their potato, broad bean and olluco (a tuber) crops in their fields from very early in the morning. She says that she enjoys her work very much although she has to be very diligent because the work is arduous and she must spend long hours withstanding the inclemency of the weather. However, she likes planting very much because the reward for her longsuffering work is when she reaps a quality harvest that she sells for good prices to wholesalers in the city. Besides the farming, she also raises sheep that she can sell for good prices once she fattens them up. Because she’s a young, hard working mother, her plans for the future are to plant larger amounts to increase her profits. This is her 7th loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with her repayments because she doesn’t want to disappoint her fellow group members who trusted her enough to include her in the group. Besides, she’s very grateful to all the people who funded the loan that will allow her to continue to work. Miriam plans to use the requested funds to buy several sacks of fertilizer and manure that she needs to increase crop productivity because she wants to sell more to increase profits thereby continuing to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Yorleni

texts.en:
Yorleni is a 37-year-old single mother who lives with her daughter in San José, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Yorleni sells various products to acquaintances and members of her community in order to earn a living.  She sells perfumes, cosmetics, clothing and pajamas, among other products. Yorleni also works in a local supermarket as a hair product promoter to complement her sales earnings and better support her daughter.
Yorleni currently has clients asking for products. The problem is that Yorleni lacks the working capital to make investments in the products she needs. She plans to use this loan to finance the purchase of inventory items so she can meet the demands of her clients.  Yorleni works from 8-12 at the supermarket promoting hair products. After that, she picks up her daughter and dedicates the rest of the afternoon to her sales business (making sales, collecting payments, delivering items). 

Yorleni has simple goals for the future. She would like to rid her house of problems, improve her microenterprise and own her own business. At the moment, though she is self-employed, Yorleni does not have a central location where clients can come and peruse the items she has for sale. A major problem for Yorleni is the neighborhood she lives in. She says she is surrounded by delinquents, she doesn´t get along with her neighbors and certain members of her family have drug problems.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, clothing and other saleable products.

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia L. is 52 and married with four children. Her business activity is planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Leonia has many years of experience in this business. Leonia needs a loan to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve the business.

In 2007, Leonia joined SPBD. This is her fourth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Leonia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Leafa

texts.en: Leafa I. is 40 and married with six children whose ages range from 6 to 22 years old. She plants and harvests taro for sale. Leafa has many years of experience in this business. Leafa needs a loan of 1,500 Samoan talas to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or $250 per week) to improve/expand the business. In 2007, Leafa joined SPBD. This is her third loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Leafa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.
