texts.en: Lulia J. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and fresh fried cassava at the market and is requesting a loan to stock sweet potatoes and bread to sell. Lulia is 24 years old and is married, with a husband who is a peasant. She has two children who both go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock sweet potatoes and bread to sell

loans.name: Siyama

texts.en: Siyama M. is currently in the business of selling crates of beer, white wine, Heineken, etc. in the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Siyama is 41 years old and is married, with a husband who is a teacher. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for her children.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal and some bags of maize to sell. Rose is 38 years old and is married, with a husband who is a businessman. She has two children who both go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a charcoal store.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal and some bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia G. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, onions, cooking oil and Irish potatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and cooking oil to sell. Cecilia is 41 years old and married, with a husband who is a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by stocking more goods such as maize flour and beans to sell.

loans.use: To stock more tomatoes and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Reality Group

texts.en:
Miaseme K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of three borrowers called Reality. Miaseme is 27 years old, single, and was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support.

For 5 years, she has been selling slippers in Clara Town in Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her LRD 20,000 portion of this LRD 50,000 business loan to buy more slippers.

She describes herself as jovial and easy-going. Her dream is to improve her business, make a profit, and open a petroleum filling station.

loans.use: To buy more slippers for resale

loans.name: Awate

texts.en:
Awate J. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant to sell.  

Awate is 36 years old and married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and more timber

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce P. is currently in the business of selling various items in a retail shop, such as boxes of tobacco, soap, etc. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar and salt to sell.  

Joyce is 31 years old and married to a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children and provide them with necessary scholastic materials.

loans.use: Stock more bags of sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is married with four children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.

Harriet owns a beauty salon in Busega, in Lubaga Division, Kampala district, and works upon all types of hair, like relaxing, plaiting, hot combing and weaving. Harriet wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of hair relaxers, cosmetics and weaves. She receives an average of 10 customers a day. She buys boxes of cosmetics from Kampala city shops, and uses public transport to and from shopping. Besides this salon business, she has started selling second hand clothes at her salon to get additional income. She works seven days a week.

Her business challenges includes transportation of boxes of cosmetics, relaxers, and weaves from Kikuubo to her salon in Busega. She aspires to going directly to manufactures for cosmetics. She decided to join MCDT because she wanted to acquire additional capital for her business. Harriet resides in, and rents, a two roomed house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics, weaves, and hair relaxers.

loans.name: God’S Blessing Group

texts.en:
Abel T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of two borrowers called God’s Blessing. Abel is 32, married, and has three children who range from 5 months to 8 years old.

He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 4 years, he has been selling soap, candles, milk, candy, copy books, ink pens, envelopes, mosquito spray, etc. in Doe’s Community in Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 25,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian dollars business loan to buy more cartons of soap, candles, milk, candy, copy books, ink pens, envelopes, mosquito spray, etc.

He describes himself as easy-going. His goal is to improve his business, make a profit and open a shop.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of soap, candles, milk, candy, copy books, ink pens, envelopes, mosquito spray, etc.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en: Maka H. is currently in the business of baking and selling local Sudanese bread (gelebia & lagemat) at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour. Maka is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a security guard. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more baking flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Rose is 52 years old and is widowed. She has 7 children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a family house for her children.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan W. is currently in the business of selling bread, groundnut paste, and fried eggs at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock fresh fish and more eggs to sell. Susan is 29 years old and is married to a husband who is a plumber. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

loans.use: To stock fresh fish and more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Chicken Wing And Dry Goods Group

texts.en:
Alex N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of two borrowers called Chicken Wing and Dry Goods. Alex is 31, married, and has two children who range from 10 to 13 years old.

He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 8 years, he has been selling pig feet in Duala Market in Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 25,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 55,000 Liberian dollars business loan to buy more cartons of pig feet.

He describes himself as determined. His goal is to grow his business, make a profit, and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of pig feet.

loans.name: Juan Carlos Ricardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan Carlos de 37 años de edad, y su esposa la Sra. Roxana que conviven hace 15 años cuentan con  cuatro hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, actualmente alquilan un lote ubicado en el barrio Tierras Nuevas, donde ahi mismo tiene su casa y su taller. 

El Sr. Juan Carlos es mecanico hace 14 años quien gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo consiguio comprarse un micro y un lote. su  esposa Roxana se dedica a la fabrica de sobres para correspondencia y luego los entrega a distintas librerias de la ciudad, y tambien administra la renta de su linea N° 16 ayudando a si mismo a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

El Sr. Juan Carlos es cliente antiguo de la institucion siempre tuvo un  buen comportamiento de pago. El credito que se le otorgo es para la contruccion de su vivienda ya que ellos cuentan con un lote propio."los señores estan muy agradecidos por el trato que recibieron y la facilidad del credito".
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 37 years old, and his wife Roxana who have been together 15 years, now have four children who are all school-age. They currently rent a lot in the Tierras Nuevas neighborhood, where he has his house and workshop. Juan Carlos has been a mechanic for 14 years and, thanks to his job and his effort, has managed to buy a lot and a minibus. His wife Roxana makes envelopes, which she then sells to different bookstores in the city, and she also manages the income from his N° 16 bus line, helping her husband with household expenses. Juan Carlos is a longstanding customer of this institution, and he has always had a good payment history. The loan he was granted is for construction on his home since they now have their own land. The family is very grateful for the treatment they have received and the ease of the loan process.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Cesar vive en la localidad de el Torno, Barrio Bolivia, de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, su esposa con la cual tiene tres hijos, es de ocupación educadora hace dos años en un colegio de la comunidad, su actividad principal es el servicio de fotocopiadora hace unos 15 años,  el destino del crédito es para comprar materiales para su negocio y mantenimiento de su vehículo, el cual le ayuda para entregar sus pedidos, y también trabaja como taxi urbano en la ciudad de anta cruz capital, sus hijos se encuentran en edad escolar, por lo tanto los costo de la colegiatura de sus hijos dependen de su negocio de la fotocopiadora, por tal motivo sus ingreso no son suficiente para mantener a su familia, por ende su esposa  tiene que trabajar y así ayudar a su esposo en su economía, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Cesar lives in El Torno, Barrio Bolivia, Santa Cruz. He and his wife have three children. His wife has been a teacher for two years at a local school. For about 15 years his main activity has been providing photocopying services. The loan will be used to buy supplies for his business and for maintenance and repair costs for his vehicle which he uses to deliver his orders. He also works providing urban taxi services in the city of Santa Cruz. His children are all school age and school tuition costs are covered by profits from his photocopying service business. His income is insufficient to support his family and this is why his wife has to work to help her husband meet expenses. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy photocopying supplies.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector El Verde, un área rural perteneciente al distrito de Jayanca, uno de los distritos agrícolas que pertenecen a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores relacionadas con la agricultura desde que era joven, el cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar granos como maíz, de la cosecha de este producto depende el sustento de la economía de su familia por lo que siempre se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajo para así poder obtener una buena cosecha.

Manuel desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para poder brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. Gracias a las acciones que realizará con este préstamo tendrámas posibilidades de obtener una buena consecha.

Manuel es un padre bastante entregado a su familia, siempre se esfuerza a diario para poder brindarles el bienestar y la calidad de vida que ellos necesitan. Anteriormente ya ha tenido préstamos con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 47-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in El Verde, a rural area that is part of Jayanca district, one of Lambayeque province’s agricultural districts, located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Since he was a young man he has worked in agriculture. He has a field where he grows corn. His family’s support depends on this harvest so he always puts in the maximum effort into his work in order to obtain a good crop yield. Manuel wants to acquire fertilizers and pesticides to provide maintenance to his crop and to reach this goal he has deemed it convenient to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Thanks to the actions he’ll be able to take with the loan he will have more possibilities of getting a good harvest. Manuel is a father who is quite dedicated to his family. He always tries every day to provide them with wellbeing and the quality of life they need. He has had prior loans with Our Institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility where repayments are concerned.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for corn crop maintenance.

loans.name: Susana Amalia

texts.es:
Susana de 25 años, ella vive en una zona periurbana en la Primavera de Duran,  ella tiene una papelería en el Ecuador se les llama “bazar”.

Con la motivación de mantener a su hijo de 4 años tuvo que invertir sus ahorros para comprar papelería y comenzar a venderla a sus conocidos. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm en su propio negocio. Una de las dificultades es la falta de tiempo y la delincuencia que ahora hay en el sector, por eso tuvo que poner rejas en su negocio (como aparece en la foto). 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y papelería para su negocio, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
25-year old Susana lives in a suburban area called Primavera de Duran. She runs a stationery store which in Ecuador is called a ‘bazaar’. Motivated by the need to provide for her 4-year old son, Susana had to invest all her savings in buying merchandise and sell it to acquaintances. She works from 8am to 8pm. One of the problems she faces is a lack of time and also the petty crime in the area. Because of this, she has had bars put on her business (as shown in the photo). With the loan Susana will buy notebooks, pens, and stationery for her store. Her future goal is to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pens and stationery

loans.name: Mwatumu

texts.en:
Mwatumu B. is forty-three years old, married, and has three children aged between twenty and fourteen years old. Her business is located at Kakamega.

She has been selling vegetables for the last ten years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable, and the major challenge she has is these goods are highly perishable, and because she does not have any refrigeration facility, the vegetables go bad. There is also scarcity of vegetables during dry seasons, making them expensive for the consumers. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 15,000 to buy more vegetables to expand her business.

She hopes to grow her business and be able to supply a variety of groceries. She describes herself as ambitious, polite, and patient.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Julia Alexandrina

texts.es:
Julia de 62 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona urbana, con una ecología en reconstrucción), ella tiene una pequeña tienda de confites. 

Tuvo su negocio porque en el sector por donde vive no había tienda de confites ni de dulces, comenzó a vender dulces y confites, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su propio local, ahora se levanta a las 08h00am hasta las 17h00 todos los días. 

Para poder continuar con mas clientela el necesita comprar con el préstamo confites y dulces y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener mas locales de dulces.
texts.en:
Julia, 62, lives in La Primavera de Duran (an urban zone that is recovering ecologically). She has a small sweets shop. She opened her business because there were neither sweets nor candy shops in her neighborhood. She started to sell candy and sweets and gradually was able to have her own store. Now, she is open for business daily from 8am until 5pm. To continue expanding her customer base she needs a loan to buy more sweets and candies to meet their demand. In the future she’d like to have more candy stores.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For sweets.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan moved to the US from Ecuador five years ago. He knew he wanted to start a franchise business and found that the cleaning business was the most affordable. In 2007, he started his own cleaning business and has been running it with his wife.

With ACCION USA’s help, Juan was able to receive his first loan in 2009 to purchase cleaning equipment. Now, Juan is refinancing his loan in order to bring his business to a new level. He is looking to purchase equipment, sign new client contracts, and launch a multimedia marketing campaign and website.

Juan is optimistic that these strategies will help him gain more clients. He is looking to expand his business beyond his local community. The loan will also help him sign larger contracts, which will generate higher revenues for Juan’s business.

Being self-employed and generating income for his family have been Juan’s greatest successes. He has great pride in providing for his wife and two young daughters. Juan enjoys managing his own business and loves the flexibility of his work. 


About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA
Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and launch a multi-media marketing campaign

loans.name: Johana Estefany

texts.es:
Johana reside en el cantón santa Elena Departamento de Usulután, vive con su mama y un hermano de la edad de 17 años ellos depende de los ingresos que ella obtiene con las artesanías.
El negocio lo inicio hace tres años gracias a una amiga que le enseño a diseñar los collares gallardetes entre otras cosas de mercería puso su negocio por la situación económica en que vive para obtener más ingreso, el puesto lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal de santa Elena.
El crédito lo invertirá en compra de collares pulseras aretes y materiales para elaborarlos ella misma.
Esto le ayudara a tener más variedad de artesanías para atraer a los clientes y de esta forma obtener más ingresos.
Sus aspiraciones es tener un negocio más fuerte con mas cliente que la demanda sea muy buena de esta forma mejorar las condicione de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Johana resides in the Santa Elena district of the Department of Usulután. She lives with her mother and seventeen-year-old brother. They depend on the income she brings in with her crafts. She started her business three years ago thanks to a friend that taught her how to design necklaces, pennants, and notions. She went into business because her economic situation required her to bring in more income. She has a stand at the Santa Elena city market. Johana plans to use her loan to buy necklaces, bracelets, earrings, and supplies to make her own products. This will help give her more variety in her handmade offerings so she can attract customers and earn more income. Johana's aspirations include having a stronger business with more customers so demand will be high, allowing her to improve living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy necklaces, bracelets, earrings, and materials for making jewelry.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Cañete Cue Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá Compañía Cañete Cue.
El Comité está integrada por  señoras muy trabajadoras y activas este Comité está en el noveno ciclo dentro del Programa Comité de Mujeres.  
Este grupo es muy unido y trabaja en forma conjunta ellas no presentan inconvenientes con el pago de sus cuotas ni en relacionamiento entre ellas.
Ellas se encuentran muy satisfechas con el programa ya que encuentran apoyo para trabajar, y de esa manera fomentar las  actividades que realizan para ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Feliciana, quien es una mujer muy activa y realiza todo tipo de trabajo con sus compañeras para fortalecer el grupo con sus compañeras.
Ella es ama de casa y tiene un pequeño negocio que atiende en su domicilio.P
Comente que el negocio le ayuda con la alimentación de la familia que es lo más importante, y los ingresos de su parece lo utilizan para otros gastos. 
Desea invertir en su negocio y solicita el préstamo para la compra de fideos, azúcar, aceite, arroz y otros para contar nuevamente con mercaderías suficientes para sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Carapeguá, Cañete Cue. The committee is composed of hard working, active women. The committee is in its 9th cycle within the Women’s Committee Program. This group is very unified and works together. None of them has any problem neither with repayments of loan installments nor with their relationships among themselves. They are very satisfied with the program because in it they find support to work and ways to encourage the activities they are involved in to help their families. One of the members is Feliciana who is a very active woman and performs all sorts of tasks with her fellow members in order to strengthen the group. She is a housewife and has a small store in her home. She stated that the store helps her provide food for her family, which is the most important thing, and also helps cover other expenses. She wants to invest in her store and needs the loan to buy noodles, sugar, cooking oil, rice and others to once again have sufficient stock for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy noodles, rice, flour, cooking oil, cleaning supplies, etc.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.es: El Señor Juanito es un cliente relativamente nuevo, ya que anteriormente el trabajo como garante de su mama, quien ahora ella le garantiza en su crédito, el Sr. Juanito se dedica al transporte publico como primera actividad y los fines de semana  es músico, toca en una banda en las fiestas de las zonas, el vive con su esposa y una hija pequeña, ahora solicita este crédito para la compra de llantas y otros repuestos para el mantenimiento de su transporte, en el anterior crédito adelanto sus ultimas cuotas por lo que se solicita este financiamiento kiva, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecido con la institución.
texts.en:
Señor Juanito is a relatively new client as his mother previously acted as guarantor for the loan. Driving a taxi is his main job, but he is also a musician at weekends playing in a band at local festivals. He lives with his wife and young daughter. Juanito is asking for a loan to buy tires and other spare parts for his vehicle. In the last loan cycle he moved his last repayments forward, so now he is asking for another loan from Kiva. He is a hardworking individual and very grateful to the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Yainkain

texts.en:
This is 31 year-old Yainkain. She is married, and has 2 children aged 6 years and under one year. She has 3 additional dependents, who live with her because they need assistance, since one comes from a divorced home and the other 2 from a village where facilities for good education are not available.

In the year 2000, Yainkain established her hair dressing and cosmetics business. She began this business because she wants to fight poverty; she started as an apprentice and later opened her own business. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 1,261,500 SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Yainkain requires a loan in order to buy synthetic hair, perming cream, and shampoos. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 252,300SLL. In the future, Yainkain plans to provide everything her customers may need in her salon. Yainkain hopes to utilize this loan well and repay it. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more hair products.

loans.name: Nancy Prudencia

texts.es: La Sra. Nancy tiene un negocio ubicado en la zona de el tejar, donde vende fruta de temporada al por mayor, ella rescata de los camiones viajeros y lo vende a segunda mano, ella tiene una casita que recién la construyo en la zona de alto Ovejuyo, donde vive juntamente con el esposo y sus hijos quienes estudian en la universidad, uno de ellos ya es independiente , el esposo es transportista de taxi particular, realiza viajes a los yungas en algunas épocas y en la mayoría trabaja c como taxista libre, es una cliente antigua y muy responsable anteriormente fue cliente kiva por lo que se solicita nuevamente este crédito, con el dinero del crédito comprara frutas como papaya, mandarina , coco, etc. y con el resto del dinero lo utilizara en el mantenimiento de la movilidad de su esposo,  la Sra. Nancy es una persona muy trabajadora siempre velando por el bienestar de su familia, en la foto la Sra. Nancy se encuentra acompañada de su Sr. esposo.
texts.en:
Nancy has a business in the El Tejar zone where she sells seasonal fruit at wholesale. She acquires it from passing trucks and resells it. She has a small house she recently built in Alto Ovejuyo where she lives with her husband and children who are university students. One of them is already independent. Her husband is a private taxi driver who makes trips to Los Yungas (The Yungas is a stretch of forest along the eastern slope of the Andes Mountains from southeastern Peru through central Bolivia) during some seasons but mostly works as an on-call taxi. She is a long-standing, responsible client who has been a Kiva client in the past. She is once again asking for a Kiva loan to buy fruits like papaya, mandarin oranges, coconut, etc. The rest of the money will be used for her husband’s vehicle maintenance and repair. Nancy is a very hard working person who is always watchful of her family’s wellbeing. Nancy’s husband appears with her in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mariuxi Janeth

texts.es:
Mariuxi de 32 años, ella es vendedora de productos naturales y vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil. 

A Mariuxi siempre le gusto la medicina pero por la falta de oportunidades y de dinero no estudio lo que tanto había querido, fue hay que decidió trabajar vendiendo productos naturales en su propio local desde la mañana hasta el anochecer. 

Para poder surtir mas su negocio con los productos naturales ella quiere comprar con el préstamo medicinas y productos naturales. En el futuro quiere agrandar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Mariuxi, 32 years old, sells natural products and lives in an urban area, in Las Orquídeas in Guayaquil. Mariuxi always liked medicine, but because of a lack of opportunity and money she did not study what she wanted so much to do. She then decided to work selling natural products in her own shop from morning until evening. To better stock her business, she wants to buy medicines and natural products with this loan. In the future she would like to expand her business more.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural products

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La Sra. Marta A. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá,  Barrió Santa Margarita, tiene un hijo adolecente en edad escolar.

         Marta es vendedora de ropas y otros productos artesanales como edredones, colchas, mantas, ponchos, hace varios años que realiza este trabajo por la zona de Carapeguá y compañías vecinas, comenta que tiene varios clientes y este trabajo le genera buen  ingreso y esto le ayuda a aumentar su  ingreso.

        También es empleada doméstica, trabajo que la ayuda a obtener otro ingreso ya que su hijo se encuentra estudiando en el colegio y requiere de recurso económico para ir terminando sus estudios.

         Con el crédito  obtenido comprará  edredones, colchas, ponchos, mantas y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta A. is from the city of Carapeguá, Barrió Santa Margarita. She has a teenage son of school age. Marta sells clothing and other hand-crafted products like comforters, bedspreads, blankets, and ponchos. She has been doing this work for several years in the Carapeguá area and neighboring areas. She says that she has several customers and that this work earns her a good amount of money, and this helps her to increase her income. She is also a domestic worker, a job which helps her to earn more income since her son is studying in secondary school, and she needs the economic resources so he can complete his studies. With this loan she will buy comforters, bedspreads, ponchos, blankets and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase comforters, bedspreads, ponchos, blankets and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING BLOUSES, SKIRTS, AND BRASSIERES, ETC., TO AUGMENT HIS BUSINESS INVENTORY

loans.name: Maria Francisca Alicia

texts.es:
María resiD. en mercedes Umaña Departamento D. Usulután, es V. y vive con una hija y una nieta, tiene una tienda y todas ellas dependen D. estos ingresos.
la tienda la inicio su hija hace quince años ahora la administra nía maría por la situación económica ellas decidieron solicitar el crédito para aumentar su mercadería.
el crédito lo invertirá en la compra D. granos básicos como aceite arroz frijoles maíz entre otros productos para surtir mas la tienda y así poder vender un poco mas y obtener mas ganancias.
su inversión le ayudara a que la tienda crezca mas tener los productos más necesarios que es lo que el cliente compra hoy en día por la misma situación económica en la que nos encontramos en nuestro país 
Sus aspiraciones son mejorar la tienda y D. esta forma tener más ingresos para que su hija pueda sacar sus estudios universitarios para que sea una profesional y luego poder ser útil a la sociedad.
texts.en:
María lives in Mercedes Umaña, Usulután department. She’s a widow and lives with a daughter and granddaughter. She has a grocery store that all of them depend on for their income. Her daughter started the store 15 years ago but now María is going to run it. Because of the economic situation they decided to request a loan to increase stock merchandise. The loan will be used to buy such basic items as: cooking oil, rice, beans and corn among other products to better stock the store and thus be able to sell a bit more and earn more profits. Her investment will help the store grow and to have more products in stock of those items that the customer buys daily because of the economic situation the country finds itself in. Her aspirations are to improve the store this way so that income will be higher in order for her daughter to finish her university studies so that she will become a professional and then be useful to society.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, rice, beans and corn.

loans.name: Hassanatu Sheku

texts.en:
Hassanatu is 36 years old. She is married, and has a daughter aged 10 years. She has 4 additional dependents living with her, who are her relatives and lost their parents.

In 2001, Hassanatu established her maggie (soup product), salt, African dresses, and pans business. She began this business because she assists her husband by providing additional income for the home. Working 6 days a week and 6 hours a day, she earns about 1,251,200SLL every month from her business. 

She needs a loan of 4,500,000SLL. Hassanatu requires a loan in order to buy tomato paste, shrimp, pans, and clothes for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 337,824SLL. In the future, Hassanatu plans to further her education and help her husband support the home from the proceeds of this loan. All categories of people buy from her, but the majority of her customers are women. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise like: blouses, skirts, pants and children's clothes.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José reside en el transito departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos los cuales dependen de los ingresos que José obtiene con el negocio de bebidas y boquitas. 
Comenzó el negocio por iniciativa propia por la necesidad que tenia para mantener a sus cuatro hijos y su esposa, trabaja de lunes a sábado en la venta de gaseosas, refrescos, naturales y boquitas, el se dedica a vender en las escuelas y las canchas de futbol.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas boquitas y productos para la elaboración de refrescos naturales y de esta forma ver surtido y grande el negocio para tener buenos ingresos a futuro.
Esto le ayudara a aumentar su mercadería para atraer al cliente y lograr buenos ingresos para que su familia salga adelante.
Sus aspiraciones es que su negocio se haga más grande comprar un vehículo para distribuir el producto por mayoreo a las tiendas y lograr darles el estudio a sus hijos  logrando así una calidad de vida más estable para su familia.
texts.en:
José lives in El Transito, Morazán Department. He lives with his wife and four children who depend on the income José earns with his drinks and snacks business. He started the business on his own initiative because he had to provide for his four children and his wife. He works from Monday through Saturday selling carbonated drinks, soft drinks, natural beverages and snacks. He makes his sales at schools and soccer fields. He will invest the loan in purchasing carbonated drinks, snacks, and products for making natural drinks, and in this way have a large and well-stocked business so he can have a good income in the future. This will help him to increase his inventory to attract customers and earn a good income so his family can make ends meet. His aspirations are to make his business grow, buy a vehicle for distributing his products wholesale to shops, and manage to give his children an education, thus achieving a more stable quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase carbonated beverages, snacks, and products to make natural drinks

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 25 year old Kadiatu. She is married, and has 1 child aged less than one year.

In 2005, Kadiatu established her maggi cube (soup product), salt, and tomato business. She began her business after she gained enough experience from her mother, who also sold the same food items. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 931,200SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000SLL. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy Jino tomato, jumbo maggi, shrimp maggi, and salt in large quantity for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 232,800 SLL. Kadiatu plans to rent a shop and buy lots of goods for sale. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more goods.

loans.name: Armenia

texts.es:
Armenia de 60 años, vive en una zona periurbana del Fortín de Guayaquil, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de comida en el mercado del Fortín. 

Empezó con el negocio de comida desde hace años cuando se cambio de casa, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar sillas y mesas. Ahora ella tiene un puesto en el mercado del Fortín, vende platos típicos del Ecuador, como arroz con pollo, arroz con menestra etc. 

Ella comprar con el préstamo plátanos, arroz y aceite para hacer mas comidas. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa que ahora es de caña para ubicar hay un local de comida.
texts.en:
Armenia, 60, lives in a periurban area of Fortín, Guayaquil. She has a small food vending stand in Fortín’s market. She started with her food business several years ago when she changed her place of residence. Gradually ,with effort, she was able to buy tables and chairs. Now, she has a small stand in Fortín’s market where she sells typical Ecuadorean dishes like chicken with rice, rice with vegetables, etc. She will use the loan to buy bananas, rice and cooking oil to make more meals. In the future she’d like to finish building her house, which is currently made of sugar cane, so that she can install an eatery.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For bananas, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Olenka

texts.es: La Sra. Olenka es una cliente que retorna a trabajar con nuestra institución desde hace dos años, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo, tiene su esposo y su pequeña hijita, su mamá le ayuda en lo que puede, y estan colaborándose mutuamente. Viven ella y su familia en la casa de su suegro, el crédito que solcita ahora es para comprar perfumes y joyas que es el pedido que tiene ahora, ella aprovecha que los productos se encuentran en promocion y compra para despues venderlos a un costo un poco mas elevado y asi poder obtener un poco mas de dinero, la pareja es joven y ambos trabajan mucho, uno de sus deseos es el de tener su propia casita.
texts.en:
Olenka has been a returning partner of the institution for 2 years. She sells cosmetics through catalogs. She is married and has a young daughter. Her mother helps her however she can and they all help each other. She lives with her family in her father-in-law's house. She requests the loan to buy perfumes and jewelry, which are the orders she currently has. She takes advantage of product sales, buys and sells products at a small profit so that she can get a little bit more income. This is a hardworking young couple and one of their wishes is to own their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la  Compañía Comandante P., son señoras de escasos recursos quienes se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para conformar un grupo. 
Estas Señoras son activas la mayoría de ellas se dedica al trabajo de ventas de productos de uso domésticos, productos artesanales, alimentos y otras actividades.
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.
La señora Ramona V. solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes que utiliza para la preparación de los comestibles que ella vende.
Ella es una de una familia muy humilde, pero muy luchadora, cada integrante realiza una tarea para ayudar con lo gasto de la casa, así la señora Ramona prepara distintos tipos de comestible como empanadas, sopa paraguaya, masa dulces y otros y sus hijos salen a vender.
Comenta que esta actividad es muy sacrificada y que le lleva mucho tiempo a ella y a sus hijos pero hasta la actualidad es la actividad que le genera ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
This committee is from Comandante P.. They are low-income women who entered the Enterprising Women Committee to unite and form a group. These women are active. Most are in sales of home use items, handicrafts, food and other activities. They need this loan to invest in their various enterprises in order to attain sustainable growth that will help them grow as a group and as individuals. Mrs. Ramona V. is asking for the loan to buy ingredients she uses to prepare the meals she prepares. She is from a very humble, but very tenacious, family. Each family member is engaged in a different activity to contribute to the household expenses. Thus, Ramona prepares various types of food items like turnovers, Paraguayan soup and pastries that her children take out to sell. She tells us that this work is very demanding and takes up a lot of her and her children’s time but to date has been the activity that produces income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 35 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo Olo de 48 años, y de sus 2 jóvenes hijos, juntos habitan en un paraje de la apacible serranía peruana. Desde muy joven se dedica a las labores agrícolas, antes ayudaba a sus padres y hoy trabaja las tierras junto a su esposo. Siembra papa, arveja y maíz en sus chacras propias, y le gusta despertarse muy temprano para vigilar sus campos, pues sabe que de su esfuerzo constante depende que obtenga un productiva cosecha que venderá a buenos precios a los mayoristas de la ciudad. Luego de la cosecha comercializa todos sus productos naturales, pues sus compradores conocen de la calidad de su producción. Pero siempre trabaja pensando en sacar adelante a sus hijos, pues quiere que estudien una carrera y sean profesionales, además dice que lo más trabajoso es trasladar toda su producción para comercializarla, ya que los sacos son bastante pesados. Como es una mujer emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, para generarse mejores ingresos. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, también esta muy satisfecho con el trabajo de su grupo comunal porque son personas organizadas y responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Rosa tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de 3 sacos de abono y semilla de arveja, pues desea mejorar la productividad de sus campos, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Rosa, 35 years old, lives in her own home along with her husband Olo, 48 years old, and two young children. They all live together on a trail along the pleasant Peruvian hill country. She has been working in agriculture since she was young. First she helped her parents, now she works the land with her husband. They plant potatoes, peas and corn on their own farm. She enjoys waking up early to tend to her fields because she knows her hard work is necessary to obtain a productive crop to sell to the whole sellers in town. She sells her production as soon as she harvests it because her buyers know the quality of her products. She always works thinking of improving her children's lives. She wants them to go to school and become professionals. In addition, she says the hardest part of her job is transporting her production to sell it since the bags are very heavy. Being the entrepreneur that she is, she plans to plant more to generate more income. This is her seventh credit with MFP. She is very thankful for all people who have made the loan that will help her continue to work possible. She is also very pleased with the work of her community group. They are well organized and responsible for the payment of their loans. Rosa plans to invest their loan in the purchase of three bags of fertilizer and pea seeds. She wants to improve her field's productivity and therefore continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of three bags of fertilizer and pea seeds

loans.name: Sara Esther

texts.es:
Sara de 54 años, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en la entrada de su casa, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil, (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Comenzó vendiendo afuera de su casa frutas pero sus clientes también le pedían comida, ella comenzó a preparar platos de comida. Poco a poco comenzó hacer comidas típicas hasta que pudo comprar mas mesas y sillas, ahora trabaja desde las 07h15am hasta las 22h00pm. Vende almuerzos a $ 1.25 c/u.  

Para poder agrandar mas su negocio el quiere comprar bebidas, arroz y platos, para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, en el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y tener otro negocio (tienda).
texts.en:
Sara, 54, has a small food stall at the entrance of her home. She lives in Fortin de Guayaquil (city outskirts, with dirt roads and hills). She started selling fruit outside her home but her customers also asked for meals, so she began to prepare cooked food. She slowly started with traditional food until she was able to buy more tables and chairs. She now works from 7:15am to 10pm. She sells lunchtime meals at $1.25 each. In order to expand her business she wants to buy drinks, rice and dishes to meet the needs of her customers. In the future she wants to improve her home and have another business (a shop).

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, drinks, dishes

loans.name: Julia Albertina

texts.es:
Julia es una madre de familia de 53 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el distrito agrícola de Oyotún, una zona agrícola con abundante recurso hídrico que presenta una geografía accidentada debido a su cercanía a la sierra norte del país. Se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mas de  veinte años, ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde siembra arroz. Debido a la abundancia de recurso hídrico en la zona, en Oyotún se suele sembrar arroz hasta dos veces por año, a diferencia del resto de zonas agrícolas de la región, en donde solo se le siembra una vez por año.

Julia utiliza los ingresos que percibe producto de esta actividad ayudando a su esposo, que también es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economia familiar. Gracias a esta actividad han podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, los cuales ya están independizados. Actualmente Julia desea adquirir diversos productos agrícolas como pesticidas y fertilizantes que le permitan asegurarse una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Julia es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su dias transcurren entre ocuparse de las labores de su hogar y cuidar de su cultivo. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Julia is a 53-year-old mother who lives with her husband in the agricultural district of Oyotún, an agricultural area with abundant water resources and uneven terrain because it is close to the country's northern mountain range. It is located approximately two hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has been a farmer for more than twenty years. She has a small field where she grows rice. Owing to the abundance of water in the area, in Oyotún rice is sown twice a year. In the region's other agricultural areas, rice is only sown once a year. Julia uses her income from this work to help her husband, who is also a farmer, with supporting the family. Thanks to this work they have been able to provide for their children, who are now adults. Now Julia wants to acquire various agricultural products like pesticides and fertilizers that allow her to guarantee a good harvest. To reach her goal, she has found it necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles. Julia is hardworking and dedicated to her family. She spends her days on household chores and taking care of her field. She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa before and has been punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizers and pesticides for rice field

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata M. is married to an active businessman, and has five children. All her children are students.

For the past ten years, Aminata has been selling colemans of different sizes, rubber dishes, and other utensils. Her business is located in the Silvanus market, Makeni town. With her long experience in the same type of business, Aminata now has a lot of loyal customers.

Aminata has a good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 4,000,000SLL to help her buy more stock for her stall. She hopes to use the proceeds of this loan to educate her children to university level, and buy a piece of land for building their family house, as she continues to reinvest in her business. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To add home utensils.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter, de 22 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de sus 3 hermanos. Cada día es nuevo para este joven trabajador que se dedica a las labores agrícolas, siembra papa, arveja y maíz  junto a su padre y hermanos. Desde que era muy pequeño aprendió las técnicas agrícolas necesarias para obtener una buena producción, y le gusta mucho realizar esta labor porque ya se acostumbro a despertarse temprano, y dirigirse a vigilar los cultivos, además se siente cómodo trabajando a lado de su familia, ya que todos juntos siembran y luego cosechan, para tiempo después recoger todos los productos y trasladarlos a comercializar al mercado mayorista de su ciudad, donde ya tienen compradores fijos que les ofrecen regulares precios. Es por eso que esta muy satisfecho con la actividad que realiza, y para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, pues quiere mejorar sus ingresos. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además dice que el trabajo de su grupo comunal marcha bien, pues todos los integrantes son muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Walter tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de semillas de arveja, así como, abono y fertilizantes que necesitará  para mejorar  y aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Walter is 22 years old. He lives with his parents and three brother. Every day is new for this young worker who does agricultural work. He plants potatoes, peas and corn with his father and brothers. He learned the farming techniques required to get a good harvest when he was very young, and he loves his work because he is used to getting up early to go and oversee the crops. He also feels comfortable working alongside his family; together they sow, harvest and gather the goods to take them to the wholesale market in their city, where they already have regular customers who offer them fixed prices. That's why he is very content with his job, and in the future he plans to farm in greater quantities in order to improve his income. This is his third loan with MFP and he is very grateful to the people who have made this loan possible as it will enable him ot continue to work. He also says that the work in his loan group is going well, because all members are very responsible in their loan repayments. Walter plans to invest the rquested loan in the purchase of several bags of pea seeds, as well as manure and fertilisers to improve and increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds and bags of fertilisers

loans.name: Juntos Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. CONSUELO TIENE  64 AÑOS Y TIENE 8 HIJOS, YA TODOS MAYORES D. EDAD E INDEPENDIENTES. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "JUNTOS AL PROGRESO", FORMADO POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES RESIDENTES LA MAYORÍA DEL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO. SUS COMPAÑEROS LA ELIGIERON COMO LA PRESIDENTA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA. CONSUELO SE DEDICA A ATENDER SU RESTAURANT D. NOMBRE "VIVIAN", LO LLAMÓ ASÍ PORQUE TIENE UNA NIETA D. ESE NOMBRE. HACE TRES AÑOS INCIÓ ÉSTA ACTIVIDAD, NOTÓ QUE EN UNA ZONA DOND. SE UBICABA UNA FÁBRICA NO HABÍA RESTAURANTES ASÍ QUE SE ANIMÓ A INICIAR SU NEGOCIO, EL CUAL LE VA BIEN.
CON SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO ADQUIRIR LOS ARTEFACTOS NECESARIOS PARA EL FUNCIONAMIENTO D. SU RESTAURANT.
SU PROXIMA META ES AMPLIAR EL NEGOCIO Y PODER LOGRAR UNA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN MEJORAR LA INFRAESTRUCTURA D. SU LOCAL, DESEA COLOCAR UNA REJA PROTECTORA CON VIDRIOS PARA PROTEGERSE DEL FRÍO Y D. LA TIERRA.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 64 years old and has eight adult children; all on their own. She is part of the group called “Juntos al Progreso” (Progressing Together), maD. up of nine members, mostly from the Carabayllo district. Her fellow members elected her as the group’s president. Consuelo runs a restaurant called “Vivian.” She started it three years ago and named it after her granddaughter. After noticing that there were no restaurants in a zone where a factory stands, she was motivated her business; it is doing well. She’s been able to acquire the items necessary for her restaurant through her work. Her next goal is to expand her business and to achieve financial stability. She will use the money from this loan to improve her restaurant’s infrastructure. She wants to install a protective grid, complete with glass panels, to proviD. protection from the dirt and cold.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Upgrade her restaurant

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María de 31 años, tiene una tienda de vivieres, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil (lugar con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Su esposo le ayuda en la tienda y tienen cuatro hijos. Debido a los pocos ingresos que tenían, ellos decidieron invertir sus ahorros hace 4 años y comprar víveres y legumbres para vender a sus conocidos, poco a poco con esfuerzo, a podido tener una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm. 

Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, verduras,,bebidas, en el futuro quiere obtén mas cliente y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old and has a general store. She lives in a peri-urban zone in Fortín de Guayaquil (an area of dirt paths and hills). Her husband helps her in the store, and the couple has four children. Due to their low income, they decided 4 years ago to invest their savings in buying groceries and vegetables to sell to their acquaintances. Little by little, with effort, they have been able to create a small store in the front part of their home. María works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. To increase her store's inventory, she would like to use the loan to buy rice, vegetables and soft drinks. In the future, she would like to obtain more customers and see her children finish their studies successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, vegetables and soft drinks for her store

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma Chávez L.  es una señora  de 45 años de edad, quien vive con su  esposo y sus 3 hijas en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada San Gabriel, localizada en Yolillal, Upala en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa.. Sus actividades principales son  la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería
Doña Irma y su familia se  ha dedicado a la producción de leche  durante mucho tiempo, por lo que ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda, además de la instrucción recibida por parte de sus familiares  a lo largo del tiempo. 
Ella Necesita un préstamo  ¢250,000 (doscientos cincuenta mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera asi seguir con el negocio de la leche, la cual ya le ha generado bastantes ingresos
Doña Irma forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabriel, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  sétimo crédito y dice que con el espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria y sacar su negocio adelante.
texts.en:
Irma Chávez L. is 45 years old, and lives with her husband and 3 daughters in a rural coastal town in Costa Rica called San Gabriel, located in Yolillal, Upala in the Alajuela province. She lives in a rather large rural community, with a semi mountainous topography. Her main work is in basic grain farming, and she is also is a small scale cattle farmer. Irma and her family have worked in milk production for a long time, throughout which she has been able to experience the great attention which it demands, in addition to receiving the instruction of her family members. Irma needs a loan of 250,000 CRC that she will use to purchase a milk cow to continue with her milk business, which has generated large profits. Irma is a member of the Communal Credit Company of San Gabriel, one of the 100 organizations partnered with EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her seventh loan, and she mentions that with it she hopes to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur and hopes to move her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Purchase a Milk Cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 3 milk cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cloth.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 30 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo Abelardo de 32 años y de sus 2 pequeños hijos, juntos habitan una modesta vivienda en una apacible zona de la sierra central de Perú. Se dedica a la agricultura, porque dice que es lo mejor que sabe hacer, y lo aprendió observando a sus familiares y vecinos de su comunidad. En la  actualidad trabaja junto a su esposo en los cultivos de papa, arveja y maíz, aunque la labor agrícola es algo sacrificada porque debe madrugar todos los días para cuidar de sus cultivos y así asegurar una buena producción, dice que durante la cosecha obtiene su recompensa, pues mientras mejor cuide sus cultivos estos brindarán mejores productos. Como sus productos naturales son de calidad tiene compradores fijos en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, y de las ventas obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten brindarle a su familia una adecuada calidad de vida. Para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, además desea comprar algunas cabezas de reses para criarlos y tenerlos ante cualquier dificultad que se le presente. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso, además dice que esta satisfecha con el desempeño de su grupo comunal porque todos los integrantes son muy responsables con el pago de sus cuotas. Yolanda tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Yolanda, who is 30 years old, lives in her own house with her husband Abelardo, who is 32 years old, and their 2 young sons. Together they live in a modest house in a quiet zone of the central sierra of Peru. She works in agriculture because she says it is what she knows how to do best. She learned how to do it by observing her relatives and neighbors in the community. Currently she works together with her husband growing potatoes, peas and corn. Although the farming work is self-sacrificing because you have to get up early every day to care for the crops in order to ensure a good production, she says that during the harvest she gets her reward. Since the better you care for your crops the better the products they will produce. Because her natural products are good quality, she has regular customers in the largest market in the city and from the sales she gets regular profits, which allows her to give her family an appropriate quality of life. For the future she plans to plant larger plots of land. She also wants to buy some heads of cattle to raise and have for whatever difficulty that may arise. This is her third loan with MFP and she is very thankful to all the people who made the loan possible as it will allow her to continue working in search of progress. Also, she says that she is satisfied with the performance of her communal group because all the members are very responsible with making their payments. Yolanda plans to invest the requested loan in buying bags of various fertilizers that she needs to improve the productivity of her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca Odila, tiene 53 años, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos adultos. Ella es integrante del grupo "siempre adelante", formado por 8 personas residentes. 

Hace quince años se dedica a la atención D. su centro D. fotocopiados ubicado en una zona muy comercial, en un local alquilado. Comenzó ésta actividad atendiendo sólo con una fotocopiadora, fué aumentando sus máquinas e inlcuyó artículos D. librería ya que así el público lo requería.

Con éste negocio ha logrado poner una pequeña bodega en su casa, cubrir sus gastos personales como D. salud.
Su meta más proxima es ampliar la bodega y trasladar sus equipos D. fotocopias a su casa, para así no tener que trasladarse todos los días a su local que le queda aproximadamente a hora y media D. distancia D. su casa.

El prestamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. bebidas para aumentar el stock D. su bodega.
texts.en:
Mrs.Blanca Odila is 53 years old. She is a widow and has five adult children. She is a member of the "Siempre Adelante" (Always Moving Ahead) Group, maD. up of 8 people. For 15 years she has run a copy shop in a rented storefront located in a very commercial area. She began this work with only one photocopier, and she began adding machines and included office supplies since the customers asked for them. With this business she has managed to open a small store in her house and cover her personal expenses, such as health expenses. Her next goal is to expand the store and move her photocopiers to her house, so she will not have to commute everyday to the shop, which is about an hour and a half from her house. She will invest the requested loan in purchasing drinks to increase her store's stock.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Drinks to increase stock in store

loans.name: Eduardo Simon

texts.es:
Eduardo de 40 años, tiene una tienda de vivieres compartida con algo de papelería, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil (lugar con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Su esposa le ayuda en la tienda, tienen dos hijos de 4 y 2 años. Debido a los pocos ingresos que tenían, y a la falta de oportunidades, el decidió invertir sus ahorros hace 3 años y comprar víveres para tener su propio negocio, poco a poco con esfuerzo, a podido tener una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h15pm. 

Para surtir mas su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz y cuadernos en el futuro quiere comprar un carro e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 40, has a grocery store with a bit of paper goods as well. He lives on the outskirts of a city in the El Fortín high-rise of Guayaquil (a place with dirt roads and hills). His wife helps him in the store. They have two children, a 4-year-old and a 2-year-old. Three years ago, due to their low income and lack of opportunity, he decided to invest his savings to purchase groceries in order to have his own business. Little by little he worked till he was able to have a small store in the front part of his house. He works from 6 a.m. until 9:15 p.m. To better stock his business he wants to use the loan to buy rice and notebooks. In the future he would like to buy a car and expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, notebooks

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es: Zenovia, D. 64 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía del menor D. sus 5 hijos, pues el resto se independizaron y trabajan en la ciudad. DesD. muy joven aprendió las técnicas agrícolas necesarias para obtener una productiva cosecha, es por esta razón que en la actualidad siembra arveja, papa, maíz y algunas verduras, y dice que le gusta mucho su labor porque trabaja en compañía D. su hijo, y juntos vigilan sus cultivos todos los días con los primeros rayos del sol. Dice que la recompensa a su labor constante la observa durante la época D. cosecha, pues obtiene productos naturales D. calidad que venD. a regulares precios a los mayoristas que vienen D. la ciudad. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces cuando no les brinda un tratamiento adecuado a sus cultivos, se infectan con plagas D. insectos y recuerda con tristeza como alguna vez perdió casi toda su producción por esta razón. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora que siempre piensa en el futuro, ya tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mejores ganancias. Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar progresando, además se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo D. su grupo comunal, porque todos los integrantes son muy organizados y responsables. Zenovia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. semilla D. arveja y papa, además para esta campaña piensa contratar trabajadores para producir en mayor cantidad, D. esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en:
Zenovia, who is 64 years old, lives in her own house with 5 of her children. The rest live by themselves and work in the city. When she was very young she learned the farming techniques necessary for a productive harvest. It is for this reason that she currently plants peas, potatoes, corn and other vegetables. She says that she likes this work a lot because she works with her son and together they keep watch of the crops every day starting at sun rise. She says that the reward of her constant labor is to watch during harvest time since she gets good quality fresh products which she sells at regular prices to the wholesalers who come from the city. The part she doesn't like is the many times is when they don't treat her crops adequately and the crops are infected with plagues of insects. She sadly remembers one time when she lost almost all of her products for this reason. As she is a very enterprising woman who always thinks about the future, she already has a plan to plant in larger quantities to increase her earnings. This is the third time she has gotten a loan with MFP and she is very thankful to all the people who maD. this loan possible and allowed her to continue progressing. Also, she feels very satisfied with the work of her communal group because all the members are very organized and responsible. Zenovia plans on investing the loan she is requesting in buying pea and potato seeds. Also for this season she hopes to contract workers to produce in larger quantities and, in this way, she hopes to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea and potato seeds and contract workers to help with planting

loans.name: Amintor Mariano

texts.es:
Amintor de 45 años, el es vendedor de ropa y accesorios, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 1 años. 

Cuando era joven el trabajo como mensajero en el ejercito, un día el papa le regalo un reloj que valía en ese entonces $250 sucres (moneda antigua Ecuatoriana),  Amintor al dirigirse a su trabajo se encontró con un amigo que le ofreció $ 800. sucres por el reloj que estaba utilizando, así que lo vendió y consiguió otros para venderlos. Con ayuda del papa que era comerciante de relojes el comenzó a venderlos y comprarlos. Ahora el es comerciante de relojes, ropa y  accesorios.

Para el continuar vendiendo su mercadería quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y accesorios, en el futuro quiere tener un almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
Amintor, 45, sells clothing and accessories. He lives in an urban zone in the suburb of Guayaquil and has 2 children - 10 and 1 years of age. When he was young Amintor worked as a courier for the army. One day his father gave him a watch that was valued at 250 sucres (the old Ecuadorian currency). While making his way to work he bumped into a friend who offered him 800 sucres for the watch he was using, and so he sold it and found others to sell. With the help of his father, who was a watch salesman, he began selling and buying them. Now Amintor is a watch, clothing and accessories salesman. To continue selling his merchandise he wants to use this loan to purchase clothes and accessories. In the future Amintor would like to have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and accessories

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.es: Bernabé, de 38 años, es un padre de familia responsable, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Durante los días hábiles de la semana trabaja brindando servicios de transporte, en su motocarro, por los distritos de su ciudad.  Inicia su labor a las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 11:00 de la noche, dejando un día de semana para descansar, de esta manera lleva más de 2 años. En un inicio le fue difícil este trabajo por que no conocía las rutas, hoy recorre las calles con mucha tranquilidad. Se  siente muy satisfecho por lo que hace, asimismo constató que este trabajo es rentable,  por ello, para más adelante  planea comprarse otra moto para alquilar y generarse más ingresos económicos. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente, ya que los considera de gran ayuda para el progreso de su labor, ya que le gustaría contar con posteriores ayudas. Bernabé, con este crédito tiene planeado comprar un par de llantas y repuestos de su motocarro, y de ese modo brindar un servicio eficiente a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Bernabé, 38 years old, is a responsible father of a family. He lives in his own house with his wife and three children. During the working days of the week he works at providing transportation, in his motor car or motorcycle taxi, through the districts of the city. He works from 7:00 in the morning until 11:00 at night, leaving a day of the week to rest. He has been doing this for two years. At the beginning this work was hard for him because he did not know the routes, today he calmly drives the streets. He is very satisfied with what he does, he also affirms that this work is very profitable, and therefore he plans to get another motorcycle to rent and generate more income. This is his first loan with MFP and he promises to pay all his installments on time. He considers it to be very helpful to the progress of his work. He would also want to be able to get help in the future if he needs it. With this loan, Bernabé plans to purchase a pair of tires and replacement parts for his motor car, and thus be able to provide efficient service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a pair of tires and replacement parts for his motor car.

loans.name: Unidos Por El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: UNIDAS POR EL TRIUNFO

Hercilia C. actualmente tiene 60 años, casada y con 07 hijos, participa en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, en la ALCANCIA COMUNAL “UNIDOS POR EL TRIUNFO”, quienes conforman 07 mujeres emprendedoras.

Hercilia se dedica a elaborar carteras, gorras, bolsos a base D. telas y cueros (con máquina D. coser), asimismo elabora aretes, collares y anillos D. perlas, lleva más D. 30 años dedicada a este negocio; tiempo atrás ella trabajaba en una fábrica textil D. telas, y es allí donD. aprendió a cocer y remallar. Debido a eso Hercilia decidió estudiar por correspondencia en una CETPRO, la carrera D. costura.
Del mismo modo doña Hercilia trabaja D. limpieza en una casa, ella invierte sus ingresos para comprar materiales D. trabajo, para los pasajes, alimentos y otros gastos D. su hija, D. la misma forma el esposo colabora con los gastos D. su hogar; el reciente préstamo que se le otorgará lo invertirá  para comprar telas, cueros y demás materiales D. trabajo,
En el futuro ella sueña con especializarse más en su carrera D. costura, y dictar clases D.  manualidades a base D. telas, perlas, y cueros
texts.en:
COMMUNAL BANK: UNITED FOR VICTORY Hercilia C., 60, is married and has 7 children. She is one of 7 enterprising women who compose EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD’s “Unidos por el Triunfo” (United for Victory) communal bank. Hercilia makes purses, caps and bags from fabric and leather (using a sewing machine). She also makes pearl earrings, necklaces and rings. She has been in this line of work for over 30 years. Long ago she used to work for a textile factory and that’s where she learned how to sew and install finishings. This led her to take a correspondence sewing career course at a CETPRO (Technical Productive Education Center). Hercilia also works cleaning a house. She invests her earnings in work supplies, transportation costs, food and other expenses of her daughter. Her husband contributes to household expenses similarly. The latest loan that will be granted will be to purchase fabric, leather and other work supplies. She would like to specialize in some aspect of sewing in the future and to teach crafts courses based on fabric, pearl and leather.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and leather.

loans.name: San Roque González Group

texts.es:
Descripción:	Este comité se denomina San Roque González y se encuentra trabajando dentro del cuarto ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
Todas las se señoras son activas y muy trabajadoras y se ayudan mutuamente para seguir adelante con el grupo y aumentar la línea de crédito en el siguiente ciclo.

Una de las integrantes es la señora Marciana quien se dedica al comercio de productos de uso domésticos. 
Esta actividad lo viene realizando  hace varios años y la administración completa se encuentra a su manejo. 
Ella se encuentra satisfecha con su actividad porque ayuda con los ingresos para muchos gastos de la familia. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su negocio como fideos, lácteos, panificados, aceites, y otros.
texts.en:
This committee is named San Roque González and is currently working within its fourth loan cycle with the Entrepreneurial Women's Committee Program. All the women are energetic and very hardworking. They all help each other to keep progressing with the group and in order to increase the line of credit for the next cycle. One of the members is Marciana who sells household products. She has been in business for several years and is completely in charge of its management. She feels satisfied to have her business because it helps provide income for her family’s many expenses. She is seeking the loan for the purchase of merchandise for her business including beans, dairy products, baked goods and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dairy products, milk, sugar, beans, herbs, fruit, vegetables, eggs, meat, flour, soft drinks, oil etc.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es: Irma es soltera y trabaja como maestra de educación primaría, ayuda a su papá y mama. Ella trabaja luego de venir de la Escuela de dar clases, en vender pollo por libra y vender leña por Rodaja.  Trabaja lunes a viernes como Maestra y de lunes a domingo en vender pollo y leña.  A parte de eso se dedica a la crianza de marranos.  Solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos, leña, y pollos.  Agradece a FAPE por brindarle ayuda. Su sueño es tenere una polleria y una marranería para seguir luchando y en el futuro estar bien economicamente y seguir ayudando a sus padres.
texts.en:
Irma is a single elementary school teacher. She also helps her mother and father. After coming home from teaching at the school she goes to work selling chicken by the pound and bundled firewood. She works from Monday to Friday as a teacher and Monday to Sunday she sells chicken and firewood. Aside from all of that she raises pigs. She requests the loan for the purchase of pigs, firewood, and chickens. She is thankful for FAPE offering her help. Her dream is to have a chicken and pig stand to continue working hard and in the future be economically stable and continue helping her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of pigs, chicken, and firewood.

loans.name: Lorenza Paola

texts.es:
Paola es de la ciudad de San Juan Bautista, tiene 19 años, está estudiando en la facultad de ciencias de la salud de la UNASUR en la localidad de San Ignacio por la carrera de Lic. en Enfermería, está trabajando en una empresa de la ciudad de San Patricio como secretaria, donde vive con su abuelita, entre semana y los sábados viene a San Ignacio para estudiar luego pasando a San Juan para estar con su madre.

Es una joven muy sacrificada quien está luchando por estudiar, trabajar y pasar con su familia.

Su madre es ama de casa y cuenta con una vivienda que alquila el cual le genera el ingreso que necesita, también realiza trabajos como empleada doméstica en ocasiones.

Paola tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera trabajar en su profesión, contar con un buen ingreso, seguir especializándose, y ayudar a su familia.

Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de los gastos de la facultad.

Paola agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará para continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Paola is from the city of San Juan Bautista, is 19 years old, and is studying in the Science College of Health of UNASUR in the town of San Ignacio for a degree in Nursing. She is working as a secretary in a company in San Patricio where she lives with her grandmother.
