During the week and on Saturdays she comes to San Ignacio to study then goes to San Juan to be with her mother. She is a very self-sacrificing young woman who is trying her hardest to study, work, and spend time with her family. Her mother is a housewife and depends on income made by renting a house. Occasionally she also works as domestic help. Paola wants very much to finish her schooling, get a job in the field of nursing, earn a good salary, continue her education to further specialize, and help her family. She is requesting the loan to pay her college tuition fees. Paola is thankful for this loan since it will help her continue with her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Monthly payments and other school supplies.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
Jacinto García M.    un joven   de 29 años de edad  que vive con su esposa y  4 hijos  en una de Reserva habitada por uno de los grupos  Indígenas más importantes de Costa Rica los  “Guaimí”.    Está Ubicada en San Vito de Coto Brus una zona caracterizada por su elevada Ubicación y por estar a solamente una hora del Parque Internacional La  Amistad. Sus principales actividades económicas son la Agricultura, la artesanía y el Turismo  el cual ha aumentando en los últimos años.
El negocio de Don Jacinto siempre ha sido el ganado de doble propósito, el vende sus productos dentro de su comunidad a muy buen precio. Los vecinos aseguran que el producto de Don Jacinto siempre se ha caracterizado por ser de muy buena calidad. 
El necesita  ¢200.000 (doscientos  mil colones) para comprar una ternera  que ya conoce pero que no había  podido comprar  por falta de dinero. Ahora con este préstamo espera obtenerla y sacarle el mejor provecho y generar ingresos que le  ayuden a mantener a su familia.
Don Jacinto es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Ku Kwata, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y está muy satisfecho con esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Jacinto García M. is a young man, 29 years old, who lives with his wife and their four children on a Reserve inhabited by one of Costa Rica's most important indigenous groups, the Guaimí. It is located in San Vito de Coto Brus, an area characterized by its high altitude and only an hour away from La Amistad International Park. The main economic activities are agriculture, handcrafts and tourism, which has increased in recent years. Don Jacinto's business has always been raising cattle for both meat and dairy sales. He sells his products in his community at a very good price. The neighbors state that Don Jacinto's products have always been of very good quality. He needs ¢200,000 (two hundred thousand colones) to buy a calf he knows of but has not been able to buy because he lacked the money. Now with this loan he hopes to obtain the calf and profit from her and earn money to help him support his family. Don Jacinto is a member of the Ku Kwata Communal Bank, on of EDESA's 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and he is very pleased about this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano J. J. es un señor de 73  años de edad  que vive con su esposa y  4 hijos  en una de Reserva habitada por uno de los grupos  Indígenas más importantes de Costa Rica los  “Guaimí”.    Está Ubicada en San Vito de Coto Brus una zona caracterizada por su elevada Ubicación y por estar a solamente una hora del Parque Internacional La  Amistad. Sus principales actividades económicas son la Agricultura, la artesanía y el Turismo  el cual ha aumentando en los últimos años.
Don Mariano  siempre se ha conocido por  señor muy  valiente y trabajador. El se ha  dedicado a la agricultura toda su vida, produciendo todo tipo de cultivos. Esto le ha permitido tener una fuente de ingresos, con lo que  ha logrado  darle a su familia lo que ellos necesitan.

Para seguir produciendo  ahora don Mariano quiere cambiar a ganado de doble propósito, por eso el  necesita un préstamo de ¢300.000 (trescientos  mil colones), para la compra de los insumos para el mantenimiento de su pequeña finca. Necesita arreglar una cerca y mejorar su potrero para empezar a trabajar con ganado.

Don Jacinto es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Ku Kwata, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y está muy satisfecho con esta oportunidad porque sabe que va a ser todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Mariano J. is a 73 year old man who lives with his wife and four kids in a Reserve inhabited by one of the most important indigenous groups of Costa Rica, the "Guaimi." It is located on San Vito of Coto Brus, and area characterized for it's elevated location and for being only an hour from The International Park of Friendship. The main economic work is agriculture, making local art, and tourism which has increased in the last few years.

Mr. Mariano has always been known to be a very brave and hardworking man. He has been working in agriculture his entire life, producing all types of crops. This has allowed him to have a source of income to provide for his family.

To continue producing Mr. Mariano now wants to begin cattle ranching meaning he has two goals. This is why he needs a ¢300.000 (three-hundred thousand colones or Costa Rican Currency), for the purchase of materials to maintain his small cattle ranch. He needs to fix a fence and improve his cattle ranch to begin working with cattle.

Mr. Jacinto is a member of the Communal Credit Company Ku Kwata, one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he is very satisfied with this opportunity because he knows that everything will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix fences and improve the cattle ranch.

loans.name: Wilma Zobeida

texts.es:
Wilma de 63 años, ella vende comida y también vende ropa, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, es madre soltera con cinco hijos. 

Desde que sus hijos eran pequeño ella  comenzó a trabajar  vendiendo ropa para poder solventar con los gastos familiares, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener suficiente clientela para comprar ropa y vender comida a sus vecinos. En la actualidad ella se dedica a la venta de comida y a la venta de ropa. Cada almuerzo lo vende a $1.25 c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas y ropa para poder tener ingresos y así asegurar ya su vejez, en el futuro quiere tener un local para poder vender sus comidas y también la ropa.
texts.en:
Wilma is 63 years old, and sells food and clothing. She lives in an urban area in the Guayaquil suburbs. She is a single mother with 5 children.

Since her children were young she began selling clothes to help pay for family expenditures. Little by little, with hard work she was able to have enough customers to buy clothes and sell food to neighbors. As of now she sells food and clothes. Each meal sells for $1.25.

With this loan she plans to buy rice, beverages, and clothes to make profits and assure her future. In the future she wants to have a stand to sell meals and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of rice, beverages, and clothes.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
Don Florentino es un señor de 39 años de edad  quien vive con su esposa y  4 hijos  en una de Reserva habitada por uno de los grupos  Indígenas mas importantes de Costa Rica los  “Guaimí”.    Esta Ubicada en San Vito de Coto Brus una zona caracterizada por su elevada Ubicación y por estar a solamente una hora del Parque Internacional La  Amistad. Sus principales actividades económicas son la Agricultura, la artesanía y el Turismo  el cual ha aumentando en los últimos años.
Una de los productos más comercializados por los Guamies son los Frijoles. Y don Florentino lleva toda su vida produciendo este grano,   para consumo de su familia y principalmente para la venta. El negocio de los frijoles ha estado un poco bajo debido a que no hay dinero para invertir pero, gracias a este tipo Organizaciones hoy don Florentino  tiene la posibilidad de solicitar un préstamo de ¢100.000 (cien mil colones) para la compra de semilla de frijol y los respectivos insumos que necesite para tener la mejor cosecha de frijol posible.
El asegura que con su negocio mejorara la calidad de vida su familia y les podrá comprar mas ropa y zapatos que necesitan sus hijos para ir a la escuela.
Don Florentino es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Ku Kwata, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y también es la primera vez  que la ECC recibe un préstamo con Fondos de Kiva.
texts.en:
Mr. Florentino is a 39 year old man who lives with his wife and 4 children in a Reserve inhabited by one of the most important indigenous groups of Costa Rica, the "Guaimi." It is located in San Vito of Coto Brus, and area characterized for its elevated location and for being only an hour away from the International Park of Friendship. The main economical work is agriculture, making local art, and tourism which has increased in the last few years.

One of the Guaimis' best selling products is beans and Mr. Florentino has spent his entire life growing grains for his family's consumption but mainly for sale. The bean business has been low due to the lack of money. Thanks to this type of organization Mr. Florentino has the opportunity to request a ¢100.000 (one-hundred thousand colones or Costa Rican Currency) loan for the purchase of bean seeds and the related materials he will need to have the best bean crop possible.

He assures that his business will improve his family's quality of life and he will be able to buy more clothes and shoes for his children to go to school.

Mr. Florentino is a member of the Communal Credit Company Ku Kwata, one of the partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and also the first time ECC receives a loan with funds coming from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bean seeds and other supplies.

loans.name: Honestidad Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Honestidad se encuentra conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y esmeradas, su coordinadora, doña Patricia del Socorro E. M. tiene una pulpería con muchos rubros de distintas clases como golosinas, medicamentos, refrescos, enlatados, artículos de uso personal e higiene, entre otros. Elsa Marina L. Rodríguez vende en su casa, comida, refrescos y sopas; Leoncida E. vende tortillas y frijoles cocidos; y Reyna Isabel vende ropa usada de manera ambulante. Estas mujeres utilizarán el dinero del crédito para aumentar su capital de trabajo y volver más fuertes sus negocios.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Honestidad” (Honesty) consists of four hardworking and dedicated women. Doña Patricia del Socorro E. M., the group coordinator, has a store where she sells different kinds of merchandise such as candy, medicines, soft drinks, canned goods, personal hygiene products, and other items. Elsa Marina L. Rodríguez sells food, soft drinks, and soups from her home. Leoncida E. sells tortillas and cooked beans. Reyna Isabel sells used clothing as a street vendor.

These women will use this loan to increase their operating capital so that they can make their businesses stronger.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón B. Rodríguez es un señor de 34 años de edad  quien vive con su esposa y  5 hijos  en una de Reserva habitada por uno de los grupos  Indígenas más importantes de Costa Rica los  “Guaimí”. Está Ubicada en San Vito de Coto Brus una zona caracterizada por su elevada Ubicación y por estar a solamente una hora del Parque Internacional La  Amistad. Sus principales actividades económicas son la Agricultura, la artesanía y el Turismo  el cual ha aumentando en los últimos años.

Don Ramón posee una pequeña Finca en la cual ha sembrado frijoles toda su vida. Por lo que la producción de frijoles ha sido siempre su principal actividad económica, sin embargo la falta de dinero le ha imposibilitado mejorar su negocio.
Es por eso que el necesita  un préstamo de ¢200.000 (doscientos  mil colones) para comprar semilla de Frijol y pagar a los peones que trabajaran para tener la mejor cosecha este año. Asegura que está muy alegre ya que gracias a este préstamo podrá sacarle provecho a su terreno.


Don Ramón  es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Ku Kwata, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y asegura que espera seguir participando más activamente con esta organización.
texts.en:
Ramón B. Rodríguez is a 34 year old gentleman who lives with his wife and five children on a reserve inhabited by one of the largest indigenous groups in Costa Rica known as the Guaymí. The reserve is located in San Vito de Coto Brus, an area known for its elevation and being located an hour away from La Amistad International Park. The main business activities are agriculture and handicrafts. Tourism has increased within the last few years.

Don Ramón has a small farm on which he has planted beans for most of his life. Since growing beans is his main business activity, the lack of money has prevented him from improving his business. For this reason, he needs a loan of 200,000 CRC to buy seeds for planting beans and to hire workers so that he can produce his best crop this year. Ramón says he is pleased and expresses his thanks for the loan since he will be able to take advantage of his land.

Don Ramón is a member of Ku Kwata Communal Credit Enterprise, one of the 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he says that he hopes to continue participating more actively with this organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting beans & pay for labor

loans.name: Lirios De Rosas Pampa Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “LIRIOS DE ROSAS PAMPA” es nueva, esta iniciando su primer crédito, es parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, tiene como presidenta a la señora Paulina.

Las(os) integrantes de la asociación comunal son ocho, siete mujeres y un varón. Tienen diferentes negocios de producción, servicio y comercio, como ser: venta de edredones, venta de joyas, venta de comida, venta de jugo de quinua, confección de todo tipo de prendas, ayudante de pensión y taller.

Doña Paulina al igual que el resto de sus compañeras, es una socia que tiene el deseo de mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida, con el crédito que va ha recibir. Su negocio es la venta de “jugo de quinua”, producto muy gustado por la población andina debido a que se consume como un desayuno caliente; además de la quinua hervida, la compota tiene manzana hervida y maicena.  Doña Paulina indica que aprendió este negocio hace 6 años.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Lirios de Rosas Pampa” is a new group that is starting its first loan cycle. It is part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center and Sra. Paulina currently serves as its president.

This Communal Association has eight members, seven women and one man. They have different businesses in the manufacturing, service, and retail sectors such as quilt sales, jewelry sales, quinoa juice sales, designing and sewing garments, and helping manage a dining hall and workshop.

Doña Paulina is treated the same as her fellow group members. She hopes to improve her business and quality of life with the loan she will receive. Her business involves selling “quinoa juice”, a popular food that is enjoyed by people living in the Andes because it is consumed as a hot breakfast. This dish consists of boiled quinoa, apples, and cornstarch. Doña Paulina says she learned about this type of business six years ago.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase quinoa, sugar, and cornstarch in bulk

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia, de 44 años,  vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. La actividad a la que se dedica, es la compra y venta de carnes de res, cerdo y menudencias, desde un puesto que tiene, ubicado en el mercado más concurrido de su ciudad. Sus clientes siempre acuden a su establecimiento, puesto que el trato que ella les ofrece es muy cálido. Disfruta mucho de su negocio, ya que es muy rentable, por eso procura mantener su puesto abastecido, por lo que se va desde muy temprano a los camales a comprar estos productos perecibles. Su gran anhelo es diversificar su negocio con la venta de ropa y edredones para que su hija se pueda dedicar en la venta de ese rubro. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas, ya que desea contar con posteriores créditos en adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, mejorará la infraestructura de su puesto de venta, asimismo incrementará con mayor cantidad de carne para la venta.
texts.en:
Herminia is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children. Her business involves buying and selling beef, pork, and internal organs. She has a vending post that is located in the busiest market in the city. Her customers always come by establishment, so she tries to offer them the highest quality. Herminia enjoys running her business because it is very profitable. As a result, she tries to keep it well stocked by visiting the slaughterhouses early in the morning to acquire her perishable goods. Her greatest wish is to diversify her business by selling clothing and bedspreads so that her daughter will be able to take over selling these items.

This is her first loan with MFP. Herminia promises to complete all of her payments on time because she wants to be eligible for subsequent loans in the future. The loan she is requesting will be used to improve the infrastructure of her vending post and increase the quantity of meat that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of her vending post & purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Resolucion Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Resolución lo conforman Jessenia Raquel R. Gómez de 30 años, Jasmina del Socorro C. V. de 29 años y Marlene Sánchez G. de 39 años. Jessenia, quien es la coordinadora de este grupo, trabaja desde hace 4 años en venta de ropa tanto nueva como usada de manera ambulante, recibiendo la ayuda de sus hijos de 14 y 12 años en dicha tarea.

Jasmina también vende ropa, pero ella lo hace desde su casa de habitación ofertándola a familiares, conocidos, vecinos y recomendados; Marlene vende elotes y yoltamales, sin embargo ella utilizará el crédito para la compra de nuevos rubros en su comercio diario.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Resolución” (Resolution) consists of Jessenia Raquel R. Gómez who is 30 years old, Jasmina del Socorro C. V. who is 29 years old, and Marlene Sánchez G. who is 39 years old.

Jessenia, the group coordinator, has been selling new and used clothing as a street vendor for four years. Her children, ages 14 and 12, help her with running the business.

Jasmina also sells clothing, but she operates her business at her house. She offers her products to relatives, acquaintances, neighbors, and referrals. Marlene sells corn on the cob and corn and cheese tamales, but she will use her loan to buy new products to sell in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio P. B.  un señor de 37 años de edad  que vive con su esposa y  4 hijos  en una de Reserva habitada por uno de los grupos  Indígenas más importantes de Costa Rica los  “Guaimí”.    Está Ubicada en San Vito de Coto Brus una zona caracterizada por su elevada Ubicación y por estar a solamente una hora del Parque Internacional La  Amistad. Sus principales actividades económicas son la Agricultura, la artesanía y el Turismo  el cual ha aumentando en los últimos años.
Don Antonio es caracterizado por uno de los miembros más activos y mas hospitalarios de esta comunidad. Uno de sus deseos es que el turismo siga creciendo en la su comunidad, es por eso que construyo una casa y compro unos caballos para alquilarlos a los visitantes a un buen precio.
En este momento la casa no tiene camas, ni muebles  es por eso que el necesita un préstamo  de ¢200.000 (doscientos  mil colones) para la compra de colchones, sillones y sabanas para equipar su casa de alquiler y poder poner a disposición de los turistas. Asegura que tendrá muchos beneficios y que esto contribuirá a que el turismo siga creciendo en su comunidad y genere mas ingresos a el y a su familia
Don Antonio es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Ku Kwata, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y está muy satisfecho con esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Antonio P. B. is a 37 year old gentleman who lives with his wife and four children on a reserve inhabited by one of the largest indigenous groups in Costa Rica known as the Guaymí. The reserve is located in San Vito de Coto Brus, an area known for its elevation and being located an hour away from La Amistad International Park. The main business activities are agriculture and handicrafts. Tourism has increased within the last few years.

Don Antonio is known as one of the most active and most hospitable members of this community. One of his wishes is to see tourism continue to grow in his community. For this reason, he built a house and bought some horses that he could rent to visitors at a good price. At the moment, the house does not have any beds or furniture. He needs a loan of 200,000 CRC to buy mattresses, chairs, and linens to equip his rental house so that he can make it available to tourists. Antonio says his business has many benefits and will contribute to the growth of tourism in his community, as well as generate more income for him and his family.

Don Antonio is a member of Ku Kwata Communal Credit Enterprise, one of the 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he is very pleased with this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment for his rental cottage

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milagro tienes 41 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Mercedes Umaña, Departamento D. Usulután, es casada, vive con el esposo y dos hijos D. la edades 18 y 22 años los cuales dependen económica mentes D. ella, la cual posee un taller sastrería ( fabrica ropa).
El negocio lo inicio atreves D. la madre quien le enseño atienD. el negocio D. lunes a Domingo es cual está ubicado en el lugar D. residencia, actualmente trabaja en la elaboración D. uniformes escolares, ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra D. tela D. diferentes colores, hilos y materiales necesarios para la fabricación D. uniformes; este préstamo contribuirá a solventar gastos familiares, que son solventados por el negocio, permitiendo continuar con el negocio.
Las aspiraciones D. milagro son apoyar a los hijos con el estudio, con las ganancias del negocio comprar otra máquina D. coser.
texts.en:
Milagro is 41 years old and resides in the town of Mercedes Umaña in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her husband and two children, ages 18 and 22, who are still financially dependent on her. Milagro owns a sewing workshop where she makes clothing.

This business started as a result of learned the traD. from her mother. Milagro operates her business Monday to Sunday from her home. She currently makes school uniforms and is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fabrics in different colors, thread, and other materials needed to fulfill her orders. This loan will enable her to contribute to the family expenses by continuing her business, thereby generating income.

Milagro says her aspirations are to support her children with their studies and use her business earnings to buy another sewing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, thread, and other materials for making uniforms

loans.name: El Mar Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario El Mar se encuentra conformado por Dina Guadalupe Pavón O., Margelia del Socorro B., Martha Lisbeth A. Solís y Calidonia F., cuatro mujeres que se desempeñan en distintas actividades económicas y sin embargo comparten la solidaridad en la lucha por salir adelante.

Dina de 38 años es la coordinadora del grupo, tiene una pulpería desde hace 7 años, sin embargo ahora tiene más productos y más artículos que le ayudan a la operación de su negocio como son un frízer, un estante, entre otros; Margelia es comerciante de productos AVON y realiza trabajos de costura por encargos; Martha vende carnes y verduras en su casa de habitación y así mismo los oferta de manera ambulante; por último, Carolina vende ropa tanto nueva como usada.

El sueño de ellas es que sus hijos, cuya mayoría se encuentra en la adolescencia, lleguen a ser grandes profesionales y que ellas puedan brindarles todo lo que necesiten para lograrlo.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “El Mar” (The Sea) consists of Dina Guadalupe Pavón O., Margelia del Socorro B., Martha Lisbeth A. Solís, and Calidonia F.. These four women work in different business activities, but what they have in common is their struggle to get ahead.

Dina is 38 years old and serves as the group coordinator. She started a grocery store seven years ago. Even though she is now stocked with more products and merchandise, what would help her business stay in operation is a freezer, shelving, and other supplies. Margelia is a saleswoman who offers Avon products and also takes on sewing jobs by accepting orders. Martha sells meats and vegetables from her home and as a street vendor. Finally, Carolina sells both new and used clothing.

Most of these women have children who are teenagers, so their dream is to provide them everything they need to become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a freezer, shelving, and other supplies

loans.name: El Arbol Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario El Árbol se encuentra constituido por Lidia Marina Dávila Chavarría, Mayda R. P. y Auxiliadora del Socorro López. Lidia, quien es la coordinadora fabrica tortillas en su casa de habitación, así mismo vende frijoles cocidos, cabeza de chanco, buñuelos y nacatamales; ella inició hace 20 años solamente con las tortillas y poco a poco fue agregando más y más productos a su comercio.

Mayda también fabrica tortillas pero el único producto agregado que ella tiene es la venta de algunos derivados de los lácteos como el queso y la cuajada. Auxiliadora, vende nacatamales, pero así mismo ha agregado la venta de frescos, helados y choco banano, ella piensa invertir el crédito en nuevos giros como la fritanga.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “El Árbol” (The Tree) consists of Lidia Marina Dávila Chavarría, Mayda R. P., and Auxiliadora del Socorro López.

Lidia, who is the group coordinator, prepares tortillas at home. There she also sells baked beans, roasted pig’s head, fritters, and Nicaraguan tamales. She started her business 20 years ago selling only tortillas, but little by little, she added more products to sell.

Mayda also prepares tortillas, but the only other items that she sells are dairy products such as cheese and curds. Auxiliadora sells Nicaraguan tamales, but now she also sells soft drinks, ice cream, and frozen chocolate covered bananas. She plans to invest her loan in new products to sell, such as fried foods.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca M. S. tiene una comidería desde hace 2 años en el local donde antes era cocinera, ella con la ayuda de su conyugue le venden a los trabajadores de la zona y su mayor sueño es hacer dicha comidería más grande y que pueda abastecer toda la demanda de la zona, así mismo sueña con que sus hijos sean unos grandes profesionales y hombres de bien y provecho en esta sociedad.
texts.en:
Francisca M. S. has an eatery she started two years ago in the same place where she used to work as a cook. With the help of her husband, she sells to workers in the area. Her greatest wish is to make her business larger so that she can meet all of the local demand. She dreams of seeing her children become successful professionals and good people who will benefit society.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to her business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María de 27 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene un pequeño salón de belleza, es madre soltera con un hijo de 6 años. 

Hace tres años comenzó a trabajar haciendo cortes de cabello, tinturados, a domicilio. Cuando ya obtuvo ingresos para abrir su propio salón de belleza comenzó a comprar de poco a poco las mesas, sillas y los productos de belleza. Ahora tiene un pequeño salón de belleza, trabaja todos los días sola. 

Para poder dar mas comodidad a sus clientes ella quiere comprar con el préstamo mesas, tintes y esmaltes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir el salón de belleza.
texts.en:
María is 27 years old and lives in an urban zone in the Guayaquil suburb. She has a small beauty salon and is a single mother with a 6 year old son. She began working 3 years ago cutting hair and doing dyes in people's homes. When she obtained enough earnings to open her own salon she began little by little to buy tables, chairs and beauty products. She now has a small beauty salon where she works alone every day. To give greater comfort to her customers with this loan María wants to buy tables, hair dyes and nail polish. In the future she wants to finish building her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tables, hair dyes and nail polish

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel A. de 47 años tiene una larga trayectoria como costurera, hace 25 años cuando inició, trabajaba sola en una máquina de coser cacera; hoy en día tiene 3 trabajadores en máquinas industriales, además de la que ella misma usa y recibe pedidos para la fabricación al por mayor de uniformes escolares, deportivos y hasta folklóricos por parte de los ballets más famosos de Nicaragua. Su sueño es poder algún día convertir su fábrica de ropa en una gran empresa de la industria de las confecciones.
texts.en:
María Isabel A., 47, has a great career as a seamstress. When she began 25 years ago she worked alone with a domestic sewing machine; today she has 3 employees who work with industrial sewing machines. María herself also receives orders to make large quantities of school uniforms, sports uniforms and folklore outfits for the some of the most famous ballets in Nicaragua. Her dream is to be able to one day convert her clothes factory into a large company in the dress-making industry.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase materials

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva de 36 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. El negocio a la que se dedica es la venta de celulares, tarjetas, accesorios para equipos móviles, por lo que cuenta con un puesto ubicado en el mercado más concurrido de su localidad. Durante todo el día atiende a sus clientes, quienes acuden a su establecimiento a buscar algún servicio. Lleva 2 años en este negocio, manifiesta sentirse satisfecha con su negocio y por las rentas que le genera, además se distrae conversando con cada uno de sus clientes. En adelante le gustaría ampliar su negocio con nueva mercadería, y también quiere terminar de construir su casa y ahí poner otra sucursal del negocio que realiza. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que este apoyo le será de mucha utilidad para su negocio, es por ello que se compromete en pagar sus cuotas oportunamente. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará celulares y más accesorios para ello, puesto que le es muy rentable, además puede aumentar la cantidad de mercaderías que vende.
texts.en:
Eva is 36 years old and is the hard-working mother of a family. She lives in her own home together with her husband and 3 children. Eva sells mobile phones, phone cards and mobile phone accessories. She has a stand located in the most popular market in her zone. All day she attends to her customers, who go to her establishment looking for different services. Eva has had this business for 2 years, and she feels satisfied with the business and the profits it generates. She also enjoys talking to her customers. In the future Eva wants to expand her business with new merchandise and also finish building her house, as well as install another branch of her business. This is Eva's first loan with MFP and she knows that this support will be very useful for her business, so she promises to meet the repayments when they are due. With this loan she will purchase mobile phones and more accessories for them, something which is very profitable, and she can also increase the amount of merchandise that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mobile phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Dulce Honestidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Dulce Honestidad se encuentra conformado por Teresa Yesenia García A., Verónica Lorena A. Martínez y Ruth del Carmen Méndez M., tres mujeres que se esfuerzan por salir adelante día a día.

Teresa quien es coordinadora de este grupo se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, sin embargo sus sueños son poder estudiar belleza y abrir su propio salón; ya que esto lo práctica en su familia y es lo que a le gusta. Verónica por otro lado, encontró un oportunidad de negocio en la zona franca, ahí ella vende frijoles, leña y alguna piezas de ropa. Ruth, nuestra última integrante, se dedica a la venta de verduras al por mayor. Estas mujeres utilizarán el dinero para la compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
The communal group Dulce Honestidad is made up of Teresa Yesenia García A., Verónica Lorena A. Martínez and Ruth del Carmen Méndez M., three women who through their efforts have pulled ahead day by day. Teresa is the group's coordinator and she sells cosmetics. Nevertheless her dream is to study cosmetology and open her own salon. This is what she does in her family and this is what she likes to do. On the other hand Verónica found an opportunity for a business on the outskirts of the town and there she sells beans, firewood, and some clothing. Ruth, our last member sells vegetables wholesale. The women use the money to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Blas Osvaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Blas S. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, Compañía Espartillar, vive en concubinato  con la  Sra. Gloria Cañiza y  no tiene  hijos, tienen casa  propia.  

      El se dedica hace varios años a la  venta ambulante de artesanía fabricadas por su esposa  por la  zona de Ypacarai y Villa Elisa, comenta que cuenta con clientelas bien formadas ya que los productos que lleva son de buena calidad y de aceptación del cliente, su viaje lo realiza en forma semanal.
Toda la familia trabaja para hacer este negocio de fabricación y venta de artesanía, entre las fabricaciones más solicitadas se encuentran los ponchos de lana, frazadas, bufandas y otros. 

   Solicita el  préstamo  para compra de materia prima (hilo, trapos de distintos tipos, y colorantes para teñir las telas).
texts.en:
Blas S. is from Carapeguá city, Compañía Espartillar. He lives with his partner Gloria Cañiza in their own home. They don't have children. For several years Blas has worked selling artesanal goods door to door, make by his wife, in the Ypacarai and Villa Elisa zones. He has very good clients as the products he sells are of a very good quality and well-received by his clients. He travels weekly to sell them. All the family works for this business, making and selling artesanal goods. Among the most sought-after products are woolen ponchos, blankets, scarves and others. Blas is seeking this loan to purchase raw materials (thread, different types of cloth, and tints to dye the wool).

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase threads, cloths and wool dyes

loans.name: Jehova Nice Group

texts.es:
Ángela Dominga M. encabeza el grupo Jehová Nice, ella tiene una pulpería en su casa, la cual inició hace más de 12 años y ha evolucionado y cambiado mucho con el paso de los años y la experiencia adquirida, hoy en día dicho negocio no se parece en nada a esos pocos productos que tenía en la puerta esperando todo el día clientes que los comprarán.

Antonia Hernández Alonso también tiene una pulpería en su casa y a sus 68 años sueña aún convertirla en una distribuidora; por otro lado María Magdalena López Fuentes se dedica a la venta de casi todo lo que es derivado del maíz, tortilla, masa, cosa de horno, elote, chicha, etcétera. Estas mujeres utilizarán el dinero producto del crédito otorgado para la compra de más materiales e insumos para la producción de sus productos.
texts.en:
Ángela Dominga M. heads up the group Jehová Nice. She has a grocery store in her house which she began more than 12 years ago. It has evolved and changed greatly over the years and with the experience she has acquired. Today the business looks nothing like the one with the few products that used to be sold, when Ángela used to spend all day waiting in the doorway for customers to buy things. Antonia Hernández Alonso also has a grocery store in her house. At 68 she dreams of converting it into a distributorship. María Magdalena López Fuentes works selling maize and related products, such as tortillas, dough, oven products, corncobs, maize liquor etc. These women will use the granted loan to purchase more materials and goods to make their products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline,  D. 18 años, es una joven muy emprendora, vive en casa D. sus padres, junto a sus 2 hermanos. ElL. es estudiante D. leyes, en el que solo se dedica a estudiar durante las mañanas, pero desD. hace 9 meses, empezó con L. venta y distribución D. ropa deportiva a los colegios particulares que se encuentra en su zona, tomando esta nueva actividad durante sus horas libres y los fines D. semana, sin descuidar sus estudios. ElL. emprendió este trabajo por medio D. su madre, siendo difícil al comienzo pero conforme pasó el tiempo pudo establecerse y llevar a cabo el negocio. Ahora se siente contenta puesto que le es rentable, ya que le servirá para cubrir  parte D. sus gastos en L. universidad. En adelante anheL. ser una exitosa profesional y tener su propia librería, ya que vive al frente del colegio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso para el capital D. su negocio, por ello se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa invertirlo en L. compra D. telas y mandar a confeccionar los uniformes deportivos, D. ese modo podrá cubrir los pedidos que le hacen los colegios.
texts.en:
Jackeline, age 18, is a very enterprising young woman. She lives in her parents' house, together with her 2 brothers. She is a law student, and during the mornings she devotes herself fully to studying. However, 9 months ago, she began selling and distributing sports clothing to private schools in her area. She pursues this new activity during her free hours and on weekends, without neglecting her studies. She undertook this work thanks to her mother; it was difficult at first, but as time passed, she was able to establish herself and manage the business. Now she feels happy, since it is profitable for her, and it will help her cover part of her expenses at the university. In the future, she hopes to be a successful professional and have her own bookstore, since she lives in front of a school. This is her first loan with MFP, and she knows that it will be very beneficial in providing capital for her business, and accordingly she is committed to making all of her payments on time. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to invest in buying fabric and having sports uniforms maD., so that she will be able to fill the orders placed by the schools.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth to make school sports uniforms

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Los Arrabales surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, el grupo se encuentra en el 14º ciclo, es un comité antiguo con pagos excelentes, tienen un ahorro que recaudaron mediante las actividades que vienen realizando desde el comienzo del comite.

Todas las integrantes son señoras muy trabajadoras y una de ellas es la Sra. Patricia A. posee un local de expendio de bebidas gaseosas, refrescos, golosinas en general, postres, helados, así como comida rápida.
Desea incrementar sus ingresos con la ampliación del engocio mediante la adquisición de más mercaderías al por mayor para la venta al detalle, tales como más variedad de bebidas, de gaseosas y golosinas. 
Teniendo en cuenta la demanda creciente de la clientela y el punto estratégico en el cual está ubicado su Kiosco.
texts.en:
This group, from the neighborhood Los Arrabales, was formed thanks to promotional activities in the area. The group is now in its 14th loan cycle. It is a longstanding committee with an excellent payment record. They also have savings collected from the activities they have been organizing since the group began. All of the members are very hard-working women. One of them is Patricia A., who has a shop where she sells soft drinks and other beverages, assorted snacks, desserts, ice cream and fast food. She would like to increase her income by expanding her store through the acquisition of more merchandise on a wholesale basis. She will purchase items such as a greater variety of beverages, soft drinks and snacks, taking into account the growing demand among customers and the strategically favorable place in which her kiosk is located.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying snacks, desserts such as ice cream and fruit, canned and packaged foods, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying construction material, chickens and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewage system and level the land.

loans.name: Mario Ruben

texts.es:
Mario Ruben N. V. tiene 30 anos. Vive en union libre en el canton de Chillanes en la provincia Bolivar. Tiene 3 hijos de 6, 3, y 2 anos. 

Mario es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Jacinto. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Mario se dedica a la agricultura. Al mes gana 140 dolares. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Matilde. 

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en el cultivo de cacao. El credito lo ayudara en sacar adelante su negocio. Su sueno es tener una casa, un carro, y un terreo. Se desafia por las cuasas que cae las lanchas en el cacao. 

Le gusta jugar deportes como el boli, el futbol. Su costumbre favorita de su cantón es las fiestas de Recinto Val Paraíso.
texts.en:
Mario Ruben N. V. is 30 years old. He lives in a common-law marrige in the canton of Chillanes in the Bolivar province. He has three children, ages 6, 3, and 2. Mario is a member of the San Jacinto community bank. There are 15 members in all, and the majority work in agriculture. Mario works in agriculture. He earns 140 dollars a month. He makes purchases and sells his products in Matilde. He is applying for the loan to invest in cocoa farming. The loan will help him advance his business. His dream is to have a house, a car, and a piece of land. His greatest challenge is when the cocoa freezes. He likes to play sports like volleyball and football. His favorite custom in his canton is the fiestas in the Val Paraíso. precinct.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant cocoa

loans.name: Kuña Kyre'y Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es del Asentamiento Santa María Cambyreta surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona. 
Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser :  venta de verdura y frutas, cría y ventas de pollos, venta de lencerías ,ventas de ropas, ventas de dulces y lavanderas,hay señoras que tienen carnicería  hace ya varios años.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Sonia Graciela V. S. posee un comedor, en el cual además de la venta de comidas también posee una variedad de bebidas y golosinas, así como refrigerios y comida rápida.
La misma desea incrementar sus ingresos ampliando la variedad de productos comestibles para la venta, al igual que más variedad de bebidas y postres, teniendo en cuenta la demanda de la clientela que ya posee y el crecimiento del mercado.
El crédito invertirá en la compra o Adquisición de carnes, verduras, harinas, aceites, fideos, conservas, enlatados, etc. para fabricación de alimentos, así como bebidas y helados como postres.
texts.en:
This group, from the Santa María Cambyreta settlement, was formed thanks to promotional activities in the area. All of the women in the group carry out business activities, such as selling fruits and vegetables, raising and selling chickens, selling lingerie, selling clothing, selling sweets, and doing laundry. There are also women who have had a butcher shop for several years. One of the members is Sonia Graciela V. S., who has a small restaurant, where in addition to selling food, she also offers a variety of beverages, snacks, refrigerated items and fast food. She would like to increase her income by broadening the variety of food products she sells, and by offering a greater variety of beverages and desserts, taking into account the demand from her existing customers and the growth in the market. The loan will be invested in buying or acquiring meat, vegetables, flour, oil, noodles, canned and packaged foods, etc., for food preparation, as well as beverages and ice cream for desserts.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying meat, vegetables, flour, oil, noodles, canned and packaged foods, etc., to prepare food, as well as beverages

loans.name: Los Lopez Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Los López lo integran Félix Elena V. F., Ana María López B. y Terencio Margarito Martínez Hernández. Elena, su coordinadora, con 57 años es la mayor del grupo y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado oriental en Managua, toda su mercadería la vende al contado y el instinto adquirido en sus 40 años de experiencia es el que le guía para saber que fruta comprar para obtener el mayor beneficio.

Ana desde hace 6 años elabora bordados y los vende en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Masaya, el cual también es lugar de comercio para Terencio quien es, según sus palabras, un artesano del calzado. Estas personas desean lo mejor para sus familias y ver superados a sus hijos e hijas es su mayor sueño.
texts.en:
Félix Elena V. F., Ana María López B., and Terencio Margarito Martínez Hernández make up the community bank Los López. At 57, Elena, their coordinator, is the oldest of the group. She sells fruit and vegetables in the east market in Managua. She sells all her merchandise on a cash basis, and the instinct acquired in her 40 years of experience is what guides her to know what fruit to purchase to obtain the greatest profits. For 6 years, Ana has made embroidery and sold it in the municipal market in the city of Masaya, which is also the business place of Tercenio, who is, in his own words, a craftsman of footwear. These people want the best for their families, and to see their sons and daughters excel is their greatest dream.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa es una madre de familia de  55 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el sector cruce S. y García del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito conformado por varias zonas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a mas de cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, ella ofrece a sus vecinos y clientes todo tipo de productos de consumo diario que usualmente no tienen al alcance de la mano. Adicionalmente también cría animales menores y los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde vive. Estas actividades son sus fuentes de ingreso y con ellas ayuda a su familia a solventar los gastos familiares y salir adelante.

Nicolasa desea ampliar su negocio de venta de abarrotes con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda responder de mejor manera a la demanda de sus clientes, asimismo planea aumentar sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Nicolasa planea utilizar las ganancias que perciba de la ampliación de su negocio en el mantenimiento del mismo y en la colaboración con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Ella es una mujer bastante honrada y trabajadora. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a 55-year-old mother who is single and lives with her family in the sector near the intersection of S. and García, in the Mórrope district. This district is made up of various rural zones which are quite distant from each other. It belongs to Lambayeque province and lies more than forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Her business is selling basic staple goods and groceries in a general store located in her home. To her neighbors and other customers. she offers all types of everyday products that they otherwise would not have at hand. Additionally, she raises small animals and sells them to buyers who visit the zone where she lives. These activities are her sources of income, and with them, she helps her family cover the household expenses and get ahead. Nicolasa wants to expand her grocery business by purchasing more products, so that she can meet her customers' demands more effectively. In this way, she plans to increase her sales. To achieve her objective, she has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1500 Peruvian new soles. Nicolasa plans to use the profits she receives from expanding her store to maintain her business and to help sustain the economy of her family. She is a very honorable and hard-working woman. In the area where she lives, her neighbors and others who know her consider her a steady and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying staple products and groceries to expand the general store in her home

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 59 años, es una madre de familia muy noble, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijas. Hace más 4 años se dedica en la venta de ropa, durante las horas libres que tiene. Su estilo de venta lo realiza cuando va a los domicilios de sus clientes, en donde lleva ropa y otros accesorios que por suerte puede ser del gusto del cliente o en todo caso le hace algún. Esta muy satisfecha por la labor que desempeña, ya que se mantiene muy ocupada y entretenida con sus clientes,  que en su mayoría son vecinas o amistades que llega a conocer en el recorrer cotidiano de su labor. En adelante tiene planeado ampliar su negocio y construir además habitaciones individuales, puesto que considera rentable alquilar habitaciones. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que le es de mucha utilidad para aumentar el capital de su negocio, por ello se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente. Rosa tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado, se abastecerá de más ropa asimismo comprar arena y cemento para procurar terminar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old and is the mother of a distinguished family. She lives in her own house with her husband and their three daughters. For more than four years she has sold clothing during her free time. Her style of sales is going to the houses of her customers, where she brings clothing and other accessories which, with luck, will be to the taste of her customers, or at least some things will be. She is very satisfied with the work that she does, since she is kept very busy and entertained by her customers, the majority of whom are neighbors or friends whom she has come to know in the daily course of her business. In the future Rosa plans to expand her business and also build individual bedrooms (in her house), because she thinks it will be profitable to rent rooms. This is her first loan with MFP, and she knows that it will help her a lot to increase the capital of her business. For that reason, she promises to make all her payments on time. She plans to use the loan she is applying for to increase her stock of clothing and at the same time to buy sand and cement to try to finish the infrastructure of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothing

loans.name: Rio Dulce Group

texts.es:
“RIO DULCE” es el nombre de una Asociación Comunal que ya iniciará su tercer ciclo en el Centro Focal de VILLA EXALTACIÓN, como todas las asociaciones,  la asociaicón “RIO DULCE” está guiada por una mesa directiva, compuesta por una presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. 

La señora Lucía Justa, casada, presidenta de la asociación, se dedica a la confección de polleras desde hace tres años.  Realiza esta tarea en su  domicilio, lo que le permite estar al pendiente de su hogar y cuidar a su familia.  Este es su primer ciclo como presidenta y la asociación tiene la confianza de que sea una buena gestión.  El dinero que solicitó de Bs.2000.- será invertido en la compra de tela pues cada pollera requiere de 6 a 7 metros de tela y lo mismo de forro, por lo que su producción requiere de un capital importante, en particular cuando se presentan muchos pedidos.

La asociación comunal esta integrado por ocho mujeres. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: producción de faldas, tejido de chompas, venta de ropa usada, venta de polleras, venta de medicina natural, producción de camas, venta de colchas y edredones.
texts.en:
Rio Dulce” (Sweet River) is the name of community association that is beginning its third cycle with the “Centro Focal de Villa Exaltacion”. Like all organizations, the “Rio Dulce” is guided by a board of directors, which includes a president, a treasurer and a secretary. Mrs. Lucia is married and the president of this organization. She has been making large skirts for the past three years. She does this work at her home. This allows her to be at home and take care of her family. This is her first term as president. The association is confident that it will be a good term for her. The money that she is asking for, Bx2000, will be invested in the purchase of fabric as each skirt requires six to seven meters of fabric and the same amount of lining. The skirt construction requires a lot of capital, especially when she has a lot of orders. The credit association is made up of eight women. They have different businesses such as sewing skirts, knitting sweaters, selling used clothes, selling large skirts, selling natural medicine, constructing beds or selling bedspreads and comforters.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fabric

loans.name: Herminia Alba

texts.es:
La  Señora Herminia G. D.  tiene 45 años D. edad, está casadacon el Sr Alejandro M. Romero quien tiene cuatro hijos  2 mayores y dos menores  en edad escolar.
 La familia cuenta con casa propia en la ciudad D. Cambyreta  Vivienda Arroyo Pora , ciudad muy cerca D. Encarnación como  a 5 km.
La Sra. Herminia es micro empresaria  es propietaria D. un local propio D. ventas D. ropería, zapatería, ventas D. Bijouteri que es atendida por ella misma y su hija realiza trabajos D. pedicura, esta demás mencionar que también  aporta a la unidad familiar  y su conjugue es maestro D. obras. 
La cliente solicito D. nuestra asistencia para compras D. mercaderías como ser ropas D. invierno, calzados, y otros que trae D. Ciudad del Este y  Asunción,  estas compras  le estarán generando mayor  margen D. ganancia.
texts.en:
Herminia G. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Two of her children are now grown up, and the other two still attend school. The family lives in their own house in the city of Cambyreta Vivienda Arroyo Pora, which is about 5 miles away from Encarnacion. Herminia has a small business selling clothing and shoes. One of her daughters works with her providing pedicures. Herminia's husband also works as a foreman. She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as winter clothing and shoes, and other items which she brings from the city of Cuidad del Este and Asuncion. This investment will help her to grow her business and her income.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her small business, including winter clothing such as pants, jackets and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 2 freezers so that she can keep more ingredients in stock and offer more variety to her customers in her small restaurant.

loans.name: Mañanitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Las Mañanitas lo conforman Walkiria F., Gloria de los Ángeles González O. y Darling de los Ángeles López C., tres mujeres de distintas edades pero que encaran a la vida en la lucha diaria por superarse.

Walkiria, quien es su coordinadora, se dedica a la venta de artículos varios como juguetes y adornos, ella vende tanto de crédito como de contado y utilizará el crédito para la compra de aquellos productos de mayor demanda y la introducción de nuevos artículos. Las otras socias, Gloria vende ropa y chinelas desde hace 3 años y Darling produce zapatos y los vende ambulante.
texts.en:
The group called Las Mananitas is made up of Walkiria F., Gloria O. and Darling Carranze, three women of different ages who all confront life with the daily struggle to improve their economic situation. Walkiria, who coordinates the group, works selling various novelties such as games and accessories. She uses the loans to purchase the products in greatest demand, as well as to introduce new items to sell. The other members of the group also have small businesses. Gloria has been selling clothing for three years, and Darling makes shoes and sells them around the community. They will each use their portion of the loan to invest in their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for their respective businesses.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La Señora Eugenia Lopez D. B. es del Barrio San Juan del parana , esta casada  tiene tres  hijos  vive en casa propia. 
Ella se dedica a la fabricacion y venta D. comida en su vivienda.
Es una persona muy trabajadora y gracias a la actividad que realiza ha podido salir adelante e ir creciendo  en su Micro-Empresa ya que actualmente a parte D. la venta D. comidas tambien venD. varios productos D. consumo del hogar.
El Destino del credito fue para realizar compras D. mas mercaderias para la fabricación D. alimentos, así como mas variedad D. bebidas y así incrementar sus ingresos teniendo en cuenta la demanda del mercado en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Eugenia Lopez D. B. is from the San Juan del Parana neighborhood. She is married, has three children, and lives in her own house. She makes and sells food in her house. She is a very hard-working person, and thanks to the activities that she carries out, she has been able to advance and to grow her micro-business, since she now, in addition to the sale of food, also sells various household products. This loan will be destined for the purchase of more ingredients to prepare food, as well as a greater variety of drinks, and thus increase her income, keeping in mind the market demand for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare food, such as flours, oils, dairy products, meats, etc., and a variety of beverages

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora C. de 53 años es una mujer luchadora y de mucha experiencia en los negocios, hace 11 años inició la que hoy su pulpería y en estos años ha logrado introducir nuevos productos, tener mayor cantidad de inventario de cada uno de ellos, comprar activos que le ayudan en su negocio y mejorar la apariencia del local. Ella utilizará el crédito para invertir en la compra de sus productos.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora C., who is 53 years old, is a hard-working woman with much experience in business. Eleven years ago she set up what is today her general store, and in these years she has succeeded in introducing new products, having a larger inventory of each one, and buying assets that help her in her business and improve the appearance of the premises. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of more products.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy products to sell

loans.name: Severiano

texts.es:
El señor Severiano V. tiene 59 años de edad, está casado desde hace tiempo con la señora Severiano Villalba, y viven en su propia casa que está situada en el Barrio San Francisco distrito de Cambyreta.
El señor Severiano y la señora Severiana son propietarios de una Heladería en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Encarnación.
Ellos se dedican a este rubro desde hace mas de 20 años, ya que fue una de las primeras heladerías y es una de las más conocidas de la ciudad.
Gracias a esta actividad ellos han podido criar a sus hijos y darles una buena educación, ya que hoy en día ellos ya son adultos e independientes.
El cliente solicita ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de mas insumos para la heladería, así también más variedad de bebidas y golosinas y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Severiano V. is 59 years old. He has been married for a long time to Señora Severiana Villalba, and they live in their own house, which is located in the San Francisco district of Cambyreta. Señor Severiano and Señora Severiana are the proprietors of an ice cream shop in the very center of the city of Encarnación. They have worked at this business for more than 20 years, since it was one of the first ice cream shops in the city and is now one of the most well-known. Thanks to this business, they have been able to raise their children and give them a good education, and they are now independent adults. The client has applied for this loan to purchase more ingredients for the ice cream shop as well as a greater variety of drinks and candies and thus increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire ingredients for the ice cream shop, as well as drinks and candies

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana, D. 43 años, es una madre D. familia muy emprendedora, vive en su casa propia, junto a sus 2 hijos. Hace más D. 20 años, se dedica a realizar cortes, tintes, rayitos, ondulaciones  y maquillajes en general. Inicialmente trabajaba en un puesto dentro del mercado que queda a 4 cuadras D. su domicilio. Con el tiempo y a base D. mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo construir su casa, por lo que acondiciono un espacio para sauna (baños D. vapor), emprendiendo un nuevo negocio. Se siente muy satisfecha por los logros que tiene, y que hoy en día tiene un spa, atendiendo a sus clientes con mucha delicadeza y atención. Para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar el servicio con masajes focalizados a petición D. sus clientes. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas como hasta hoy, ya que sabe que este dinero le será D. mucha utilidad. Roxana tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra D. líquidos, tintes y lociones para el cuidado y tratamiento D. piel, D. ese modo continuar brindando un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Roxana is 43 years old and an enterprising mother. She lives in her own home with her two children. For more than 20 years, Roxana has been providing haircuts, coloring, highlights, perms, and general makeovers. She started working from a vending space at the market, which is four blocks from her house. After a lot of hard work and sacrifice over a period of time, she was able to build a house. Roxana wants to remodel one of the rooms to install a sauna (steam bath) so that she can launch a new business. She is very pleased with what she has achieved. Now she has a spa where she provides her customers great care and attention. In the future she plans to expand her services by providing massage therapy at the request of her customers.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. She promises to complete her payments in the same manner that she does today because the money will be very useful. Roxana plans to invest this loan in the purchase of fluids, tints, and lotions used in administering skin care treatments so that she can continue providing good service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products used for skin treatments

loans.name: Santos Joel

texts.es:
Santos tiene 28 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el sector Muy finca del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola conformada por varios caseríos cuyos pobladores viven de actividades como la agricultura y el comercio. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte). El brinda este servicio en los diversos caseríos que conforman la zona en donde vive y en el pueblo central (Mochumí), los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en colaborar con el sostenimiento de su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su mototaxi y el mal estado de los caminos de la zona han hecho que su unidad movil sufra algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, para realizar esta acción el ha creído pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es una persona honrada y entregada a su trabajo, diariamente el da lo mejor de si para mantenerse en esta actividad y asegurarle a los suyos el sustento diario. Sus vecinos y amigos le consideran un joven tranquilo y responsable.
texts.en:
Santos is 28 years old and lives with his family in the sector of Muy Finca in the District of Mochumí, an agricultural area that consists of several villages where the inhabitants make their living through farming and trade. This district is part of Lambayeque Province, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past year, Santos has been providing cargo and passenger transport services using a motorcycle taxi (a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle taxi with an attached cabin for providing transportation services). He provides his services in different villages within the area he lives and in the town of Mochumí. The income he receives from this business is used to support his family.

Due to continued use and the poor condition of the local roads, his vehicle has developed some problems that require urgent repairs to ensure that it operates properly. In order to take corrective action, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Santos is an honest person who is dedicated to his work. He does his best every day so that he can maintain his business and provide for his daily needs. His neighbors and friends consider him to be a peaceful and responsible young man.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for repairs & maintenance of his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Alicia Teresa

texts.es:
Alicia F. es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, tiene 23 años y  está cursando el 5° año de la carrera de Ciencias Jurídicas y Escribania en la Universidad del Norte de la misma ciudad.
Ella tiene 1 hermana de 22 años quien es egresada de la carrera  de Contabilidad de la Misma Universidad al que asiste Alicia.
Su madre tiene un negocio de alquileres de mesas y sillas para eventos sociales y su padre es comerciante.
Alicia actualmente trabaja como Registradora en el Poder Judicial, donde se encuentra adquiriendo experiencia y al mismo tiempo obtiene un ingreso para sus estudios.
Ella tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y abrir su propio estudio jurídico, crecer profesionalmente y ser destacada a nivel social por sus excelente labor como Abogada.
La clienta solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad  ya que lleva dos carreras y tiene mucho costo.
texts.en:
Alicia F. is from the city of Caaguazú. She is 23 years old and in her fifth year studying Legal and Notary Sciences at Universidad del Norte in Caaguazú. Alicia has a 22 year old sister who graduated with a degree in Accounting from the same school. Her mother has a business renting out tables and chairs for social events, while her father works as a merchant.

Alicia currently works as a registrar at the courthouse, where she is gaining experience while earning an income to help pay for her studies. She is eager to finish her degree so that she can open her own law practice, grow professionally, and be recognized for her excellent work as a lawyer.

Alicia is requesting a loan to pay her monthly tuition. Since she is seeking to complete two degrees, the cost is quite expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her monthly tuition

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
José de 57 años, el es cerrajero (en la foto aparece ya terminadas unas rejas que el hizo),  vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona urbana, con una ecología en reconstrucción). 

Tiene un taller de cerrajería en la parte delantera de su casa, comenzó desde muy joven para poder mantener a su familia, pasado el tiempo obtuvo experiencia con la ayuda de su papa que le enseño. Ahora el trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. 

Para seguir con su taller de cerrajería el quiere comprar con el préstamo pinturas y metales, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y poder readecuar el taller.
texts.en:
José is a metalsmith. In the photograph, he is finishing a set of bars that he created. José lives in Primavera de Duran, an urban area that is undergoing revitalization.

He operates a metal shop in the front part of his house. José started this business as a young man so that he could support his family. He gained experience by learning the trade from his father. José works every day from 7am to 6pm.

To keep his metalsmith workshop in operation, he wants to use this loan to buy paints and metals. In the future, he wants to finish the construction of his house and remodel his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paints & metals

loans.name: Tatiana Yaoska

texts.es: Tatiana Yaoska G. R. tiene ya 8 años de tener en su casa una pulpería en la cual venda ropa y accesorios de uso personal, obviamente en sus inicios el negocio no le podía abarcar todo lo que tiene ahora y tampoco podía conseguir la cantidad de clientes que tiene, sin embargo la lucha por superarse y salir adelante es lo que ha convertido ese negocio en lo que es hoy. Entre sus principales metas está ver crecer mucho más lo que hoy llama su pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
Tatiana Yaoska G. R. has managed a store for eight years out her home, where she sells clothing and personal accessories. Obviously, at the beginning, she was not able to handle everything and neither did she have the number of customers like she does today. Nonetheless, she struggled to overcome these obstacles and has succeeded in making her business what it is today. Among her main goals are to grow what is now her little store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.en:
Rosa Elvira M. S. is 58 years old. She is married and lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. She has 5 children who are 36, 35, 34, 32, and 14 years old. 

Rosa is a member of the rural loan group called San Jacinto. The group consists of 15 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture. 

Rosa works in the agricultural sector and earns on average $130 per month. She buys and sells her products in the nearby town of Matilde. 

Rosa hopes to be able to produce more crops with the help of this loan. Her dreams are to keep improving and expanding in agricultural production and to provide her children with a good education. She says that there is a lot of competition among the farmers in her area, and she hopes that the credit helps her remain competative in the sale of her crops. 

In her free time, she likes to watch television and do domestic chores.

loans.use: to produce more crops

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia D. 47 años, es una madre D. familia muy jovial y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia en compañía D. su hijo que es universitario. Es profesora desD. hace 19 años, en un colegio particular cerca D. su localidad, pero con el fin D. tener más ingresos elabora trabajos didácticos ofreciendo algunos D. sus alumnos, siendo el costo retribuido en partes. Es así que se inicia en estos trabajos pedagógicos, en vista que sus alumnos requerían y compraban D. las librerías a costos mucho más elevados, desD. entonces le va muy bien, por lo se siente muy feliz. Además cuenta con el apoyo D. la directora del colegio y con las ganancias pueD. ayudar a cubrir la educación superior D. su hijo. Para el futuro piensa  diversificar y ampliar la distribución D. sus  trabajos didácticos. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas oportunamente, asimismo esta muy agradecida con las integrantes, por la invitación e integración a este grupo. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará cartulinas plastificadas, temperas, pegamentos, corrospum, así como también plumones D. diversos colores, para terminar los acabados D. sus materiales didácticos.
texts.en:
Siliva is 47 years old and a jovial hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her son who is attending university. Silvia has been a teacher for 19 years and works at a private school near her home. In order to earn extra income, she prepares educational materials and offers them to some of her students who pay for the cost in installments. She started creating these educational materials because her students had a need for them and were paying much higher prices at the bookstores. Since then, she has done very well and feels very happy. Silvia also has the support of her school principal and the income helps cover her son’s higher education. In the future, she wants to diversify and expand the distribution of her educational materials.

This is her first loan with MFP. Silvia promises to complete her loan payments promptly. She is grateful to the other members of her Communal Bank for inviting her to join the group. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy laminated poster boards, paints, adhesives, “corrospum” (a type of plastic used for crafts), and markers of different colors so that she can compete the finishing touches on her educational materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making educational materials

loans.name: Fabiola Margarita

texts.es: Fabiola Margarita Mejía López es una mujer empoderada de 40 años que desde hace 5 años ya elabora tortillas en su casa de habitación, sin embargo además de vender tortillas poco a poco fue introduciendo nuevos productos y ahora vende también elotes, tamales, frijoles cocidos y hasta artesanías que trae de sus viajes a Chinandega. Ella utilizará el crédito para la compra de productos y así hacer crecer más su negocio.
texts.en:
Fabiola Margarita Mejía López is an empowered woman who is 40 years of age. For the past five years, she has been preparing and selling tortillas out of her home. Little by little, she has been introducing new products and now sells corn on the cob, tamales, baked beans, and handicrafts that she brings back from her trips to Chinandega.

She will use this loan to buy more products to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Maurillo Marin

texts.en:
Maurillo Marin N. V. is 45 years old. He lives in common law marriage in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. He has 5 children, ages 17, 11, 9, 7, and 3. 

Maurillo is a member of the rural loan group San Jacinto. There are 15 members total, the majority of which work in the agricultural sector. 

Maurillo works in the agricultural sector. He earns on average $150 per month. He buys and sells his agricultural supplies and products in the nearby town of Matilde. Marillo plans to use the loan to build a house. His dream is to own a car and finish building the house. 

In his free time he likes to watch television and listen to music.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Ingrid Cinthya

texts.es:
Ingrid de 22 años, tiene una tienda de víveres, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, cuando murió el papa de Ingrid le heredo la tienda para que ella pueda solventar sus gastos, pero como era pequeño su mama la administraba hasta ahora que ella creído. 

Ella trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 23h00pm todos los días, vende arroz, bebidas, aceite, huevos etc. Ella quiere ampliar la tienda, para que los ingresos le ayuden a estudiar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, bloques y pintura para ampliar la tienda, en el futuro quiere tener un Minimarket y poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 22 years old and has a store where she sells provisions. She lives in the urban area of Suburbio de Guayaquil. When her father passed away, Ingrid inherited the store so that she would be able to cover her expenses. However, she was still young at the time, so her mother managed the business until she was old enough to run it herself.

Ingrid works every day from 6:30am to 11pm. She sells rice, beverages, oil, eggs, and other products. She wants to expand her store so that she can generate income to help pay for school.

With this loan she plans to buy cement, blocks, and paint so that she can expand her store. In the future, she wants to open a mini-market and continue her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, blocks, and paint so that she can expand her store

loans.name: Milagro Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Milagro del Socorro C. L. vende frutas en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Masaya, ella compra al por mayor distinta variedad de frutas en dependencia de la temporada (mango, limón, naranja, naranja agria, melocotón, etc.) y las vende al menudeo; tiene ya 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad económica y utilizará el crédito para la compra de aguacates y otras frutas.
texts.en:
Doña Milagro del Socorro C. L. sells fruit at the municipal market in the city of Masaya. She buys different varieties of fruit in bulk depending on the season (mangoes, lemons, oranges, bitter oranges, peaches, etc.) and sells them at retail.

Milagro has been in this business for ten years and will use this loan to buy avocados and other fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase avocados & other fruits

loans.name: Dina Marina

texts.es:
La señora Dina Marina R. G. desde hace 17 años se dedica a la venta de tacos y gorditas de harina que ella misma prepara. La parte de enfrente de su vivienda ya esta muy deteriorada a causa de la fuertes lluvias que habido en esta misma ciudad, lo cual es muy preocupante para ella ya que es su único patrimonio familiar. Dina solicita de su apoyo para reparar la pared y así vivir cómodamente sin ningún problema.
Su esposo es un hombre trabajador que tiene como profesión ser carpintero y herrero son como se ayudan para cubrir sus gastos.
texts.en:
Sra. Dina Marina R. G. has been selling tacos and flour gorditas that she prepares herself for the past 17 years.

The front part of her house was badly damaged by heavy rains that came through her city. She is extremely worried because this is her only family asset. Dina is requesting your assistance to repair the wall so that she can live comfortably without any problems.

Her husband is hardworking gentleman. He is a carpenter and blacksmith by trade and helps to cover their expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the wall in the front part of her house

loans.name: Armando Mesias

texts.en:
Armando Mesias A. C. is 42 years old. He is married and lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. He has one son named Luis who is 12 years old.

Armado is a member of the rural loan group called San Jacinto. There are a total of fifteen members in the group, the majority of whom work in the agricultural sector.

Armando also works in the agricultural sector and earns on average of $130 per month. He buys and sells his products in the nearby town of Matilde.

Armando plans to use the loan to grow cacao (used to make chocolate). He hopes to buy two plots of land. The climate this year has been hard on his crops. 

In his free time, Armando likes to play sports like volleyball and indoor soccer. His favorite community tradition is the fiesta of San Francisco, Ecuador.

loans.use: To grow cacao
